title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/05/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 06/05/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Paul Allen and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Wealth Manager: Chinese Investors Look to Diversify
content: Grant Pan, Noah Holdings CFO and ARK Hong Kong CEO, says wealthy Chinese investors have become more sophisticated. Pan says clients are now looking at markets such as Japan, Singapore and Europe to diversify. It's a change from high net worth individuals who were previously more focused on China and the US. He discusses this trend with Yvonne Man and Annabelle Droulers on "Bloomberg: The China Show." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Former Australian Prime Minister Turnbull on Chinese Ownership of Darwin Port
content: Former Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull discusses Chinese ownership of the Port of Darwin in an interview with Bloomberg Television. Turnbull says "our assessment at the time was that this wasn't a security issue," but adds that the shifting geopolitical landscape means "there's a discomfort about a Chinese company owning port facilities" in the country. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ECB to Cut Rates as Trade Mess Weighs on the Economy
content: The European Central Bank is set to lower interest rates for an eighth time as President Donald Trump’s jolts to global trade dim the prospects for inflation and the economy.

title: Oil Investments to Fall 6% on Lower Demand and Prices, IEA Says
content: Global oil investments are expected to drop 6% in 2025, in the first such decline in a decade excluding the year of the Covid slump, according to the International Energy Agency.

title: Neuberger Berman Raises $4 Billion for New Secondary Fund
content: Neuberger Berman has raised more than $4 billion for its latest general partner-led secondary fund despite a challenging environment for private capital fundraising.

title: This Might Be the ‘Biggest Year’ in Tech: Bosworth
content: Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth speaks at Bloomberg Tech San Francisco 2025 about why this year could be pivotal for the development of the metaverse, highlighting unique opportunities emerging for engineers across the tech industry. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Japan’s Bonds Back on Stage With Another Sale of Longer Debt
content: Japan’s sovereign debt is back in the spotlight as the government prepares for another sale of super-long-term bonds after dismal showings at recent auctions, as demand for the far-end of the curve sputters across the globe.

title: President Trump Signs Travel Ban for 12 Countries
content: President Donald Trump has signed a proclamation that bans individuals from 12 countries from entering the US. Bloomberg's John Harney reports on the latest from Washington. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meta CTO on What's Ahead in Artificial Intelligence / DAY 1
content: Andrew “Boz” Bosworth, Chief Technology Officer & Head of Reality Labs at Meta spoke about harnessing engineering talent and his leadership priorities at Meta, including what’s next for a hardware rollout in the AI era with Bloomberg’s Tom Giles at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Enterprise Products Says US Set to Deny Its China Ethane Export License
content: Enterprise Products Partners LP received a notice saying the US intends to deny licenses for three proposed cargoes of ethane heading to China as the Trump administration doubles down on security for exports to the country.

title: Glencore-Backed Cobalt Holdings Axes $230 Million London IPO
content: Cobalt Holdings Plc has decided not to proceed with its planned initial public offering in London.

title: Vietnam Sends Trade Demand Reply as US Turns Up China Heat
content: Vietnam said it is responding to US demands with “goodwill” and has sent a written reply to US trade requests after the Trump administration vowed to keep pressuring the Southeast Asian nation to reduce its role in China supply chains.

title: China Offers $1,400 Bounty for Arrests of Taiwan Cyberwarriors
content: China placed a bounty on cyberwarriors working for Taiwan’s Defense Ministry, extending its campaign to squeeze President Lai Ching-te.

title: Ex-Australia PM Says He Could Have Halted Port Lease to Chinese Firm
content: Former Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull said he could have halted the lease of the Port of Darwin to a Chinese company shortly after coming to power a decade ago — pulling the plug on a deal the US “never liked.”

title: Germany’s Got a Problem, and It’s More Than Donald Trump
content: As Donald Trump pushes ahead with his campaign to transform the way the world does business, Germany is uniquely vulnerable.

title: Elon Musk Urges Americans Take Action to ‘Kill’ Trump Tax Cut Bill
content: Elon Musk is on a mission to block President Donald Trump’s tax bill after he tried — and failed — to convince Republican lawmakers to preserve valuable tax credits for electric vehicles in the legislation, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Xi Tells Lukashenko China Will Hold Military Parade on Sept. 3
content: President Xi Jinping said China will hold a military parade to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II on Sept. 3, an event that’s expected to bring his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin to Beijing.

title: Trump Orders Inquiry Into Biden’s Health, Use of Autopen
content: President Donald Trump directed aides to investigate whether former President Joe Biden’s staff conspired to hide information about his health from the public and enacted any executive actions without his predecessor’s knowledge.

title: Trump Stymied in ‘Art of the Deal’ Approach to World’s Strongmen
content: President Donald Trump has long boasted about his ability to cut deals with the world’s strongmen. But now that he’s back in the White House, his charms haven’t worked on the leaders he professes to admire.

title: Trump Bars Foreign Students From Entering US to Attend Harvard
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive action that prevents foreign nationals from entering the US to study at Harvard University, accusing the school of failing to implement discipline on campus and fostering a dramatic rise in crime.

title: Kim Vows Full Backing for Putin as Ties With Russia Deepen
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un reiterated his pledge to unconditionally support Russian President Vladimir Putin, state media said, as the sanctions-defying alliance between the two countries raises security concerns in the region.

title: US to Keep Pressure on Vietnam Over China Imports, Lutnick Says
content: The Trump administration will keep up pressure on Vietnam as long as it keeps re-exporting a significant amount of Chinese products to the US, according to Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick.

title: The Rare-Earth Fight Imperiling US-China Trade Peace, Explained
content: Markets cheered in early May when the US and China agreed in Geneva to lower tariffs and other barriers. But after a few weeks, the shine started to come off that deal, with China accusing the US of violating it with new restrictions and the US saying China failed to honor promises on rare earths.

title: Hong Kong Bolsters Top Court With First Foreign Judge in a Year
content: Hong Kong has appointed a retired New Zealand judge to its top court, the first foreign justice named to the appellate body in over a year following record resignations that threatened to undermine confidence in the judicial system.

title: Senate GOP Plans to Boost CFPB Scrutiny, Cut Fed Employee Pay
content: The Senate Banking Committee is planning to eliminate all mandatory funding for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and restrict the pay of many Federal Reserve employees as part of the Senate’s big tax and spending bill, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Signs Travel Ban for 12 Countries Including Afghanistan
content: President Donald Trump signed a proclamation that bans individuals from 12 countries from entering the US, reinstating one of the most controversial measures from his first term after an attack in Colorado that targeted an event supporting Israeli hostages.

title: Trump Violated Rights of Deported Venezuelans, Judge Rules
content: A US judge ruled that the Trump administration violated the due-process rights of more than 100 Venezuelans deported to a notorious prison in El Salvador, and they must now get a chance to challenge their removal.

title: Trump Broadcasts Putin Vow to Respond to Ukraine Attacks
content: Donald Trump on Wednesday broadcast Vladimir Putin’s warning that he’ll retaliate against Ukraine for its recent stunning drone strikes deep inside Russian territory, the clearest signal yet that the US president’s peace efforts have stalled.

title: Trump, GOP Senators Discussed Cutting SALT Break in Tax Bill
content: Donald Trump and Republican senators discussed ways to scale back the $40,000 state and local tax deduction cap in the House version of the president’s tax-cut bill, Senate Majority Leader John Thune said.

title: Trump’s Late-Night Lament Over Xi Deepens Impasse in Trade Fight
content: President Donald Trump is positioning a personal discussion with his Chinese counterpart as the key to preventing the world’s largest economies from spiraling deeper into their trade and technology fight.

title: Trump Officials Target Columbia Accreditation Over Pro-Palestine Protests
content: The Education Department said Columbia University no longer appeared to meet accreditation standards after concluding that the school is in violation of anti-discrimination laws, the latest effort by the Trump administration to target elite schools over their handling of pro-Palestinian protests.

title: Lutnick Says Hurricane Center’s Fully Staffed Despite Key Vacancies
content: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told a congressional committee that the US National Hurricane Center was fully staffed even though key positions are going unfilled as hurricane season begins.

title: Why the Trade War Is Keeping US Inflation Down—For Now
content: On this week’s episode of Trumponomics, we discuss consumer pessimism and how legal challenges to Donald Trump’s tariffs might play out.

title: The CBO Has Good News and Bad News on Trump Tax Bill
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the Congressional Budget Office forecasts for the Republican tax and spending cut bill. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Trump Budget Plan Raises Concern Over Cuts to Statistics Bureau
content: The Trump administration is proposing to cut resources from the Bureau of Labor Statistics when the agency is already reeling from years of budget constraints, further compounding concerns about the quality and quantity of data produced about the US economy.

title: Three of US’s Top Steel Suppliers Are Seeking Breaks on Tariffs
content: The US’s top steel providers are racing to win exemptions from Donald Trump’s steel tariffs.

title: Netanyahu’s Government Shaky as Political Allies Eye Exit
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government faces the possibility of collapse and early elections after his ultra-Orthodox coalition partners on Wednesday threatened to bolt, according to Israeli media.

title: Walmart Fires Workers, Reviews Permits Over Immigration Ruling
content: Walmart Inc. is informing stores across the country to begin identifying workers whose work authorization may be expiring after the Supreme Court ruled that the Trump administration could revoke protections for hundreds of thousands of migrants.

title: Trump Gets a Tentative Win From CBO's New Tax and Tariff Estimates
content: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office handed Republicans a major political talking point Wednesday, with projections that showed the possibility for President Donald Trump’s tariffs to bring in more federal revenue than will be lost by his giant tax-cut plan.

title: Carney Holds Back on Tariff Retaliation, Says US-Canada Talks Are Progressing
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada and the US are in “intensive” talks about the countries’ trade relationship, explaining his government’s decision not to respond yet to the Trump administration’s doubling of steel and aluminum tariffs.

title: USDA to Review Reports Following Delay of Latest Trade Outlook
content: The US Department of Agriculture is undergoing a review of non-statutory reports including a quarterly forecast on trade that pointed to a record farming deficit.

title: Trump Travel Ban, Wise Plans UK-US Main Listing Shift, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 0:00

title: US foreign student ban will be to its detriment: ex-Australian PM
content:
The US’ ban of foreign students will be to its detriment amid a global race for talent, says former Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.

Donald Trump earlier signed a travel ban for 12 countries and barred international students from entering the US to attend. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: NATO Plans Massive Weapons Ramp-Up to Appease Trump
content: Welcome to the Brussels Edition, Bloomberg’s daily briefing on what matters most in the heart of the European Union.NATO’s defense ministers gather in Brussels today to formally sign off on a massive weapons ramp-up that should lead to a new alliance-wide defense spending target of 5% of GDP. They will also further discussions on how to keep US President Donald Trump as happy as possible at the alliance’s upcoming summit. Europeans have insisted that a so-called US backstop is essential to deter

title: The Smart India Investor Playbook for a Rocky 2025
content: Getting used to lower returns is one place to start

title: ECB Rate Decision Day: What to Expect
content: The European Central Bank is set to lower interest rates for an eighth time today. Analysts surveyed by Bloomberg expect the deposit rate to be cut by a quarter-point to 2%. Bloomberg’s Lizzy Burden reports.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Europe: Trump Signs Travel Ban (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 20:57

title: Germany’s Merz to Meet Trump in Washington
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz will travel to Washington for his inaugural meeting with US President Donald Trump on Thursday. With just weeks until Trump has threatened to implement sweeping 50% tariffs on all European goods, the timing of Merz’s trip is critical. Bloomberg’s Michael Nienaber reports.

title: White House Bans Travel From 12 Countries
content: Good morning. Donald Trump signs a travel ban to restrict entry to the US for some nations. The European Central Bank may cut rates today. And Nintendo’s Switch 2 goes on sale. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: Trump Signs Travel Ban, Musk Seeks to ‘Kill’ Tax Bill, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 0:00

title: German Manufacturing’s Problems Came Way Before Trump’s Tariffs
content:
German manufacturing was in decline long before Trump took aim at the country’s auto and steel industries with high tariffs.

Marilen Martin traveled to the port city of Duisburg, Germany’s industrial heartland, to understand the flagging economy’s effects on life and politics. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Dark Side of Data Needs Some Tariff Light
content: The US economy is showing signs of strain. But there are some caveats.

title: Hong Kong Is Becoming a Key Part of Xi’s Ambitions to Counter US
content: In this week’s Hong Kong Edition, we look at what the flurry of activity among Beijing officials in the city means, dive into New World’s woes and review Manchester United’s performance against a local side. We also interview one of the two teachers who created a 100-kilometer summer trail and check out a Michelin-starred Japanese restaurant.

title: Glencore-Backed Cobalt Holdings Axes $230 Million London IPO
content: Cobalt Holdings Plc has decided not to proceed with its planned initial public offering in London.

title: Google’s Pichai on the Fate of Search in a World of AI
content:
In a world of AI and personalized answers, will chatbots take over search?

Here’s what Google CEO Sundar Pichai had to say at the Bloomberg Tech Summit in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump signs executive action banning travel from 12 countries
content:
President Donald Trump has signed a proclamation that bans individuals from 12 countries from entering the US in the wake of an attack in Boulder, Colorado.

The second-term travel ban covers countries like Afghanistan, Haiti, Iran and Yemen. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Why Golden Visas Are Quietly Making a Comeback
content: On this week’s Australia Podcast: Host Rebecca Jones speaks to wealth editor Ainsley Thomson about why New Zealand is embracing golden visas — and wealthy expats.

title: Trump 'a Little Desperate' For Xi Call: Ashton
content: President Donald Trump is positioning a personal discussion with his Chinese counterpart as the key to preventing the world’s largest economies from spiraling deeper into their trade and technology fight. Ashton Analytics founder Anna Ashton speaks on The Asia Trade about the dynamics between the two superpowers. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Australia: Why Golden Visas Are Back (Podcast)

content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:02

title: President Trump Holds Meeting With GOP Senators | Balance of Power: Late Edition 6/04/25
content: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Senator Peter Welch (D) Vermont talks about the Congressional Budget Office projecting President Trump's tariffs will cut the budget gap by $2.8 trillion. Retired General Ben Hodges, former Commanding General for US Army Europe, shares his thoughts on President Trump speaking with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Senator Roger Marshall (R) Kansas talks about the meeting he had in the White House with President Trump and other members of the Senate Finance Committee where they spoke about the tax bill. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Source: Bloomberg, 20:57

title: Trump Violated Rights of Deported Venezuelans, Judge Rules
content: A US judge ruled that the Trump administration violated the due-process rights of more than 100 Venezuelans deported to a notorious prison in El Salvador, and they must now get a chance to challenge their removal.

title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily: Tillamook Milestone (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 8:09

title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 Lures Fans to Biggest Gadget Launch in Years
content: Nintendo Co. fans from Tokyo to Manhattan stood in line for hours to be among the first to get a Switch 2, fueling one of the biggest global gadget debuts since the iPhone launches of yesteryear.

title: Alphabet CEO Expects to Keep Hiring Engineers as AI Advances
content: Alphabet Inc.’s Sundar Pichai said his company will keep expanding its engineering ranks at least into 2026, stressing human talent remains key even as Google’s parent ramps up AI investments.

title: Meta’s Push Into Defense Tech Reflects Cultural Shift, CTO Says
content: Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth said that the “tides have turned” in Silicon Valley and made it more palatable for the tech industry to support the US military’s efforts.

title: 23andMe’s DNA Data Gets Boosted $305 Million Bid in New Auction
content: Bankrupt genetic analysis company 23andMe will hold a second auction for its cache of DNA data with an opening bid of $305 million from group lead by the company’s former chief executive officer, Anne Wojcicki.

title: IBM Said to Have Pursued Informatica Ahead of Salesforce Deal
content: International Business Machines Corp. pursued Informatica Inc. before Salesforce Inc. bought the software company for $8 billion last month, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Elon Musk’s AI Startup Set to Get Debt Backing From TPG
content: TPG Angelo Gordon is an anchor investor in a debt package for Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup, xAI Corp., according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Uber, DoorDash Settle Delivery Fee Cap Dispute With New York
content: DoorDash Inc., Grubhub Inc. and Uber Technologies Inc.’s Uber Eats are settling a 2021 lawsuit against New York City over a cap on fees the meal-delivery services can charge restaurants.

title: Nvidia Director Discloses Proposal to Sell $550 Million Position
content: Billionaire Nvidia Corp. director Mark Stevens unloaded more than 1 million shares of the chipmaker this week as the stock rebounds from a slow start to the year.

title: Japanese Space-Debris Firm Loses Half Its Value a Year After IPO
content: When Astroscale Holdings Inc. began trading in Tokyo a year ago, excitement over the Japanese space-debris pioneer was riding so high that the stock surged 62%, making it a billion-dollar company.

title: Deliveroo Launches Drone Food Delivery Service in Dublin
content: Deliveroo has launched an autonomous drone food delivery service in Dublin in partnership with Irish firm Manna Drones Inc.

title: Xiaohongshu Valuation Hits $26 Billion in Boost for Backer GSR
content: Xiaohongshu’s valuation surged to $26 billion in recent market transactions via a major fund, an unusually fast ascent that underscores how the Chinese social media phenom is making headway against TikTok in the US.

title: Apple Loses Bid to Pause Court Order on App Store Changes
content: Apple Inc. lost its request to pause a court order requiring it to let App Store developers steer users to the web to purchase in-app items without paying a commission.

title: Best Buy, GameStop Expect Rapid Sellout of Switch 2 Consoles
content: Best Buy Co. expects to sell out its allotment of Nintendo Co.’s new Switch 2 game consoles shortly after they become available for purchase at midnight.

title: Tesla FSD's Role in Crash, GlobalFoundries Ups US Spend | Bloomberg Technology 6/4/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss footage and details from late 2023 when a Tesla using what the company calls Full Self-Driving (FSD) was in a fatal crash. Plus, GlobalFoundries CEO Tim Breen talks about his company’s plans to spend $16 billion to boost chip production in New York and Vermont. And HPE CEO Antonio Neri explains why the company has reduced how much it expects tariffs to impact earnings. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Chinese Hacked US Telecom a Year Before Known Wireless Breaches
content: Corporate investigators found evidence that Chinese hackers broke into an American telecommunications company in the summer of 2023, indicating the country’s attackers penetrated the US communications system earlier than publicly known.

title: Planet Labs CEO Says Europe Demand Beating Outset of Ukraine War
content: Earth imaging company Planet Labs PBC’s profit beat expectations as Europe hikes defense spending in response to the United States pulling back from the continent.

title: Reddit Sues Anthropic, Says AI Company Exploited User Data
content: Reddit Inc. sued artificial intelligence firm Anthropic, saying it has used the social media company’s content without permission to train its AI models.

title: FCC Departures Gut Panel With Big Merger, Investigation Pending
content: Two members of the Federal Communications Commission announced they’ll depart this week, leaving the agency with three vacancies while it reviews a major media merger and investigates a wireless provider.

title: Cyber Investigators Examine Video of Alleged Hackers on a Jet
content: Marco Rubio, US secretary of state, during a Senate Appropriations Subcommittee on State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, May 20, 2025. The hearing is reviewing the fiscal year 2026 budget request for the US Department of State. Photographer: Nathan Howard/Bloomberg

title: CrowdStrike Says DOJ, SEC Sent Inquiries on Firm Accounting
content: CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. said US officials have asked for information related to the accounting of deals it’s made with some customers and said the cybersecurity firm is cooperating with the inquiry.

title: US Is Reworking Subsidy Awards to Chipmakers, Lutnick Says
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the Trump administration has been reworking agreements forged with semiconductor makers under the 2022 Chips Act to secure what he called better terms aimed at generating additional domestic investment.

title: Italy to Strengthen STMicro, Not Tear It Apart, Minister Says
content: Italy intends to strengthen embattled semiconductor company STMicroelectronics NV, a joint venture with France, Industry Minister Adolfo Urso said.

title: Organized Crime Phishing Took £47 Million From UK Coffers
content: Organized crime has extracted £47 million ($64 million) from the UK government in a phishing operation, His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs officials said Wednesday.The operation, which took place last year, involved mimicking taxpayer credentials and claiming payments from HMRC, Angela MacDonald, second permanent secretary and deputy chief executive, told Parliament’s Treasury Committee. The incident wasn’t a cyberattack and no data from taxpayers was taken, she said.

title: AI-Power Demand Leads Brokerage Snapper to Hire Team
content: Commodity brokerage Snapper Creek Energy has built a power team focused on rising volatility in electricity markets as artificial intelligence and extreme weather upend grids.

title: Samsung’s Galaxy S25 Edge Shows the Limits of Impressively Thin Phones
content: Review: The handset, one of several slim devices coming this year, skimps on battery life for the sake of a light design.

title: CrowdStrike Shares Drop After Sales Forecast Underwhelms
content: Shares of CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. fell after the cybersecurity company projected revenue for the current period that trailed estimates, in its first financial update since announcing it would cut about 5% of its global workforce.

title: Microsoft’s LinkedIn Chief to Run Office Group in AI Shakeup
content: The chief of Microsoft Corp.’s LinkedIn is taking charge of the teams that build email and productivity apps, in a reorganization that consolidates more of the company’s workplace software as it seeks to speed up deployment of artificial intelligence tools.

title: Pornhub Suspends Site in France to Protest Age Verification Law
content: The parent company of Pornhub, Youporn and RedTube blocked access to its adult content in France to protest new age verification requirements in the country.

title: Google Warns Hackers Stealing Salesforce Data From Companies
content: A hacking group has been impersonating IT personnel to break into companies’ Salesforce tools, using the access for data theft and extortion, according to a new report from Google’s threat intelligence group.

title: Spain Makes First Payment in Lengthy Renewable Energy Fight
content: The Spanish government made its first payment as a result of an arbitration decision in 2021 around the country’s move to change investor incentives tied to renewable energy projects, following a number of lengthy legal battles between Spain and various creditors.

title: Data Error Pushed Up UK Inflation in April, Stats Office Says
content: Britain’s statistics office has said April’s inflation number was 0.1 percentage point higher than it should have been due to an error in data provided by the Department for Transport.

title: Sweden’s Core Inflation Slowdown Backs June Rate Cut
content: Sweden’s underlying inflation rate fell to a five-month low, broadly in line with expectations and strengthening the case for the Riksbank to reduce interest rates later this month.

title: Vietnam Sends Trade Demand Reply as US Turns Up China Heat
content: Vietnam said it is responding to US demands with “goodwill” and has sent a written reply to US trade requests after the Trump administration vowed to keep pressuring the Southeast Asian nation to reduce its role in China supply chains.

title: German Factory Orders Rose Even After US Tariff Announcement
content: German factory orders kept rising after President Donald Trump’s announcement of US reciprocal tariffs, defying expectations for a setback.

title: China’s Services Activity Picked Up After Truce in Trade War
content: China’s services activity expanded at a faster pace in May, a private survey showed, in a sign the consumer economy is stabilizing while higher US tariffs threaten demand for exports.

title: Germany’s Got a Problem, and It’s More Than Donald Trump
content: As Donald Trump pushes ahead with his campaign to transform the way the world does business, Germany is uniquely vulnerable.

title: ECB to Cut Rates as Trade Mess Weighs on the Economy
content: The European Central Bank is set to lower interest rates for an eighth time as President Donald Trump’s jolts to global trade dim the prospects for inflation and the economy.

title: US Business Optimism Slumps in ‘Clear Pivot’ From Trump Election
content: US business optimism has moved sharply lower, deepening a trend seen in the first quarter and marking a sharp reversal from the buoyant mood among executives after Donald Trump’s reelection as president.

title: Why Trump Has Doubled Down on Steel and Aluminum Tariffs
content: President Donald Trump raised levies on US imports of steel and aluminum to 50% from 25% as he ratcheted up his campaign to reshape the country’s trade ties with the rest of the world.

title: Trump Stymied in ‘Art of the Deal’ Approach to World’s Strongmen
content: President Donald Trump has long boasted about his ability to cut deals with the world’s strongmen. But now that he’s back in the White House, his charms haven’t worked on the leaders he professes to admire.

title: RBI Set to Deliver Third Straight Rate Cut to Lift Growth: Guide
content: India’s central bank will likely cut interest rates for the third straight meeting to boost growth, with market watchers focused on the extent of easing in this cycle.

title: Australia’s Spending Stays Soft as Consumers Wait for Sales
content: Australia’s household spending remained tepid in April as consumers directed their spare cash to services like eating out rather than goods such as clothing and cars.

title: Japan to Seek Tariff Review in Latest Negotiations Ahead of G-7
content: Japan will stick to its stance of seeking a review of all US tariffs in what could be the final ministerial-level talks ahead of a leaders’ summit this month, the nation’s top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said.

title: The Rare-Earth Fight Imperiling US-China Trade Peace, Explained
content: Markets cheered in early May when the US and China agreed in Geneva to lower tariffs and other barriers. But after a few weeks, the shine started to come off that deal, with China accusing the US of violating it with new restrictions and the US saying China failed to honor promises on rare earths.

title: Why Golden Visas Are Quietly Making a Comeback
content: On this week’s Australia Podcast: Host Rebecca Jones speaks to wealth editor Ainsley Thomson about why New Zealand is embracing golden visas — and wealthy expats.

title: Japan’s Base Pay Grows Faster, Backing BOJ Rate Hike Case
content: Growth in Japanese workers’ base pay picked up as annual wage hikes began to kick in, in a positive development for the Bank of Japan as authorities look for an opportunity to raise interest rates even as domestic and global economic risks mount.

title: China’s Power Prices Nosedive in Relief to Tariff-Hit Factories
content: A crash in Chinese coal prices, and a flood of clean energy, are cutting power rates in major industrial hubs, easing pressure on some of the factories caught in the crossfire of trade hostilities with the US.

title: Kashkari Says Fed Well Positioned to Wait for Tariff Impact
content: Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said the US central bank is well positioned to wait and see how tariff policies impact the economy before adjusting interest rates.

title: UK Home Sales Hit Three-Year High, Defying Slowdown Fears
content: Britain’s property market saw its busiest month in over three years in May, defying expectations for a slowdown after a tax break for buyers expired.

title: Bowman Confirmed by Senate to be Fed Vice Chair for Supervision
content: Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman was confirmed by the US Senate on Wednesday to serve as the central bank’s vice chair for supervision, further signaling a shift to lighter regulation under President Donald Trump.

title: Why the Trade War Is Keeping US Inflation Down—For Now
content: On this week’s episode of Trumponomics, we discuss consumer pessimism and how legal challenges to Donald Trump’s tariffs might play out.

title: Trump Budget Plan Raises Concern Over Cuts to Statistics Bureau
content: The Trump administration is proposing to cut resources from the Bureau of Labor Statistics when the agency is already reeling from years of budget constraints, further compounding concerns about the quality and quantity of data produced about the US economy.

title: Trump Gets a Tentative Win From CBO's New Tax and Tariff Estimates
content: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office handed Republicans a major political talking point Wednesday, with projections that showed the possibility for President Donald Trump’s tariffs to bring in more federal revenue than will be lost by his giant tax-cut plan.

title: Carney Holds Back on Tariff Retaliation, Says US-Canada Talks Are Progressing
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada and the US are in “intensive” talks about the countries’ trade relationship, explaining his government’s decision not to respond yet to the Trump administration’s doubling of steel and aluminum tariffs.

title: US Economic Activity Ebbs, Prices Rise in Fed’s Beige Book
content: Economic activity declined slightly in the US in recent weeks, indicating tariffs and elevated uncertainty are rippling across the economy, the Federal Reserve said in its Beige Book survey of regional business contacts.

title: The TACO Trade Will Explode in July
content: Donald Trump has proven to be a lot more malleable than many in the financial world initially anticipated. Equity markets have adapted well, and now trade on the theme that Trump always chickens out (or TACO for short). That helped the S&P 500 gain 7% last month. But will this last? And will Trump capitulate again when the 90-day reciprocal tariff deadline comes?

title: Republican Tax Bill Adds $2.4 Trillion to US Deficits, CBO Says
content: The House-passed version of President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill would add $2.42 trillion to US budget deficits over the next decade, according to a new estimate from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.

title: Weak US Services Activity, ADP Hiring Signal Some Tariff Strain
content: Activity at US service providers unexpectedly contracted last month for the first time in nearly a year and companies throttled back hiring, indicating the grip on the economy from higher tariffs is getting tighter.

title: CBO Projects Trump Tariffs to Cut Budget Gap by $2.8 Trillion
content: President Donald Trump’s tariff policies in effect as of mid-May would help to shrink US fiscal deficits by an estimated $2.8 trillion, according to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.

title: Fintech Wise Plans to Shift Main Listing From London to US
content: Wise Plc is planning to list its shares in the US, the latest blow to London’s stock market.

title: China’s Global Income Tax Crackdown Expands Beyond Ultra Rich
content: China is intensifying efforts to collect taxes on citizens’ overseas income, expanding its scrutiny to less wealthy individuals after targeting the ultra-rich last year, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Job of Last Resort Puts Further Strain on Malaysia’s Palm Sector
content: Malaysia’s palm oil industry is grappling with a dwindling labor pool as workers increasingly shun physically demanding jobs at plantations, a trend that threatens to exacerbate production woes in the major grower.

title: Citi to Cut 3,500 Tech Jobs in China as Part of Global Revamp
content: Citigroup Inc. will cut its technology employee workforce in China by about 3,500 as part of its global simplification efforts, while reiterating its commitment to the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Ram Brings Back Hemi V8 Engine in Bid to Reclaim Lost Sales
content: Ram is putting the Hemi V8 engine back in its light-duty pickup trucks, part of a blitz of changes from brand head Tim Kuniskis to claw back lost share in the hyper-competitive US truck market.

title: Even ‘White Lotus’ Buzz Isn’t Reviving Thailand’s Tourism Slump
content: Thailand’s tourism outlook in such doldrums that even the so-called The White Lotus effect — a temporary boost in Western visitors inspired by the latest Koh Samui—set season of HBO’s hit show — hasn’t been enough to offset a slump in arrivals from neighboring countries.

title: Enterprise Products Says US Set to Deny Its China Ethane Export License
content: Enterprise Products Partners LP received a notice saying the US intends to deny licenses for three proposed cargoes of ethane heading to China as the Trump administration doubles down on security for exports to the country.

title: Citi Taps McLean as Australia ECM Head After Jahrling Exits
content: Citigroup Inc. appointed John McLean as its new head of equity capital markets for Australia and New Zealand, replacing Rob Jahrling, who is leaving the bank.

title: China’s Power Prices Nosedive in Relief to Tariff-Hit Factories
content: A crash in Chinese coal prices, and a flood of clean energy, are cutting power rates in major industrial hubs, easing pressure on some of the factories caught in the crossfire of trade hostilities with the US.

title: Mangione Wrote United Health Executive ‘Had It Coming,’ DA Says
content: Manhattan prosecutors said that when Luigi Mangione was arrested on a murder charge last year he was carrying a diary that referenced “Unabomber” Ted Kaczynski and claimed UnitedHealth Group Inc. executive Brian Thompson “had it coming.”

title: ADHD Feels Like It’s Everywhere? Researchers See No Upswell
content: ADHD may seem like it’s everywhere at the moment, but researchers found its prevalence hasn’t changed much in recent years.

title: Trump’s Pick for Fed’s Top Regulator Expected to Be Friendly to Wall Street
content: Bowman approved as Federal Reserve’s vice chair for supervision

title: Judge Blocks Deportation of Colorado Attack Suspect’s Family
content: A US judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deporting the wife and children of a man charged with fire-bombing 12 people at a Colorado event in support of Israeli hostages.

title: Itochu to Support Pharma Firms Entering Japan to Fill Drug Needs
content: Two Itochu Corp. units are expanding into the business of luring more foreign drug companies to Japan, in a bid to help them develop innovative therapies for the local market that are already available overseas.

title: Former Trump NASA Nominee Suggests Ties to Musk Caused His Ouster
content: Financial technology billionaire Jared Isaacman appeared to suggest President Donald Trump withdrew his nomination to run NASA due to his close ties to Elon Musk amid the SpaceX chief executive officer’s falling out in Washington.

title: Walmart Pledges Transparency on Prices After Drawing Trump’s Ire
content: Walmart Inc. said it will continue to communicate the impact of tariffs with investors, consumers and policymakers after President Donald Trump criticized the retailer’s plans to raise prices.

title: Ship Carrying EVs Abandoned in Pacific After Catching Fire
content: A ship carrying about 3,000 cars to Mexico was abandoned in the middle of the Pacific Ocean after catching fire Tuesday, highlighting a growing risk to the transportation of electric vehicles.

title: China’s First Foreign-Owned Hospital Seeks More Medical Tourists
content: A Singapore hospital operator wants more international patients to seek treatment at its new medical center in China, as foreign healthcare providers eye medical tourism as a new growth area in the world’s second-largest economy.

title: FDA to Meet Drug Approval Goals Despite Cuts, Commissioner Says
content: The US Food and Drug Administration will meet its drug approval targets this year despite cutting thousands of staff, the agency’s commissioner said.

title: Starbucks Reshuffles Leadership to Accelerate Turnaround Bid
content: Starbucks Corp. is reorganizing part of its senior ranks, looking to speed up plans to reverse a sales slump.

title: Mercedes, BMW Step Up Response to China Export Curbs to Avoid Shortages
content: Automakers in the US and Europe raised concerns about China’s export controls on rare earth metals, as Beijing’s move threatens to disrupt global car production.

title: Walmart Fires Workers, Reviews Permits Over Immigration Ruling
content: Walmart Inc. is informing stores across the country to begin identifying workers whose work authorization may be expiring after the Supreme Court ruled that the Trump administration could revoke protections for hundreds of thousands of migrants.

title: Santander Names Preto as New Accounting Head Amid Broedel Saga
content: Banco Santander SA has nominated Manuel Preto to become its new chief accounting officer, dropping plans to appoint former Itau Unibanco Holding SA Chief Financial Officer Alexsandro Broedel Lopes who has been accused of fraud by his former employer.

title: Jefferies Hires Lazard’s Thomas for Activism Defense
content: Jefferies Financial Group Inc. has hired Rich Thomas from Lazard Inc. to lead its activism defense practice globally, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Aditya Birla to Buy Cargill Chemicals Plant in Georgia
content: Indian conglomerate Aditya Birla Group has agreed to acquire a manufacturing facility from Cargill Inc., its first entry in the US chemicals market.

title: Klarna Saved $2 Million After Cutting Ties With Salesforce
content: Klarna Group Plc Chief Executive Officer Sebastian Siemiatkowski said his company saved around $2 million after it severed ties with Salesforce Inc. in favor of data tools it built using artificial intelligence.

title: Wall Street Pushes UK to Change Bonus Rules for 2025 Payouts
content: Some of the world’s biggest banks are pushing UK regulators to accelerate plans to ease rules around deferred bonuses so the new regime can be applied to payouts for 2025, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Freed From Scandal, Wells Fargo Sets Its Sights on Growth
content: Charlie Scharf can finally play offense.

title: Wacker Neuson’s Main Shareholders Are Said to Explore Sale
content: Wacker Neuson SE’s major shareholders are considering a sale of the German construction equipment maker, people with knowledge of the matter said.

title: Spar Sees Muted Store Growth as South African Economy Stalls
content: Spar Group Ltd. expects muted store growth in the next year as South Africa’s second-largest grocer by revenue seeks to focus on restructuring the property portfolio in its home market as it also prepares to sell its Swiss and UK businesses.

content: Indian stocks rose and bond markets whipsawed after the central bank unexpectedly delivered a deeper-than-expected rate cut and injected more cash, while simultaneously signaling a higher bar for future easing.

title: German Industrial Production and Exports Declined in April
content: German industrial production and exports sank in April, dashing hopes of a cyclical recovery of the country’s critical sector amid looming US trade tariff threats.

title: FTSE 100 on Best Weekly Winning Streak Since January
Swiss Arms Chief Seeks Closer European Ties for Defense Race
content: Switzerland’s most senior arms procurement official is seeking closer collaboration with European neighbors, as global demand for weapons surges and the nation’s own defense industry falters.

title: ECB’s Muller Sees Cuts Near End as Villeroy Hails ‘Victory’
content: The European Central Bank is approaching the end of its interest-rate cuts, according to Governing Council member Madis Muller, as another colleague declared that inflation has been vanquished.

title: Hungary’s Retail Sales Rebound Counters Industry Output Decline
content: Hungary’s retail sales surged at the start of the second quarter, making shoppers Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s bet to avoid another recession less than a year before elections.

title: Taiwan Money-Market Rate Slump May Delay Central Bank Easing
content: A surge in the Taiwanese dollar last month spurred an influx of funds, driving local money-market rates to the lowest level in more than a year and potentially delaying monetary easing by the central bank.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/6/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hong Kong’s New Platform for $166 Billion Pension Faces Glitches
content: Some Hong Kong pensioners migrating to a new electronic system for retirement savings have experienced glitches, raising concerns over the platform’s reliability as it enters a key phase of adding more users.

title: Binance Official Who Was Detained in Nigeria Leaves Crypto Exchange
content: Binance Holdings Ltd.’s head of financial crime compliance, Tigran Gambaryan, who was detained last year in Nigeria for about eight months, is leaving the world’s largest crypto exchange.

title: Temasek Chairman to Step Down After 12 Years, Teo to Succeed
content: Temasek Holdings Pte Chairman Lim Boon Heng is stepping down and will be succeeded by Teo Chee Hean, marking a significant shift in leadership at the Singapore state investor.

title: SNB Denies FX Manipulation After US Treasury Puts Swiss on List
content: The Swiss National Bank denied being a currency manipulator after the US Treasury added Switzerland to a list of economies it is closely monitoring over foreign-exchange practices.

title: Nomura's Nanavati on Dealmaking in Asia
content: Nomura Head of Investment Banking for Asia ex-Japan, Jwalant Nanavati, says he sees opportunities in South Korea stemming from areas such as AI and technology, along with the reorganization of chaebols. He spoke with Bloomberg Insight anchor Haslinda Amin from the Nomura Investment Forum Asia in Singapore. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Pressure Mounts for Japan to Adjust Bond Sales as Soon as July
content: Expectations in the market are intensifying that the Japanese government may adjust debt issuance as soon as next month by increasing sales of shorter maturity securities and trimming offerings of longer-dated ones.

title: Stocks, Futures Fluctuate Ahead of US Jobs Data: Markets Wrap
content: Equities traded in a tight range as investors searched for a clear direction after talks between President Donald Trump and Xi Jinping failed to lift sentiment and investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of the US jobs data.

title: Gold’s Cheaper Precious Metal Peers Surge to Multi-Year Highs
content: Silver extended gains to trade at a 13-year peak, while platinum hit highest level in more than two years, signaling growing investor appetite for precious metals used by the industrial sector.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/06/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Annabelle Droulers and Avril Hong give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 6/6/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hello Kitty Stock Overtakes Auto Giant Toyota in Turnover
content: Hello Kitty owner Sanrio Co. surpassed Japan’s biggest company Toyota Motor Corp. in stock turnover last month on the firm’s inclusion to the MSCI index and its perceived resilience to tariff risks.

title: Korean Stocks See Biggest Weekly Inflow in 15 Months on Election
content: Foreign inflows into South Korean stocks this week hit the highest since March 2024, despite a shortened trading week, as Tuesday’s presidential election ushered in an end to a months-long political leadership vacuum.

title: Carney, Li Hold Talks on Fentanyl, Trade in Sign of Warming Ties
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney spoke with Chinese Premier Li Qiang on Thursday in a sign that the tense relationship between the two nations might be improving.

title: Oil Holds Gains After Trump-Xi Call Signals Easing Trade Tension
content: Oil was steady after advancing Thursday on optimism around easing trade tensions between the US and China following a call between the leaders of the two countries.

title: Bajaj Finserv Founders Seek $679 Million From Share Sale
content: Bajaj Holdings and Investment Ltd. and Jamnalal Sons Pvt., part of the founder group of Bajaj Finserv Ltd., plan to raise as much as $679 million collectively via a sale of shares in the financial unit of one of India’s oldest conglomerates, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News.

title: Indian Bonds Erase Gains on RBI’s Stance Change to Neutral
content: Indian bonds erased gains after the central bank unexpectedly changed its policy stance to neutral even as it reduced the benchmark rate by a bigger-than-expected half a percentage point.

title: Starmer's Stock-Market Apathy Is Bad for Growth
content: It’s been another bad week for London’s status as a listing venue. A shame, then, that recent government policy has focused on private markets investing.

title: Burning Trees for Electricity Isn't Sustainable
content: Continued support for Drax Group will only make sense if the UK government can detail a better vision — and execute it.

title: Portugal Considers Sweetening Incentives for Golden Visa Program
content: Less than two months after Spain scrapped its golden visa due to concerns about its effect on the housing market, Portugal is considering whether to sweeten its golden visa program and make a special tax regime for expatriates even more attractive.

title: Winners of Defense Stock Frenzy in Europe, From Chemical to Goggle Makers
content: This year’s surge in Europe’s biggest defense stocks has elicited some obvious winners, leading investors to dig deeper beneath the surface for other names that might stand to benefit from the billions being diverted toward military budgets.

title: H&M Billionaire Quietly Moves Retailer Toward Private Ownership
content: Hennes & Mauritz AB, the fast-fashion retailer that’s been listed on the Swedish stock market since 1974, is steadily moving back toward private ownership.

title: Morgan Stanley Opens xAI Books With Musk in Trump Crosshairs
content: Even before Elon Musk and President Donald Trump’s public falling out, selling debt for the tech mogul’s companies has always been tricky for Morgan Stanley. But xAI Corp. was supposed to be different.

title: Dassault Partners With Tata to Make Jet Fighter Frames in India
content: Tata Advanced Systems will manufacture airframes of Rafale fighter jets for French defense manufacturing giant Dassault Aviation SA in a move aimed at strengthening India’s domestic aerospace industry.

title: Turkey Said to Supply Somalia’s Military With Combat Helicopters
content: Turkey will supply Somalia’s navy with T129 Atak helicopters following the signing of a defense pact between the two nations earlier this year, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: SNB Denies FX Manipulation After US Treasury Puts Swiss on List
content: The Swiss National Bank denied being a currency manipulator after the US Treasury added Switzerland to a list of economies it is closely monitoring over foreign-exchange practices.

title: Russia Attacks Kyiv with Drones and Missiles, Killing Four
content: Russian drone and missile attacks killed at least four people in Kyiv and wounded more than a dozen others, in a strike that comes after President Vladimir Putin pledged reprisals for a Ukrainian drone attack on Russian air bases.

title: Pakistan Says India’s Actions Boost Nuclear Risk in Future
content: A senior Pakistani official said India has lowered the threshold for future military action between the two arch-rivals, adding that India’s use of a nuclear-capable missile during the latest conflict has made the situation more precarious.

title: Musk Signals He’s Open to Cooling Off Period in Trump Feud
content: Elon Musk signaled he would move to cool tensions with US President Donald Trump, after differences between the two exploded Thursday into an all-out public feud.

title: Labour Surprises in Scotland With Win Over Farage, Nationalists
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s Labour Party won a Scottish parliamentary by-election, a surprise result that deals a blow to both the Scottish nationalists and Nigel Farage’s Reform UK party.

title: Trump Tariffs Get Personal for the Harris Tweed Makers of the Hebrides
content: Few believe the US president will lift tariffs to help the island that was the birthplace of his mother.

title: Portugal Considers Sweetening Incentives for Golden Visa Program
content: Less than two months after Spain scrapped its golden visa due to concerns about its effect on the housing market, Portugal is considering whether to sweeten its golden visa program and make a special tax regime for expatriates even more attractive.

title: Australian PM Floats Potential US Beef Import Deal for Trump
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has signaled scope for a potential deal on US beef imports to his nation as part of tariff negotiations with President Donald Trump.

title: The Trump-Elon Feud Timeline: Best Buddies Broadcast Their Breakup
content: The rift started after Musk expressed opposition to Trump’s tax bill, quickly took flight online and sent Tesla shares tumbling.

title: Elon Musk’s Feud With Trump Spurs One of His Worst Wealth Losses Ever
content: Minute by minute, post by post, Elon Musk’s very public, extremely online feud with President Donald Trump sliced into his vaunted status as the world’s richest person.

title: US Steel Deal Seen Closing by Merger Deadline on Trump Pivot
content: Nippon Steel Corp. and United States Steel Corp. are on pace to finalize their $14.1 billion combination with President Donald Trump’s administration before a deal deadline later this month, capping an 18-month saga to combine the steelmakers into the world’s second-largest producer.

title: Harvard Sues Over Trump Barring Foreign Students’ US Entry
content: Harvard University sued to stop the Trump administration from barring its international students’ entrance to the US, adding to a high-stakes legal battle between the government and the school.

title: UK Response to Aid Abused Migrant Carers Failing Most, Data Show
content: A major government initiative to match exploited migrant care workers in the UK with new employers has helped less than 4% find new roles, according to a Freedom of Information request, casting further doubt on the government’s efforts to cut migration in the social care sector.

title: Trump Said to Be Open to Lowering SALT Cap in GOP Tax Bill
content: President Donald Trump told Senate Republicans he is open to a state and local tax deduction cap lower than the $40,000 in the House-passed version of his giant tax bill, a person familiar with the matter said.

title: Democrats Unveil Bill Responding to Midair Collision Near DC
content: Senate Democrats introduced legislation Thursday they said would boost aviation safety following a deadly midair collision near Washington earlier this year.

title: US Imposes Sanctions on Four ICC Judges Over ‘Abuse of Power’
content: The Trump administration announced sanctions on four judges of the International Criminal Court for alleged “transgressions” against the US and Israel, escalating pressure on what the US labels a highly politicized institution.

title: UK Bans Six Water Companies From Paying Bonuses to Bosses
content: The UK has banned six water companies from paying bonuses to senior executives to try to force companies to do more to tackle pollution.

title: China’s Power Play In the Indian Ocean
content: India and China are vying for control of strategic islands and chokepoints in the Indian Ocean. With shifting US policy, the battle for influence is intensifying, shaping regional and global power. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: How Trump Is Going After International Students
content: President Donald Trump’s broad crackdown on immigration is spreading confusion and fear among the more than one million international students who attend US universities.

title: Trump’s Statecraft Tunes in Xi, Turns on Musk
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Ramsey Al-Rikabi looks at Donald Trump’s brand of personal statecraft. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: US Refrains From Using Currency Manipulator Tag, Blasts China
content: In the first formal assessment of US trading partners’ foreign-exchange practices since President Donald Trump returned to office, the Treasury Department declined to name any country a currency manipulator while singling China out for “its lack of transparency.”

title: What to Know About Trump’s New Travel Ban
content: US President Donald Trump ordered a travel ban on June 4 barring citizens of 12 countries, mostly in the Middle East and Africa, from entering the US.

title: Trump-Musk Alliance Unravels Over ‘Big Beautiful Bill’
content: From the moment Donald Trump and Elon Musk joined forces, betting in Washington held that the president’s bond with the First Buddy who bankrolled his comeback election win wouldn’t last.

title: Senate to Keep Spectrum Sales in Tax Bill, Key Republican Says
content: A key Republican said senators have reached an agreement to reauthorize spectrum sales to internet companies that would generate billions of dollars in revenue toward funding US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax cuts and spending bill.

title: Germany’s Merz Lets Trump Do the Talking and Survives Oval Office Meeting
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz successfully navigated a 40-minute meeting with Donald Trump in the Oval Office without falling victim to the public humiliation the American president has doled out to other leaders — even though both Germany and Europe are two of Trump’s perpetual irritants.

title: Portugal Says It May Reach 2% Defense Spending Target in 2025
content: Portugal will try to reach its defense spending target of 2% of gross domestic product in 2025, four years ahead of its initial goal, Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said.

title: Asia Sees Trump’s 5%-of-GDP Defense Spending Goal as Unrealistic
content: US President Donald Trump’s push for Indo-Pacific allies to ramp up military spending to counter growing threats from the likes of China and North Korea is running into the hard reality of fiscal limits and jittery bond markets.

title: Medicare Emerges as Target for Cuts to Offset Trump Tax Bill
content: Senate Republicans are considering cuts to Medicare spending to help pay for Donald Trump’s signature legislative package.

content:
After a mix of uncertainty and anticipation, US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping held a call earlier this week.

title: HSBC’s Tucker to Leave Lender in September, Return to AIA
content: HSBC Holdings Plc’s Chairman Mark Tucker will leave Europe’s largest lender in September to take on a non-executive chairman role at AIA Group Ltd., marking his return to the Hong Kong-based insurer.

title: NATO Adopts New Military Buildup Plans
content: North Atlantic Treaty Organization defense ministers met in Brussels on Thursday to formally adopt so-called capability targets, a set of highly classified lists of weaponry and personnel that each country must contribute to the alliance’s defense plans. NATO member states signed off on the alliance’s most ambitious military ramp-up since the Cold War. Bloomberg’s Piotr Skolimowski reports.

title: Temasek Chairman to Step Down After 12 Years, Teo to Succeed
content: Temasek Holdings Pte Chairman Lim Boon Heng is stepping down and will be succeeded by Teo Chee Hean, marking a significant shift in leadership at the Singapore state investor.

title: Are Tensions Between Trump and Musk Cooling Down?
content: Elon Musk signaled he would move to cool tensions with US President Donald Trump after a public feud which exploded on Thursday. He’d earlier called for Trump’s impeachment and insinuated Trump was withholding the release of files related to late disgraced New York financier Jeffrey Epstein because of his own presence in them. Bloomberg’s Rosalind Mathieson reports.

title: HelloFresh Executives Face Growing Dissent Over Pay Ahead of AGM
content: HelloFresh SE’s management could be edging closer to a revolt on executive pay after failing to heed investors’ warnings for the last three years.

title: Hong Kong’s New Platform for $166 Billion Pension Faces Glitches
content: Some Hong Kong pensioners migrating to a new electronic system for retirement savings have experienced glitches, raising concerns over the platform’s reliability as it enters a key phase of adding more users.

title: Kuaishou’s Shares Climb After Outlining Video AI Revenue Jump
content: Kuaishou Technology’s stock climbed to its highest level since March after the social video service said it expected annual revenue from video-generation platform Kling AI to hit $100 million by February.

title: Stonepeak Is Said in Exclusive Talks for Buyout of $2.1 Billion Yinson
content: Stonepeak Partners is in exclusive talks for a buyout of Yinson Holdings Bhd. that may value the firm at as much as 9 billion ringgit ($2.1 billion), according to people with knowledge of the matter, in what could be one of the biggest deals in Malaysia this year.

title: BYD’s Misfire With Price Cuts Sparks $20 Billion Stock Selloff
content: A renewed EV price war launched by BYD Co. has shaved more than $20 billion off its market value in just two weeks, as skepticism over the top Chinese automaker’s strategy takes some steam out of its big rally.

title: Musk Walks Back Threat to Decommission Dragon Spacecraft
content: Elon Musk seemingly backed down from a threat to decommission SpaceX’s Dragon spacecraft that ferries cargo and people to the International Space Station for the US, made during an escalation of a spat between the billionaire and President Donald Trump.

title: Indonesia’s Wealth Fund Weighs Role in $7 Billion Grab-GoTo Deal
content: Indonesia’s sovereign wealth fund Danantara is considering a role in Grab Holdings Ltd.’s planned $7 billion acquisition of GoTo Group, potentially allowing the country’s government to own a slice of an Asian internet powerhouse.

title: Elon Musk’s Feud With Trump Spurs One of His Worst Wealth Losses Ever
content: Minute by minute, post by post, Elon Musk’s very public, extremely online feud with President Donald Trump sliced into his vaunted status as the world’s richest person.

title: Defense Startup Anduril Clinches Funding at $30.5 Billion Valuation
content: Anduril Industries Inc. has closed a new funding round of $2.5 billion, a deal that more than doubles the defense startup’s valuation to $30.5 billion, Executive Chairman Trae Stephens said in an interview on Bloomberg Television.

title: Meituan to Expand Drone Delivery Routes Over Dubai Marina
content: Meituan is expanding its drone delivery service in Dubai as part of an ambitious overseas push.

title: Broadcom Gives Tepid Forecast, Missing Loftiest Expectations
content: Broadcom Inc., a chip supplier to companies like Alphabet Inc. and Apple Inc., gave a lackluster revenue forecast for the current quarter, suggesting that the AI spending frenzy isn’t as strong as some investors anticipated.

title: Nintendo Switch 2 Hands-On: Bigger Screen, Faster Chip Live Up to the Hype
content: The arrival of Nintendo Co.’s Switch 2 marks the biggest consumer tech product release of 2025 so far, with legions of gamers now unboxing and trying the new $450 gaming console for the first time.

title: Crypto Fund Takes Aim at Circle IPO For Ignoring Crypto Natives
content: Not everyone was celebrating the success of Circle Internet Group Inc.’s initial public offering on Thursday.

They speak with Anduril Executive Chairman Trae Stephens about the company's latest fundraise and the future of defense tech, Agility Robotics CEO Peggy Johnson about her outlook for the robotics industry, and they hear from Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai on AI competition on the horizon. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Microsoft Hits First Record Since July as AI Halo Takes Hold
content: Microsoft Corp. shares closed at a record on Thursday, taking out an all-time high that’s stood for nearly a year as investors increasingly see the software giant as a major winner with artificial intelligence.

title: Walmart Boosts Drone Deliveries in Effort to Speed Up Orders
content: Walmart Inc. is adding drone delivery in five new cities in a bid to expand online sales and get goods to shoppers faster.

title: Perplexity AI CEO Pans Google’s AI Rollout and Assistant Product
content: Perplexity AI Inc. Chief Executive Officer Aravind Srinivas issued a broadside against Google’s artificial intelligence products and strategy, marking some of the AI search startup’s strongest criticisms of its rival.

title: The Evolution of Drones in Warfare
content: Quantum Systems CEO Florian Seibel talks about the evolution of using drones in modern warfare. He says drones have let Ukraine level the playing field in their war against Russia. The German company specializes in making drones and aerial intelligence. He says the US and Europe need to be able to build thousands of drones. He speaks to Bloomberg Businessweek. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: A key Republican said senators have reached an agreement to reauthorize spectrum sales to internet companies that would generate billions of dollars in revenue toward funding US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax cuts and spending bill.

title: Portugal Says It May Reach 2% Defense Spending Target in 2025
content: Portugal will try to reach its defense spending target of 2% of gross domestic product in 2025, four years ahead of its initial goal, Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said.

content: Peloton Interactive Inc. Chief Executive Officer Peter Stern said he has no interest in selling the business while he works on a turnaround, vowing to keep it “a standalone company.”
