China’s Short-End Bonds Rally Amid Debate on Likely PBOC Trading
content: China’s short-end sovereign bonds rallied as heavy purchases by state banks spurred a debate among traders on whether the central bank was behind the move.

title: FTSE 100 Live: London’s Stock Market Set to Lose Another Tech Firm
JSDA Said to Probe Brokerages on Unsuitable Japanese Bond Sales
content: A Japanese securities industry group is probing brokerages on inappropriate bond selling practices amid surging investor demand for higher-yielding corporate debt.

title: Global Demand Jumps for Emerging Asia Bonds on Rate-Cut Bets, FX
content: Global investors are extending their purchases of sovereign bonds in emerging Asia on rate-cut wagers and stronger local currencies.

title: Saudi Arabia’s IPO Boom Faces Multiple Challenges
content: Saudi Arabian firms have raised about $3 billion from new share sales this year, making it one of the world’s hottest IPO markets. But a series of recent setbacks is threatening to take the sheen off that boom, Bloomberg's Laura Gardner Cuesta reports on Horizons Middle East & Africa. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: OPEC+ Quota Hikes Yet to Deliver Oil Surge, Morgan Stanley Says
content: The OPEC+ alliance may be boosting oil-production quotas at a significant pace in a push to restart idled capacity, but that shift has yet to translate into big gains in actual output, according to Morgan Stanley.

title: Oil Holds Ground Ahead of Fresh Round of US-China Trade Talks
content: Oil steadied after a weekly surge as a renewed round of US-China trade talks offered the potential for reduced global tensions.

title: Chinese Defense Companies Soar as Pakistan Touts Arms Purchase
content: Shares of Chinese defense companies rallied Monday, after Pakistan said it intends to buy one of the Asian power’s most-advanced fighter jets as a part of major arms purchase.

title: Chinese Stocks in Hong Kong Head for Bull Market Before US Talks
content: Chinese shares trading in Hong Kong were on course to enter a bull market by Monday’s close, as planned talks between the US and China fuel a wider sense of relief among investors.

title: China Soy Imports at Record as US Spat Spurs More Brazil Flows
content: China’s soybean imports climbed to an all-time high last month as the world’s biggest buyer scooped up large volumes mainly from Brazil amid concerns that its trade war with the US could boost global prices.

title: US-China Trade Talks; LA Immigration Clashes Escalate | Horizons Middle East & Africa 6/9/2025
content: The US and China are ready to resume trade talks in London today... with the flow of rare earth minerals set to be a key focus; clashes between law enforcement and demonstrators in Los Angeles over anti-deportation protests escalate. President Trump's deployment of the National Guard inflames residents... California's Governor says he will file a law suit to block the federal government's intervention; and Bloomberg learns Meta is in talks to invest in startup Scale AI. The financing may exceed $10 billion, making it one of the largest-ever private company funding deals. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Sunnova Files for Bankruptcy Amid Rooftop Solar Struggles
content: Sunnova Energy International Inc., one of the largest US rooftop solar companies, filed for bankruptcy in Texas following struggles with mounting debt and diminishing sales prospects.

title: In Upside-Down Bond Market, Italy and Greece Are the Big Winners
content: As fiscal-deficit concerns rocked global bond markets last month, an unusual thing happened. The bonds of Italy, Greece and Spain rallied.

title: Stocks Rise Before China-US Talks, Dollar Dips: Markets Wrap
content: Asian stocks rose ahead of trade talks between China and the US Monday that have the potential to cool tensions between the world’s two largest economies.

title: Gold Steadies After Two-Day Loss Ahead of US-China Trade Talks
content: Gold steadied — after losing almost 2% over the previous two sessions — as another round of US-China trade talks offered hope tensions between the two largest economies can be eased.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/09/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and Stephen Engle give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/9/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 9/6/25
content:
"Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets.

Note: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said in a post on X that Marines could be sent next if protests intensify in California. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Data Still Don't Make Anything Easy for the Fed
content: Reduced risk of a recession gives little reason to cut rates.

title: China’s Rare Earth Exports Recover Ahead of US Trade Talks
content: Chinese exports of rare earths, a group of 17 minerals at the center of a trade dispute with Washington, rose 23% in May from the previous month, according to customs data on Monday.

title: China’s Copper Boom Tested as Miners Wield Bargaining Power
content: The unrelenting expansion of Chinese copper processing capacity over the past few years has now become a global headache, as smelters scramble to secure the ore they need to produce the vital industrial metal.

title: ‘Most-Unloved Bonds’ Turn Routine US Auction Into Crucial Test
content: Global investor pushback against long-term government debt is turning what normally would be a routine US bond auction into one of the most anticipated events on Wall Street this week.

title: Elliott Calls for Sumitomo Realty Improvement in Rare Letter
content: Elliott Investment Management is calling for Sumitomo Realty & Development Co. to improve shareholder returns and corporate governance, saying the Japanese real estate developer’s stock is worth 40% more than its current value.

title: LA Immigration Clashes Escalate for Third Day (Correct)
content:
Demonstrations over US immigration raids intensified for a third consecutive day in the Los Angeles area, with thousands of protesters clashing with security forces outside a downtown federal detention center. Bloomberg’s Alicia Caldwell reports on the latest developments.

(Corrects headline to remove reference to Trump considering Marines deployment. The video has also been edited to remove an anchor's description of Trump's comments.) (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Julius Baer Sees Consumption Revival in India Taking Stocks to Record High
content: Julius Baer Group is expecting Indian stocks to hit a new high in the second half of the fiscal year, as domestic consumption recovers.

title: German Sovereign Bonds See Largest Japanese Selloff Since 2014
content: Japanese investors sold the largest amount of German sovereign bonds in a decade in April, the month after fiscal concerns spurred a selloff of the European nation’s debt.

title: US, China to Resume Trade Talks With Focus on Rare Earths
content: The US and China are set to resume trade negotiations in London on Monday in a bid to further defuse tensions over rare-earth minerals and advanced technology following a phone call between leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping last week.

title: Indian Central Bank's Jumbo Rate Cut Could Supercharge IPO Pipeline
content: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: Keep the Portfolio Tilt Toward Risk, Lombard Odier's Lee Says
content: Lombard Odier's Homin Lee says investors should "keep the portfolio tilt toward risk" as latest developments suggest that "we're still in the middle of the deal making phase in the Trumpian trade policy." Lee discusses his outlook for global equities on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Wall Street Touts India Options for Market Insulated From Trump
content: India’s equity rally may have stuttered recently, but Wall Street banks are now doubling down on the world’s fifth-largest stock market, this time focusing on derivatives.

title: NATO’s Rutte Calls For ‘Quantum Leap’ in Defense Investment
content: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said members of the military alliance need to deliver a “quantum leap” in their collective defense amid the ongoing threat from Russia.

title: Chinese Aircraft Carrier Seen Operating Deeper Into Pacific
content: A Chinese aircraft carrier made one of its deepest forays into the Pacific Ocean over the weekend as Beijing continues to project its military power further from its shores.

title: S. Korea’s Lee, Japan’s Ishiba Vow to Boost Ties in First Call
content: South Korea’s President Lee Jae-myung and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba held their first phone conversation and vowed to seek ways to deepen bilateral ties so both nations can respond together to future challenges.

title: LA Clashes Escalate as Trump, Newsom Spar Over National Guard
content: Tensions flared in Los Angeles on the third day of anti-deportation protests, as demonstrators clashed with law enforcement while President Donald Trump and California Governor Gavin Newsom exchanged blame over the unrest and responsibility for restoring order.

title: US, China to Resume Trade Talks With Focus on Rare Earths
content: The US and China are set to resume trade negotiations in London on Monday in a bid to further defuse tensions over rare-earth minerals and advanced technology following a phone call between leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping last week.

title: Israel Blocks Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza, Group Says
content: Israel intercepted a humanitarian aid ship trying to reach Gaza that was carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg, the group operating the vessel said.

title: Senator in Intensive Care Shows Colombia Spinning Out of Control
content: Last Thursday, presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia was fast sinking back into its violent past. Two days later, a gunman shot him in the head during a rally.

title: LA Mayor Bass Seeks Peace After Trump Calls in National Guard
content: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass called for peace as thousands of people demonstrating against immigration raids clashed with security forces for a third day.

title: Starmer Calls on Nvidia’s Huang to Train Up Britons on AI
content: Keir Starmer will make an appearance alongside Nvidia Corp co-founder Jensen Huang on Monday, as the British prime minister puts technology and artificial intelligence at the heart of his government’s plan to boost economic growth.

title: Trump Says National Guard Will Restore Order, End Unrest in LA
content: President Donald Trump pledged Sunday to send whatever is necessary to California to respond to two days of protests in Los Angeles triggered by sweeping immigration raids.

title: Italy Votes on Citizenship, Job Protections Amid Turnout Concern
content: ROME (AP) — Italians vote over two days starting Sunday in referendums that would make it easier for children born in Italy to foreigners to obtain citizenship, and on providing more job protections. But apparent low public awareness risks rendering the votes invalid if turnout is not high enough.

title: Venezuela Plans a 50% Fuel Hike as It Braces for Revenue Slump
content: Venezuela’s government is laying the groundwork for a 50% hike in fuel prices at the pump as it braces for a decrease in revenues after US oil major Chevron and other oil firms halted work in the country.

title: Renault In Discussions With France to Make Drones in Ukraine
content: French automaker Renault SA has held discussions with the French defense ministry to produce drones in Ukraine.

title: Spain Opposition Calls for Early Elections as Thousands Rally in Madrid
content: Spain’s main opposition party rallied thousands of people in a demonstration in the heart of Madrid, calling for early elections following accusations of corruption against the Socialist-led government of Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.

title: Israel Says It Recovered Body of Hamas Commander Mohammed Sinwar
content: The Israeli army on Sunday said it recovered the body of Mohammed Sinwar, a senior Hamas commander who was killed in a May 13 airstrike at a Gaza hospital.

title: Colombia Candidate Fighting for Life After Assassination Bid
content: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay remains in a critical condition after an assassination attempt on Saturday that recalled the political violence that roiled the nation in the 1980s and 1990s.

title: US Seeks Deal in London on China Rare Earth Flows, Hassett Says
content: US negotiators will aim to restore the flow of critical minerals when they meet their Chinese counterparts for a new round of trade negotiations Monday in London, a top economic aide to President Donald Trump said.

title: Israel Vows to Stop Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza
content: Israel won’t allow a humanitarian aid ship — carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg — to reach Gaza, Defense Minister Israel Katz said on Sunday.

title: Gaza Militia With Ties to Israel Emerges to Challenge Hamas
content: A Palestinian militia operating with tacit approval from Israel has surfaced in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip to challenge the rule of Hamas, which threatened a crackdown in turn.

title: Ukraine Rejects Claim Russian Forces Enter Key Central Region
content: Kyiv’s armed forces rejected as “disinformation” Russia’s claim that its ground troops have crossed into Ukraine’s Dnipropetrovsk region for the first time, even as prospects for a US-brokered ceasefire remain elusive.

title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to De-Escalate Border Standoff
content: The governments of Thailand and Cambodia agreed to de-escalate a border standoff by adjusting military forces in the conflict zone, following a skirmish in late May. The decision was announced by Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra in a post on X late Sunday.

title: Trump to Send 2,000 National Guard Troops to Calm LA Unrest
content: President Donald Trump will send the National Guard to restore order in Los Angeles in response to growing unrest over a wave of federal immigration raids.

title: Westinghouse In Talks for Role in US Nuclear Expansion Plan: FT
content: Westinghouse Electric Co. is in discussions with US officials to deploy 10 large nuclear reactors, as it seeks a role in fulfilling President Donald Trump’s ambitions to bolster America’s nuclear energy capabilities, the Financial Times reported.

title: Macron Says Subsidy for Energy Efficient Homes Should Go On
content: French President Emmanuel Macron called on his government to continue a home renovation subsidy program after the finance ministry said it would temporarily halt the grants.

title: US Trade Team Said to Extend India Stay as Talks Gather Momentum
content: A US trade team that’s currently in India for negotiations has extended its stay, according to people familiar with the matter, in a sign talks are progressing ahead of a July deadline.

title: Chad to Suspend Visas for US Citizens After Trump Travel Ban
content: N'DJAMENA, Chad (AP) — Chad's President Mahamat Idriss Deby has announced that his country will suspend the issuing of visas to U.S. citizens in response to the Trump administration’s decision to ban Chadians from visiting the United States.

title: UK Vows Due Diligence on China Embassy Amid Security Concerns
content: The UK government promised to assess any security concerns related to the construction of a Chinese embassy near the City of London, an issue that could potentially complicate trade talks with the US.

title: US-China Trade Talks Resume In London Today
content: Good morning. The US and China start another round of trade talks in London today. Los Angeles reels in its third day of anti-deportation protests. And visiting the pyramids is becoming easier. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: China Soy Imports at Record as US Spat Spurs More Brazil Flows
content: China’s soybean imports climbed to an all-time high last month as the world’s biggest buyer scooped up large volumes mainly from Brazil amid concerns that its trade war with the US could boost global prices.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Europe: National Guard LA Clashes (podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 17:13

title: Meta in Talks for Scale AI Multi-Billion Investment
content: Meta Platforms Inc. is in talks to make a multibillion-dollar investment into artificial intelligence startup Scale AI, according to people familiar with the matter. Scale AI uses an army of contractors to label the data that tech firms such as Meta and OpenAI use to train and improve their AI models, and helps companies make custom AI applications. Bloomberg’s Tom Mackenzie reports.

title: National Guard LA Clashes, US-China London Talks, More

content: WPP Plc Chief Executive Officer Mark Read is set to retire at the end of the year, kicking off a search for a successor at one of the world’s largest advertising agency groups as it grapples with slowing sales.

content: Qualcomm Inc. has agreed to buy London-listed semiconductor company  Alphawave IP Group Plc for about $2.4 billion in cash to expand its technology for artificial intelligence.

content: Chinese exports of rare earths, a group of 17 minerals at the center of a trade dispute with Washington, rose 23% in May from the previous month, according to customs data on Monday.

content: UK employment plunged by the most in five years and wage growth slowed more than forecast, as the labor market deteriorated after Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ramped up the cost of hiring.

title: BOJ’s Ueda Says Inflation Is Still Below Target, Weakening Yen
content: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said the central bank is still some distance from its inflation goal in comments that helped accelerate a weakening of the yen.

title: Chinese Stocks Drop Suddenly as Investors Await US Trade Talks
content: Chinese stocks slid suddenly before the second day of trade talks with the US, showing how investors remain on the edge as the world’s two largest economies seek to address some contentious issues.

title: Rochester: Trump Escalates to De-Escalate
content: Asian shares edged higher on the back of US-China trade talks as officials struck a positive tone after the first day of negotiations. Jordan Rochester, Head of EMEA FICC Strategy at Mizuho spoke to Bloomberg's Lizzy Burden on Horizons Middle East and Africa on the market reaction to President Trump's tariffs plan. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Rises on Trade-Talk Optimism, Signs of Near-Term Tightness
content: Oil ticked higher, rising for a fourth straight day, on investor optimism around extended trade talks between the US and China, and signs of near-term tightness in the physical market.

title: Korea’s Pension Fund Stops Selling Dollars After Won Rebound
content: South Korea’s National Pension Service has ended a five-month strategy of selling dollars in a bid to support the won, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Global Investors Turning Buyers of Indian Stocks is Bullish Sign
content: Global investors are on course to be purchasers of Indian equities for the first quarter in three, flashing a possible positive indicator of continued inflow.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Sheds Most Jobs Since Pandemic
Stocks, Futures Gyrate Before US-China Trade Talks: Markets Wrap
content: Equity-index futures fluctuated and stocks lost momentum in a quick reversal of risk sentiment ahead of the second day of talks between the US and China.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/10/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Gold Declines on Optimism US-China Trade Talks Will Ease Tension
content: Gold declined as traders waited for progress on US-China trade talks, with both sides signaling a willingness to make concessions, easing demand for haven assets.

title: Taiwan Life’s Losses Double in May on Currency Rally Hit
content: Taiwan Life Insurance Co.’s losses more than doubled in May from a month earlier as the local currency’s rally against the US dollar pummeled its foreign investments.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/10/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Grab Plans Big Convertible Bond, Fueling Hopes About GoTo Deal
content: Grab Holdings Ltd. announced plans for a $1.25 billion sale of bonds convertible into stock, the biggest of its kind among Asian companies this year, fueling speculation it’s bulking up its warchest to take over rival Southeast Asian delivery-and-transport provider GoTo Group.

title: Diageo Weighs Options for Stake in Indian Cricket Team
content: Diageo Plc is considering options for its ownership of the Indian Premier League cricket franchise Royal Challengers Bengaluru, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Europe’s IPO Drought Has Stock Exchanges Battling for Listings
content: As fewer large companies opt to go public in Europe, the region’s stock exchanges are fighting harder to win the biggest listings.

title: China’s Solar Industry Gathers as Gloom Deepens Over Demand
content: China’s despondent solar manufacturers face a new threat — an imminent drop-off in demand for their products that’s likely to heap pressure on an already oversupplied market.

title: Australia Tackles Diplomatic Row Over Chinese-Owned Port
content: The Australian government is confronting a fresh diplomatic dilemma with Beijing: how to fulfill a pledge to regain control of the strategic Port of Darwin from a Chinese company. The Australia-China Relations Institute thinks the issue has been driven by domestic politics and will not trigger a downwards spiral in bilateral relations. ACRI Director James Laurenceson talks about Canberra's plan and the global trade turmoil on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China's Recovery 'Has Legs': Franklin Templeton's Tan
content: Chinese stocks trading in Hong Kong remain in bullish territory and the recovery still "has legs," Franklin Templeton Institute investment strategist Christy Tan tells Bloomberg TV's Haslinda Amin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: RBI’s Cash Move Fuels Demand for India’s Short-Term Bonds
content: Investors are set to funnel surplus money into short-term bonds, further boosting an already favored play in India’s debt market, after the central bank’s surprise decision to inject more cash into the banking system.

title: Private Equity-Backed VeloBank Eyes Polish M&As After Citi Deal
content: Fast growing VeloBank SA, backed by US private equity fund Cerberus Capital Management LP, is on the prowl for more Polish takeovers after it bought Citigroup Inc.’s retail operations in the country.

title: China’s Gas Sector Lobbies for More Power Plants to Boost Demand
content: China’s natural gas producers are lobbying Beijing to increase the number of power plants that run on the fuel, in a bid to help prop up faltering demand.

title: Toyota Industries Shareholders Question Buyout at Annual Meeting
content: Toyota Industries Corp. held what could be its last annual meeting as a public company, after the Toyota group unveiled plans to privatize the maker of forklifts, textile looms and auto parts.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 10/6/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Marlboro Expansion Draws Indian Bulls to Godfrey Phillips
content: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: Taiwan Moves Pose Hurdle for Foreign Defense Firms, AmCham Says
content: Changes that Taiwan made to rules for defense cooperation with foreign companies might discourage them from working with the archipelago, an American business group says — a view that comes just as China’s military shows off some key advances.

title: Iron Ore Edges Lower With Traders’ Hopes Pinned on Trade Talks
content: Iron ore declined for a second day, as traders watched for any progress from US-China trade talks and potential stimulus from Beijing that could reignite buying interest in the steelmaking material.

title: China Taps $1.5 Trillion Fund to Boost Home Market Support
content: China is tapping an often overlooked pool of funds worth 10.9 trillion yuan ($1.5 trillion) to salvage its housing sector, offering people an alternative to bank mortgages.

title: Billionaire Johnson Family’s VC Fund to Exit China Tech Holdings
content: A venture capital fund backed by Fidelity Investments’ billionaire Johnson family plans to unload its Chinese technology holdings amid heightened tensions between Beijing and Washington, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Investors Bank on No-Frills Pakistan Budget to Keep Rally Alive
content: Investors in Pakistan are hoping Tuesday’s budget stays focused on slashing spending, boosting revenues, and reinforcing the government’s commitment to its International Monetary Fund loan program.

title: Britain Loses 276,000 Jobs Since Reeves’ Tax-Raising Budget
content: UK employment plunged by the most in five years and wage growth slowed more than forecast, as the labor market deteriorated after Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ramped up the cost of hiring.

title: Russia Unleashes Massive Drone Attack Against Kyiv and Odesa
content: Russia unleashed a sweeping drone attack on the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv and the Black Sea city of Odesa that left a trail of destruction as President Volodymyr Zelenskiy demanded increased pressure on Moscow to end the war.

title: Australia Names Wilkinson Treasury Head, First Woman in Role
content: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has named Jenny Wilkinson as the nation’s new secretary to the Treasury, making her the first woman to hold the bureaucracy’s top economic post.

title: Xi Urges South Korea’s Lee to Help Safeguard Free Trade
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping held his first phone conversation with South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung and called for cooperation to safeguard multilateralism and free trade.

title: Trump Says China ‘Not Easy’ as Trade Talks to Resume Tuesday
content: Trade talks between the US and China will continue into a second day, according to a US official, as the two sides look to ease tensions over shipments of technology and rare earth elements.

title: France’s Finance Minister Is the Calm Hand Macron Needs Now
content: Eric Lombard is deploying his deal making skills to avert political turmoil

title: Why Trump’s Deployment of Military in California Is So Controversial
content: President Donald Trump ordered the California National Guard on June 7 to dispatch at least 2,000 soldiers to the Los Angeles area as thousands of people demonstrating against immigration raids clashed with security forces. After vandalism and violence broke out, the Pentagon escalated the federal response by also mobilizing 700 active-duty Marines.

title: Albanese Slams Shooting of Australian Journalist at LA Protest
content: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has strongly condemned the shooting of an Australian journalist with a rubber bullet during protests in Los Angeles, describing footage of the incident as “horrific.”

title: Huawei Founder Waves Off Chip Curbs as Trade Talks Proceed
content: Huawei Technologies Co. founder Ren Zhengfei dismissed the impact of US export restrictions on China in a front-page People’s Daily article, wading into one of the key topics dogging Washington-Beijing trade negotiations.

title: US Deploys Marines to LA as Trump Tensions With Newsom Intensify
content: The Trump administration escalated its response to anti-deportation protests in Los Angeles with the mobilization of 700 Marines, deploying active-duty military on the ground and deepening tensions with California officials.

title: White House Pitches Texas GOP on US House Redistricting Gambit
content: Members of Texas’ Republican congressional delegation met on Monday to discuss the prospect of redistricting to try and tilt the state further in the GOP’s favor before the 2026 midterm elections.

title: Israel Takes Greta Thunberg and Aid Boat Crew Into Custody, Group Says
content: All 12 people from an aid boat intercepted by Israel carrying Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg have arrived at port and are being transferred to the custody of Israeli authorities, the group involved said in a social media post.

title: Saudi Arabian Crown Prince MBS Gets G-7 Invitation From Canada
content: Canada has invited Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to attend the Group of Seven summit, according to a person familiar with the matter, in another sign of a new approach to foreign policy under Prime Minister Mark Carney.

title: Japan’s Ishiba Pledges 50% Pay Rise by 2040 Ahead of Elections
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has set pay raises and a ¥1 quadrillion ($6.9 trillion) economy as the top campaign promises for this summer’s upper house election, as the date nears for voters to give their latest verdict on his administration.

title: Investors Bank on No-Frills Pakistan Budget to Keep Rally Alive
content: Investors in Pakistan are hoping Tuesday’s budget stays focused on slashing spending, boosting revenues, and reinforcing the government’s commitment to its International Monetary Fund loan program.

title: California Asks Court to Halt Trump Deploying Military in LA
content: California asked a federal court to halt the Trump administration’s “illegal” deployment of the state’s National Guard and the US Marines in Los Angeles to quell unrest over the president’s immigration raids.

title: Ireland Needs Fiscal Rule as Economic Risk Grows, Watchdog Warns
content: The Irish government should commit to a domestic fiscal rule so it can better plan spending as the economy enters uncertain territory, the state’s fiscal watchdog warned.

title: Pentagon Sends 700 Marines to Los Angeles, Escalating Response to Protests
content: The Trump administration is sending about 700 active duty Marines to reinforce the National Guard in response to protests in Los Angeles, the US Northern Command said Monday of a move continuing an escalation that California officials have called unwarranted.

title: California Sues Trump to Protect Its Transgender Athletes Policy
content: California sued to protect itself from the Trump administration’s threats to pull federal funding over a state law that allows transgender high school athletes to compete in female sports, the latest showdown between President Donald Trump and the most populous state.

title: US Asks Appeals Court to Let Trump Tariffs Remain for Longer
content: A federal appeals court is closer to ruling on whether to keep most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs in place longer while the legal battle over them continues.

title: France’s Macron Doesn’t Rule Out Calling Snap Elections Again
content: French president Emmanuel Macron said he doesn’t rule out the possibility of again dissolving the National Assembly and calling snap elections.

title: Crucial Stablecoin Bill Vote Teed Up in the Senate for This Week
content: Senate Majority Leader John Thune has teed up a critical procedural vote Wednesday on stablecoin legislation supported by the crypto industry and President Donald Trump.

title: Trump Touts CEO Pledges on Tax Bill’s Child Savings Accounts
content: President Donald Trump touted a provision in his tax bill that would deposit $1,000 into an investment account for babies born in the next few years alongside corporate leaders who said they would aid the effort.

title: California Labor Leader Charged With Felony After ICE Protest
content: California labor leader David Huerta has been charged with a federal felony, accused of interfering with law enforcement after joining a protest against immigration arrest operations in Los Angeles that set off days of unrest.

title: Lula pasa de ser el “líder más popular del mundo”, a perder apoyo en Brasil
content: La elevada inflación y el descontento económico impactan la popularidad de Lula. Sus aliados afirman que el verdadero problema es que el presidente de 79 años sigue anclado en el pasado.

title: Once the World’s ‘Most Popular Politician,’ Lula Is Losing His Way in Brazil
content: High inflation and economic discontent are hammering Lula’s approval. Allies say the real problem is a 79-year-old president who’s stuck in the past.

title: Johnson Urges Senate to Minimize Changes to $40,000 SALT Deal
content: House Speaker Mike Johnson said he’s pressuring Senate Republicans to refrain from changing a deal to increase the state and local tax deduction cap to $40,000, pushing back on President Donald Trump’s willingness to scale back the write-off.

title: Senator Shot in Head ‘Needs a Miracle’ as Colombia Reels
content: Last Thursday, presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia was fast sinking back into its violent past. Two days later, a gunman shot him in the head during a rally.

title: What to Watch for ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ in the Senate This Week
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Trump to Keep White House Starlink as Musk Feud Dissipates
content: President Donald Trump reiterated his desire to end his public spat with Elon Musk, telling reporters he would retain Starlink internet service at the White House and that he wished his billionaire backer “very well.”

title: India’s Swelling Coal Stockpiles Test State-Owned Mining Giant
content: Recent rains may have provided the world’s most populous nation some relief from scorching summer heat, but they shattered state-owned mining giant Coal India Ltd.’s hopes of denting record-high inventories.

title: Drone Attack on Kyiv as Russia, Ukraine Swap Prisoners
content: Russia unleashed a sweeping drone attack on the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv and the Black Sea city of Odesa that left a trail of destruction and killed at least one person, according to local authorities. The attacks came as Russia and Ukraine are undertaking a major prisoner exchange following peace talks last week in Turkey. Bloomberg’s Bill Faries reports.

title: US and China Focus Trade Talks on Rare Earth Materials
content: Trade talks between the US and China will continue into a second day, according to a US official, as the two sides look to ease tensions over shipments of technology and rare earth elements. Representatives for both nations ended their first day of negotiations in London after more than six hours at Lancaster House, a 19th century mansion near Buckingham Palace. Gracelin Baskaran, Director of the Critical Minerals Security Program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, discusses the importance of rare earth materials to American defense and economic initiatives. Dr. Baskaran speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says China ‘Not Easy’ Amid Trade Talks
content:
Trade talks between the US and China will continue into a second day, according to a US official, as the two sides look to ease tensions over shipments of technology and rare earth elements. 

Dexter “Tiff” Roberts, Nonresident Senior Fellow at the Atlantic Council’s Global China Hub and author of “Trade War” a weekly newsletter on China’s economy, examines which side has the advantage in these crucial discussions. Dexter with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mark Zuckerberg Personally Hiring to Create New “Superintelligence” AI Team
content: Mark Zuckerberg, frustrated with Meta Platforms Inc.’s shortfalls in AI, is assembling a team of experts to achieve artificial general intelligence, recruiting from a brain trust of AI researchers and engineers who’ve met with him in recent weeks at his homes in Lake Tahoe and Palo Alto.

title: TSMC’s May Sales Surge 39.6% on Resilient AI Demand
content: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., the main chipmaker for Nvidia Corp. and Apple Inc., reported a 39.6% jump in May revenue after companies stockpiled chips in response to mounting trade uncertainty.

title: Trump Says China ‘Not Easy’ as Trade Talks to Resume Tuesday
content: Trade talks between the US and China will continue into a second day, according to a US official, as the two sides look to ease tensions over shipments of technology and rare earth elements.

title: Academic Publishers Sign AI Deals as Trump Cuts Research Funding
content: Academic publishers are rushing to sign licensing deals with artificial intelligence companies, carving out a new revenue stream as US research funding cuts dim their outlook.

title: Huawei Founder Waves Off Chip Curbs as Trade Talks Proceed
content: Huawei Technologies Co. founder Ren Zhengfei dismissed the impact of US export restrictions on China in a front-page People’s Daily article, wading into one of the key topics dogging Washington-Beijing trade negotiations.

title: South Korea’s Ruling Party Unveils Plan to Allow Stablecoins
content: South Korea’s new President, Lee Jae-myung, is moving quickly to deliver on his campaign pledge to allow local companies to issue stablecoins, giving a further boost to one of the world’s most active digital-asset markets.

title: Billionaire Johnson Family’s VC Fund to Exit China Tech Holdings
content: A venture capital fund backed by Fidelity Investments’ billionaire Johnson family plans to unload its Chinese technology holdings amid heightened tensions between Beijing and Washington, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla, First Indian in Space in 41 Years, Will Blast Off in a Musk Rocket
content: More than four decades after the first person from India went to space, the nation is finally about to have a sequel.

title: Everything New Coming to iPhones, iPads and Macs Later This Year
content: Apple Inc. kicked off its annual Worldwide Developers Conference on Monday with a roughly 90-minute presentation where it unveiled a slew of updates to its various software platforms.

title: Apple Expands ChatGPT Deal and Mimics Google in AI Comeback Attempt
content: The company unveiled a number of AI features at WWDC, though they weren’t the focus of event

title: Amazon Whole Foods Distributor Breach Disrupts Deliveries
content: A cybersecurity breach at United Natural Foods Inc., the primary distributor for Amazon.com Inc.’s Whole Foods grocery markets, has disrupted deliveries and forced the company’s systems offline.

title: Trump Says He Wishes Musk ‘Very Well’
content: President Donald Trump tells reporters that he would retain Starlink internet service at the White House and wished Elon Musk “very well.”

title: Apple’s macOS Tahoe to Be Final Operating System to Work on Intel Macs
content: Apple Inc.’s new macOS Tahoe 26 will be the final Mac operating system software that will work on Macs running Intel Corp. processors, the company said Monday following its developer conference.

title: Roblox Taps Paramount’s Naveen Chopra as New CFO
content: Roblox Corp. tapped Paramount Global’s Naveen Chopra as its new chief financial officer, effective June 30.

title: Fuji Media Keeps Real Estate Spinoff in Play as Activists Circle
content: Fuji Media Holdings Inc.’s incoming president said “all options” regarding its real estate operations remain on the table, including a possible spinoff along the lines of activist investor demands.

title: Investors Look To Apple's WWDC For Guidance | Bloomberg Tech 6/9/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Apple's software and AI goals as the company kicks off its annual Developers Conference in Cupertino. Plus, AI and tariffs top the agenda for China-US trade talks as discussions get underway in London. And, Warner Brothers Discovery splits its streaming and cable businesses. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mexico’s Coppel to Invest $4.2 Billion in E-Commerce, New Stores
content: Grupo Coppel SA, Mexico’s largest private retailer, will spend 80 billion pesos ($4.2 billion) over five years on investments including a new e-commerce platform to double the portion of digital transactions to 20% of total sales.

title: Apple’s AI Takes Back Seat to Design, iPad Revamp at WWDC Event
content: Apple Inc. unveiled the most sweeping software redesign in its history, aiming to make the company’s device lineup more cohesive and useful, even while doing little to upgrade its struggling artificial intelligence platform.

title: How to Install Apple’s Redesigned Operating Systems — If You’re a Developer
content: Apple Inc. on Monday released the first developer beta previews for its upcoming iOS 26, iPadOS 26, macOS Tahoe 26, tvOS 26, watchOS 26, and visionOS 26 updates. The software is intended to give app makers an opportunity to explore the visual redesign and new features ahead of a wide rollout in the fall. A public beta will be available in July for those who want to test the major software upgrades several months in advance.

title: Warner Bros. to Split Into Streaming, Cable TV Companies
content: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. is splitting itself in half, unshackling its fast-growing streaming business from the struggling legacy media channels and setting up two independent companies that could pursue deals on their own.

title: Apple Unveils Liquid Glass Operating System at WWDC
content: Apple Inc. unveiled a new operating system interface called Liquid Glass at its annual Worldwide Developers Conference, an event that focused heavily on aesthetics and design elements rather than software breakthroughs. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow was there and reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Key Takeaways From Apple’s 2025 Developer’s Conference
content: Apple Inc.’s 2025 Worldwide Developers Conference was jam-packed. Here are the highlights:

title: Swedish ‘Vibe Coding’ Startup Lovable in Talks for $1.5 Billion Valuation
content: Lovable, an AI startup that streamlines software development, is in talks for a large funding round that would make it one of Europe’s biggest artificial intelligence newcomers.

title: Apple Shares Fall While AI-Focused Event Is Underway
content: Apple presents the new Liquid Glass design at WWDC in Cupertino on June 9.

title: Financier Lex Greensill Decries ‘Code of Silence’ Around SoftBank Deals
content: Financier Lex Greensill said there was a “code of silence” around a series of transactions with SoftBank Group Corp. to keep potential losses hidden, in his first public court appearance since the high-profile collapse of his firm.

title: Apple Event to Put Focus on ‘Existential Risk’ of AI Struggles
content: Apple Inc. shares have been heavily tethered to US trade policies this year, but its annual developer’s conference could refocus Wall Street’s attention on a potentially bigger problem: its struggles with artificial intelligence.

title: Tesla Hit With a Pair of Downgrades Amid Fallout From Trump Feud
content: Tesla Inc. was hit with a pair of downgrades on Monday, underscoring mounting concerns on Wall Street about the electric-vehicle maker’s outlook following last week’s clash between Chief Executive Elon Musk and President Donald Trump.

title: IonQ Buys UK Quantum Computing Startup in $1 Billion Deal
content: US quantum computing company IonQ has agreed to buy UK startup Oxford Ionics in a $1.08 billion deal that highlights increasing commercial confidence in what has largely been an experimental field of computing.

title: Norway’s Core Inflation Slows More Than Forecast to 2025 Low
content: Norway’s underlying inflation rate declined slightly more than expected in May, cementing the case for Norges Bank to begin interest-rate cuts in coming months.

title: Britain Loses 276,000 Jobs Since Reeves’ Tax-Raising Budget
content: UK employment plunged by the most in five years and wage growth slowed more than forecast, as the labor market deteriorated after Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ramped up the cost of hiring.

title: BOJ’s Ueda Says Inflation Is Still Below Target, Weakening Yen
content: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said the central bank is still some distance from its inflation goal in comments that helped accelerate a weakening of the yen.

title: Xi Urges South Korea’s Lee to Help Safeguard Free Trade
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping held his first phone conversation with South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung and called for cooperation to safeguard multilateralism and free trade.

title: France’s Finance Minister Is the Calm Hand Macron Needs Now
content: Eric Lombard is deploying his deal making skills to avert political turmoil

title: Japan’s Ishiba Pledges 50% Pay Rise by 2040 Ahead of Elections
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has set pay raises and a ¥1 quadrillion ($6.9 trillion) economy as the top campaign promises for this summer’s upper house election, as the date nears for voters to give their latest verdict on his administration.

title: New Zealand’s Willis Wants RBNZ to Add Summer Rate Decision
content: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis wants the central bank to increase the frequency of its rate decisions, ending its practice of a three-month summer break and bringing it in line with global peers.

title: Australia’s Consumer Sentiment Rises in ‘Cautious Pessimism’
content: Australia’s consumer confidence edged up in June as the conflicting moves of lower interest rates and cool inflation ran up against slow growth and ongoing trade upheavals to place households in a holding pattern.

title: Ireland Needs Fiscal Rule as Economic Risk Grows, Watchdog Warns
content: The Irish government should commit to a domestic fiscal rule so it can better plan spending as the economy enters uncertain territory, the state’s fiscal watchdog warned.

title: Argentina Eases Bond Auction Rules in Aim to Lure More Dollars
content: Argentina’s central bank unveiled a slew of measures Monday aimed at helping the South American nation amass more hard-currency reserves, firepower the country needs to defend the peso.

title: Colombian Inflation Slows More Than Forecast to Lowest Since 2021
content: Colombian inflation slowed more than expected in May to its lowest level since 2021, potentially bolstering the arguments of Finance Minister German Avila who is calling for much deeper interest rate cuts.

title: UK Retail Sales See Smallest Gain Since November as Budgets Hit
content: UK retail sales rose in May at the slowest pace in six months, an industry group found, as increasing prices and higher monthly bills squeezed household budgets.

title: BOJ Likely to Ease Tapering Pace of Bond Buys, Ex-Official Says
content: The Bank of Japan is likely to slow the pace of tapering its government bond purchases next fiscal year at the board’s upcoming meeting, according to a former BOJ executive director in charge of monetary policy.

title: ECB Rate Pause Until Autumn Makes Sense, Holzmann Tells ORF
content: The European Central Bank may be able to keep interest rates on hold over the summer, according to Governing Council member Robert Holzmann.

title: US May Exhaust Debt-Ceiling Measures in Mid-August, CBO Says
content: The US government could run out of enough funds to meet its financial obligations in a timely manner between mid-August and the end of September, the Congressional Budget Office said Monday.

title: Fed Interest Payments Are Likely Here to Stay, JPMorgan Says
content: A proposal to eliminate the interest paid to banks that deposit cash at the Federal Reserve risks unleashing tremors across the industry, funding markets and US monetary policy, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co. strategists.

title: IMF Wants Zimbabwe Gold-Backed ZiG to Become Sole Currency
content: The International Monetary Fund said it would like to see the ZiG “fully becoming a national currency” as it considers whether to place Zimbabwe on a staff-monitored program.

title: US, China Hold Trade Talks in London to Address Export Curbs
content: Trade talks between the US and China stretched on in London, with the US signaling a willingness to remove restrictions on some tech exports in exchange for assurances that China is easing limits on rare earth shipments.

title: Inflation Expectations Declined Across All Horizons, NY Fed Says
content: Consumers’ expectations for future price pressures improved across all horizons in May, and households’ pessimism about the labor market somewhat eased, according to monthly survey data released Monday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: Bank of Spain Cuts GDP Forecast as US Tariffs Cloud Outlook
content: The Bank of Spain lowered its 2025 growth forecast for the country, citing a high level of economic uncertainty due to US trade policies.

title: S. Africa Wins $1.5 Billion World Bank Infrastructure Loan
content: The World Bank has approved a $1.5 billion loan to support structural reforms aimed at boosting South Africa’s infrastructure.

title: Mexico’s Inflation Tops Target Range, Testing Rate Cut Plans
content: Mexico’s annual inflation accelerated more than expected in May and breached the top of the target range, challenging expectations that the central bank will keep its half-point pace of interest rate cuts this month.

title: India’s RBI to End Daily Fund Infusions Following Stance Shift
content: India’s central bank said it will stop daily fund injections into the financial system, days after the monetary authority shifted its policy stance and said the space for future easing was constrained.

title: London Infrastructure Set to Miss Out in Reeves Spending Plans
content: London is set to miss out on extra funding for new infrastructure projects in Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ spending review on Wednesday, provoking an eleventh-hour row between the Treasury and the capital’s mayor, Sadiq Khan.

title: Trump’s Leverage Wobbles as China Trade Talks Get Started
content: One argument made for President Donald Trump’s tariffs is that they give him leverage over other countries. But what happens when signs emerge that his leverage is a diminishing asset?

title: Here’s a New Way to Decode the BOE’s Policy Signaling
content: I’m Julian Harris, a UK economics editor in London. Today we’re looking at a new way to track the Bank of England’s policy signals. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Malaysia to Expand Services Tax From July 1 to Trim Deficit
content: Malaysia is expanding its sales and service tax to include the construction and financial services sectors effective July 1, according to the Finance Ministry.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Aimed at Reviving Manufacturing Are Doing the Opposite
content: President Donald Trump’s signature trade policy is threatening to backfire by upending other top priorities: the revival of US manufacturing and the American Rust Belt.

title: Taiwan Exports to US Hit Record as Two Sides Talk Trade
content: Taiwan’s exports to the US jumped to a record, surging as companies fired off shipments before any tariffs hit — gains that come as the two sides try to hammer out a trade deal.

title: Europe Must Defend Rule of Law Standards, ECB’s Elderson Says
content: Europe can foster economic well-being and help increase the euro’s global role by adhering to and even strengthening rule of law standards, European Central Bank Executive Board member Frank Elderson said.

title: Bellway Raises UK Home Sales Guidance After Rise in Deals
content: Bellway Plc lifted its guidance on home sales after a period of “improved affordability” supported an uptick in deals over the past few months.

title: Monash IVF Shares Drop After Another Embryo Transfer Mix-Up
content: Shares of Australia’s Monash IVF Group Ltd. tumbled after saying a patient’s embryo had been incorrectly transferred, the latest mix-up reported by the reproductive health-care company behind the world’s first IVF pregnancy.

title: UK Picks Rolls-Royce for Next-Generation Atomic Power Technology
content: The UK chose Rolls-Royce Plc to provide technology for the country’s first small modular reactor, or SMR, according to a statement published Tuesday.

title: China Bans Bank From Luring Depositors With Popular Labubu Dolls
content: A Chinese lender’s stunt to woo depositors with gifts including the wildly popular Labubu dolls has been barred by financial regulators, underscoring the increasingly fraught battle among banks for customers as interest rates and profit margins fall.

title: Diageo Weighs Options for Stake in Indian Cricket Team
content: Diageo Plc is considering options for its ownership of the Indian Premier League cricket franchise Royal Challengers Bengaluru, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: China’s Solar Industry Gathers as Gloom Deepens Over Demand
content: China’s despondent solar manufacturers face a new threat — an imminent drop-off in demand for their products that’s likely to heap pressure on an already oversupplied market.

title: Eutelsat CEO Races to Raise Funds to Keep Starlink Rival Afloat
content: Europe’s only Starlink alternative has to get cash fast to have any hope of challenging Elon Musk’s provider of satellite-based internet services.

title: Chinese Firm Halts Production of Controversial Alzheimer’s Drug
content: A Chinese company that developed the country’s first homegrown Alzheimer’s disease therapy has suspended production of the drug, a local media report said, casting doubts on the treatment’s future nearly five years after its approval.

title: Toyota Industries Shareholders Question Buyout at Annual Meeting
content: Toyota Industries Corp. held what could be its last annual meeting as a public company, after the Toyota group unveiled plans to privatize the maker of forklifts, textile looms and auto parts.

title: Chinese State Media Takes Aim at ‘Zero-Mileage’ Used Cars
content: The Communist Party controlled People’s Daily newspaper has urged Chinese carmakers to stamp out “zero-mileage” used vehicles in the latest rebuke to the auto industry amid growing concern unbridled competition could upend the market.

title: China Taps $1.5 Trillion Fund to Boost Home Market Support
content: China is tapping an often overlooked pool of funds worth 10.9 trillion yuan ($1.5 trillion) to salvage its housing sector, offering people an alternative to bank mortgages.

title: Top India Dealmakers Earn 37% More Than Singapore Peers
content: Senior dealmakers in India are earning more than their counterparts in Singapore and Hong Kong, according to Bloomberg Intelligence, as global firms boost pay to attract top talent in the world’s fastest-growing major economy.

title: Alexander Brothers Claim Sex-Trafficking Probe Sparked by Rival
content: Former star real estate brokers Tal and Oren Alexander asked a federal judge to dismiss some or all of the charges against them in a criminal sex-trafficking case, claiming the probe was kicked off by an industry rival.

title: RFK Jr. Removes All Members of CDC Vaccine Advisory Panel
content: The Department of Health and Human Services dismissed all 17 members that make up one of the main committees advising the US government on vaccine safety and policy, an unprecedented move to reshape a key scientific panel.

title: Thames Creditors Plan £5 Billion in Fresh Funds, Debt Writedowns
content: Thames Water’s senior creditors have submitted a rescue plan to the UK’s water industry regulator, envisaging £5 billion ($6.8 billion) of fresh funds and hefty losses for the struggling utility’s debt holders.

title: UK Retail Sales See Smallest Gain Since November as Budgets Hit
content: UK retail sales rose in May at the slowest pace in six months, an industry group found, as increasing prices and higher monthly bills squeezed household budgets.

title: Eurostar Plans Five-Hour Trains From London to Frankfurt, Geneva
content: Eurostar Group Ltd. plans to launch direct train services from London to Frankfurt and Geneva next decade, connecting the UK’s capital to two of Europe’s key financial centers.

title: Japan Pension Funds Holding $400 Billion Hire Their First CIOs
content: Japanese pension funds are seeking to bolster returns in a volatile market by doing something many of them have never done before: appoint chief investment officers.

title: Sexual Wellness Firm Founder Convicted in Forced-Labor Case
content: The founder of the sexual wellness company OneTaste was convicted in New York of engaging in a yearslong forced-labor scheme by manipulating employees and some participants in the firm’s educational courses.

title: S&P Downgrades Warner Bros. Bonds Deeper Into Junk Status
content: S&P Global Ratings cut Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.’s unsecured bond ratings deeper into junk status after the media company announced it was splitting up, and said that it’s reviewing downgrading other ratings of the company.

title: Charter Schools Financier Blames Bankruptcy on Spat With Backer
content: A major financier of US charter schools filed bankruptcy, blaming pandemic-era subsidies that reduced demand for its services and a dispute with a top stockholder, New York investment firm Orthogon Partners Investment Management.

title: Starwood REIT Begins to Scale Back Its Steep Withdrawal Limits
content: A real estate fund managed by Barry Sternlicht’s Starwood Capital is slowly lifting a cap on redemptions more than a year after it severely limited investors’ ability to retrieve capital.

title: Mexico’s Coppel to Invest $4.2 Billion in E-Commerce, New Stores
content: Grupo Coppel SA, Mexico’s largest private retailer, will spend 80 billion pesos ($4.2 billion) over five years on investments including a new e-commerce platform to double the portion of digital transactions to 20% of total sales.

title: Ken Moelis Plans to Step Down as CEO of His Investment Bank
content: Ken Moelis, who became one of the most recognizable dealmakers on Wall Street in his four-decade career, will step down as CEO of his boutique investment bank effective Oct. 1.

title: FAA Nominee Blames Air Traffic Woes on Agency’s Culture
content: President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead the Federal Aviation Administration blasted the regulator’s risk-averse culture and a lack of strong leadership, saying those shortcomings have stymied efforts to modernize the US air traffic control system.

title: Centerbridge Seeks $1 Billion to Hold Canadian Bank for Longer
content: Centerbridge Partners aims to raise about $1 billion to give it more time to hold its minority position in Fairstone Bank of Canada, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Merck Wins US Approval for Shot to Prevent Infant RSV
content: Merck & Co. won US approval for a shot that protects against RSV, the most common cause of hospitalization among infants.

title: Germany’s SEFE to Announce 10-Year Deal For Gas From Azerbaijan
content: Germany’s state-owned SEFE is expected to announce a 10-year deal to buy gas from Azerbaijan’s state-owned Socar, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Waymo Halts LA Service After Cars Destroyed During Protests
content: Waymo has suspended service of its ride-hailing service in downtown Los Angeles after its vehicles were set on fire during protests against immigration raids in the area.

title: Senators Call for Watchdog Probes of Midair Plane Collision Near DC
content: A bipartisan group of senators called on government watchdogs to examine the midair collision near DC in January, in part to determine whether shortfalls in managing the congested airspace contributed to the deadly accident.

title: Watch out for this No. 1 red flag when buying your home: I've seen people miss this 'again and again,' says real estate agent
content: Real estate agent Dana Bull shares her best advice about how to make sure you are "buying a quality home, one that's been cared for and built to last."

title: Walmart is using its own fintech firm to provide credit cards after dumping Capital One
content: Walmart had leaned on Capital One as exclusive provider of its credit card since 2018, but sued the bank in 2023 so that it could exit the relationship.

title: Robinhood shares drop after the online brokerage fails to get the nod to join the S&P 500
content: Investors were left disappointed after S&P Dow Jones Indices said Friday the S&P 500 would remain unchanged.

title: Job market is 'trash' right now, career coach says — here's why
content: Employers are reluctant to hire in an uncertain economy, making it hard for job seekers to land new gigs.

title: UK finance watchdog teams up with Nvidia to let banks experiment with AI
content: The initiative is designed for financial services firms in the "discovery and experiment phase" with AI, the Financial Conduct Authority said.

title: Trump, Harvard battle over student visas could have an $180 million economic impact, analysis finds
content: With more than 6,000 students from overseas, Harvard's international enrollment contributes $180 million to the local economy, a new analysis by Implan found.

title: Supreme Court just gave DOGE access to Social Security data. Here's what personal information is at stake
content: The Trump administration wants to give DOGE access to the Social Security Administration's sensitive data. Now the Supreme Court has weighed in.

title: Millions of student loan borrowers were promised an interest-free break. This woman's debt is still growing
content: The Education Department has promised student loan borrowers in the SAVE forbearance that interest accrual is paused. Why did this woman see her balance grow?

title: Job market is 'trash' right now, career coach says — here's why
content: Employers are reluctant to hire in an uncertain economy, making it hard for job seekers to land new gigs.
