content: Anna Edwards, Tom Mackenzie and Mark Cudmore break down today's key themes for analysts and investors on "Bloomberg: The Opening Trade."  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Auto Parts Supplier Marelli Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
content: Marelli Holdings Co., the struggling auto parts supplier for Nissan Motor Co., Stellantis NV and other carmakers, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US as it seeks to slash its debt burden and restructure under new ownership.

title: South Africa Statistics Chief Defends Jobless-Data Calculations
content: The head of South Africa’s statistics agency defended the methodology of his organization’s unemployment data after the chief of the nation’s top bank by customers said misclassification of traders means the jobless rate was much lower.

title: South Korea President Visits Stock Exchange He Pledged to Help Boost
content: South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung made a high-profile visit to the main stock exchange, signaling a commitment to follow through on his pledges to boost the market.

title: BSE’s Shares Put Under Trading Caution as Stock Price Doubles
content: BSE Ltd.’s shares have been placed under extra scrutiny to caution investors and deter any speculative trading, following a sharp rally in the bourse’s stock price.

title: China Rare-Earth Magnet Maker Gets Green Light for US Exports
content: A major Chinese manufacturer of rare-earth magnets received export permits to countries including the US, in a possible sign of easing tensions between Beijing and Washington.

title: Indian Investors Are Moving to Alternatives, Kotak Mahindra Says
content: Gautami Gavankar, president of Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd., says Indian investors are increasingly considering alternative assets and private credit. Real estate plays, private equity funds like pre-IPO funds, infrastructure funds and special situation funds are also gaining traction, she tells the audience at the Bloomberg Invest conference in Hong Kong. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/11/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stock Futures Dip After China-US Talks, Dollar Up: Markets Wrap
content: Stock-index futures for the US and Europe declined and Asian shares managed only a modest rally after officials’ comments at the end of US-China talks lacked the details needed to extend the recent gains in markets.

title: Swedish Green Steel Maker Mulls IPO to Fund Expansion Plans
content: Stegra AB, which is building the world’s biggest green steel plant in northern Sweden, is doing initial work for an eventual public listing of shares because its expansion plans may need more funding than it can raise privately.

title: Prudential India Asset Manager Is Said to Near IPO Filing
content: Prudential Plc’s Indian asset-management venture is close to filing preliminary documents with the local regulator for a proposed initial public offering that may fetch as much as 100 billion rupees ($1.2 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Live: FTSE 100 Testing Record High, Pound Slides Below $1.35
Bloomberg: The China Show 06/11/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US, China Officials Agree on Plan That Awaits Xi, Trump Sign-Off
content: The US and China capped two days of high-stakes trade talks with a plan to revive the flow of sensitive goods — a framework now awaiting the blessing of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

title: Crude Oil Steadies as Traders Parse Signals on US Trade Policy
content: Oil steadied as traders digested a welter of headlines on US trade policy, including an appeal court ruling that US President Donald Trump can press on with his global tariffs.

title: It’s Never Too Early to Start a Trump Account
content: A $1,000 investment fund for kids, untouchable until they reach 18, is a worthy idea.

title: Gold Advances Even After US and China Agree to Ease Trade War
content: Gold advanced even after the US and China said they had agreed on a plan to ease trade tensions during talks in London.

title: Apollo to Tap Rich, Retail Clients in Asia for Asset Growth
content: Apollo Global Management Inc. said high-net-worth clients and access to retail investors are the biggest opportunities in Asia for growth in the coming years.

title: Bain, KKR Said to Be Second-Round Bidders for Sapporo Unit
content: Bain Capital, KKR & Co. and Lone Star are among investment firms that have advanced to the second round of bidding for the real estate unit of Sapporo Holdings Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Chinese Stocks Advance as Preliminary Trade Deal Eases Tensions
content: Chinese stocks rose on Wednesday, after the world’s two largest economies agreed on a plan to reduce trade tensions following a two-day meeting in London.

title: Singapore-Backed Realty Company Bets on India Entertainment Boom
content: Prestige Estates Projects Ltd., which ranks among India’s top five real estate developers by market value, is looking to sell more entertainment and dining spaces in malls while cutting back on apparel retailers, a top official said.

title: Apollo's Michelini on Japan Insurance, Consumer Trends
content: Apollo Global Management's Matthew Michelini says the Japanese insurance industry is "really interesting" right now and adds that "accessing retail consumers is one of the biggest opportunity sets." He discusses his views in a conversation with Sonali Basak at the Bloomberg Invest conference in Hong Kong. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Being a Bully on Trade Won’t Work Longer Term, Lagarde Warns
content: There’s no longer-term advantage to being a bully on global commerce, according to European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde.

title: The Euro Struggles to Win Over Czechs Going Slow on Adoption
content: The Czech central bank governor touted the benefits of his country’s currency, saying that the koruna puts it in a better position to moderate price-growth than the euro would.

title: Biotech Firm MediLink Is Said to Hire Banks for Hong Kong IPO
content: MediLink Therapeutics Ltd. has hired China International Capital Corp., JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Morgan Stanley for a planned initial public offering in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 11/6/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China’s Resort Island Hainan Braces for First Typhoon of Season
content: Hainan Island is bracing for the first typhoon of the season in the western Pacific, with the storm expected to dump heavy rain across parts of southern China as the system nears the coast.

title: Japan’s Longer Debt Attractive for Foreigners, Morgan Stanley Says
content: Foreign investors are looking with interest at longer-term Japanese bonds, while it remains uncertain when the government will adjust how much of the debt it sells, Morgan Stanley says.

title: Apollo: Trade Concern a Positive for Asia Private Credit
content: Apollo Global Management's Matthew Michelini says investors in Asia are now considering putting a portion of investment intended for the US into places like India and Australia. He speaks with Yvonne Man on the sidelines of the Bloomberg Invest conference in Hong Kong. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Falling Australian Iron Ore Quality Sparks Grade Benchmark Tweak
content: The iron ore industry’s key pricing benchmark for seaborne cargoes will be lowered as the quality of supplies from biggest exporter Australia worsens.

title: EU Aims for US Trade Talks to Extend Past Trump’s July Deadline
content: The European Union believes trade negotiations with the US could extend beyond President Donald Trump’s July 9 deadline, even as the speed of the talks has increased over the past week.

title: Swedish Support for Joining Euro Fades as Krona Strengthens
content: Swedes’ enthusiasm to adopt the euro fell for the first time in four and a half years after a recent run of strength for the krona, a survey showed.

title: US Assails Sanctions by UK, Allies on Top Israeli Officials
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio rebuked five allies over sanctions they imposed on two members of Israel’s cabinet as fissures between the US and its partners widen over the war in Gaza and the treatment of Palestinians.

title: India, US to Expedite Trade Talks Ahead of Trump’s Tariff Deadline
content: India and the US will expedite trade talks to conclude an agreement that includes “early wins” for both sides, an official said, as the two nations race to clinch a deal before Washington’s tit-for-tat tariffs kick in next month.

title: EU Ready for Second Attempt at Australia Trade Deal, Envoy Says
content: The European Union is ready and willing to make a second attempt at securing a free trade deal with Australia, EU Ambassador Gabriele Visentin said, while adding that the main obstacles to an accord that were identified in 2023 are largely unchanged.

title: US, China Officials Agree on Plan That Awaits Xi, Trump Sign-Off
content: The US and China capped two days of high-stakes trade talks with a plan to revive the flow of sensitive goods — a framework now awaiting the blessing of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

title: Chinese Stocks Advance as Preliminary Trade Deal Eases Tensions
content: Chinese stocks rose on Wednesday, after the world’s two largest economies agreed on a plan to reduce trade tensions following a two-day meeting in London.

title: Being a Bully on Trade Won’t Work Longer Term, Lagarde Warns
content: There’s no longer-term advantage to being a bully on global commerce, according to European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde.

title: North Korea Appears to Have Added to Its Nuclear Complex
content: North Korea appears to have constructed a new building within its main nuclear complex, satellite imagery showed, in what could be an additional enrichment facility to ramp up the country’s ability to produce nuclear weapons.

title: Pentagon Slashes in Half Its Request for Air Force F-35s
content: The Air Force has cut in half its request to Congress for its signature F-35s, dealing a blow to Lockheed Martin Corp., the top US defense contractor.

title: Downtown LA Under Curfew as Newsom Warns of Trump Overreach
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom accused President Donald Trump of misusing his power by mobilizing troops in Los Angeles and warned other states to prepare for similar unrest, as protests over immigration raids stretched into a fifth night and led to a curfew in parts of the city’s downtown.

title: Kirchner’s Ban From Office Marks New Chapter for Argentina
content: Argentina’s top court sidelined former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner from elections, likely ushering in a new political era in South America’s second biggest economy.

title: Malaysia’s Anwar Faces More Challenges Even as Lawsuit Paused
content: After more than two years of relative political stability in Malaysia, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim faces multiple hurdles that could fuel discontent within his ruling coalition.

title: Philippine Senators Send Duterte Impeachment Back to House
content: Prospects for a Senate trial of Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte were thrown into doubt late Tuesday after senators voted to return the articles of impeachment to the House to ensure they don’t breach the constitution.

title: Trump Poised to Repeal Biden Curbs on Power Plant Pollution
content: The Trump administration will propose scrapping Biden-era climate mandates requiring the nation’s power plants to curb planet-warming greenhouse gas emissions as soon as Wednesday, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: National Guard Providing Security for ICE Officers, US Says
content: National Guard troops are now protecting Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers in and around Los Angeles, marking an expansion of their duties since being deployed by President Donald Trump this week.

title: Trump Tariffs Can Stay in Effect Longer, Appeals Court Says
content: Donald Trump can continue to enforce his global tariffs for now, a federal appeals court held in a win for the president on one of his signature economic policies.

title: Traders See Cooling US-China Tensions Sparking Cautious Gains
content: Asia’s traders mostly shrugged off news of a preliminary US-China trade deal, with most looking for more details from the accord before making investment plans.

title: NJ’s Sherrill, Ciattarelli Win Primaries in Governor’s Race
content: New Jersey voters have chosen Mikie Sherrill to face off against Jack Ciattarelli, pitting a moderate Democrat against a Trump-endorsed Republican in the first gubernatorial election since last year’s presidential race.

title: NJ Congresswoman Indicted Over Scuffle at ICE Facility, US Says
content: A federal grand jury indicted a Democratic House lawmaker from Newark, New Jersey, over her confrontation with US immigration officers outside a private detention facility that is key to the Trump administration’s mass deportation plans, according to a prosecutor.

title: Key Lawmaker Questions Hegseth Decision to Slash Test Office
content: A top House Republican who oversees Pentagon spending expressed surprise and concern about Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s order last month to slash nearly half the staff of the Pentagon’s test oversight agency, even as the US embarks on major military initiatives including the F-47 fighter and the Golden Dome defensive system.

title: Associated Press Challenges Ruling Limiting White House Access
content: The Associated Press is challenging a ruling that allowed President Donald Trump to exclude the news agency from “restricted” spaces like the Oval Office and Air Force One.

title: Gabbard Warns Global Nuclear Annihilation Is Closer Than Ever
content: Tulsi Gabbard, the US director of national intelligence, released a video Tuesday warning that the world is closer to nuclear war than ever and accusing unnamed political elites of trying to foment conflict between world powers.

title: Starlink Is Best for Rural Airports, Not So Much for Urban Ones, Cruz Says
content: Urban airports should use fiber-optic communications while Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite service may be better for rural ones, Senator Ted Cruz said.

title: Marines Arrive in LA as Tensions Grow Over Immigration Raids
content: Marines deployed by President Donald Trump arrived in the Los Angeles area with orders to protect federal property and officers, as the city is gripped by tensions over anti-deportation protests.

title: ABC News Drops Correspondent Terry Moran Over Anti-Trump Post
content: Walt Disney Co.’s ABC News division said it parted ways with Washington-based correspondent Terry Moran over comments he made on social media over the weekend about President Donald Trump and White House Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller.

title: US Judge to Weigh Limiting Military Troops in LA on Thursday
content: California’s bid to limit military involvement in the Los Angeles immigration protests will be taken up by a judge Thursday, meaning that a pullback by the Trump administration before then is unlikely.

title: US Seeks to Halt Abrego Garcia Deportation Case After His Return
content: Days after Kilmar Abrego Garcia was brought back to the US to face human smuggling charges, the Trump administration asked a federal court to halt a lawsuit seeking answers over why the US hadn’t facilitated his return following his wrongful deportation to El Salvador.

title: Argentina’s Top Court Bans Kirchner From Office for Life
content: Argentina’s Supreme Court upheld former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner’s fraud conviction, ratifying her sentence to six years in prison as well as a lifelong ban on holding public office, according to the court ruling reviewed by Bloomberg.

title: How NYC’s Ranked-Choice Voting System Looms Over Mayoral Race
content: New York City’s mayoral contest has had plenty of drama ahead of the June 24 vote. The incumbent mayor, Eric Adams, decided not to participate in the Democratic primary in the wake of a corruption scandal and is running instead as an independent. The front-runner, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, is attempting a political comeback after leaving office in 2021 following multiple allegations of sexual harassment. And Cuomo’s closest challenger for the Democratic nomination is Zohran Mamdani,

title: South Africa Regulator to Decide on Musk’s Starlink
content: The Independent Communications Authority of South Africa will decide whether to award Elon Musk’s Starlink an operating license, a government minister said. Pretoria-born Musk indicated that he wants Starlink internet services to be made available in Africa’s largest economy, but he has refused to relinquish any equity in the business to comply with Black-empowerment rules. Bloomberg’s Loni Prinsloo reports.

title: Auto Parts Supplier Marelli Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
content: Marelli Holdings Co., the struggling auto parts supplier for Nissan Motor Co., Stellantis NV and other carmakers, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US as it seeks to slash its debt burden and restructure under new ownership.

title: Israeli Ministers Sanctioned Over Gaza Comments
content: The UK, Australia, Canada, New Zealand and Norway, sanctioned two Israeli government ministers, Itamar Ben Gvir and Bezalel Smotrich, for inciting violence against Palestinian communities. Bloomberg's Stuart Livingstone-Wallace reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: What to Expect From Reeves’ UK Spending Review
content: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will defend her fiscal choices in the spending review today, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government seeks to regain momentum after a faltering first year in power. Reeves is due to speak in the House of Commons, and will set out how funds raised in her tax-raising budget in October will be allocated between government departments. Bloomberg’s James Woolcock reports.

title: Bessent Emerges as Possible Fed Chair Contender
content: A growing chorus of advisers inside and outside the Trump administration are pushing for US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent to serve as the next chair of the Federal Reserve. President Donald Trump said Friday he would name a successor “very soon” to replace Jerome Powell, whose term as Fed chair ends in May 2026. Bloomberg’s Valerie Tytel reports.

title: US, China Trade Talks: What We Know
content: American and Chinese negotiators agreed to a preliminary plan to ease trade tensions between the two nations during talks in London. The delegations will now take the proposal back to their respective leaders. Bloomberg’s Lizzy Burden breaks down the situation.

title: US-China Deal Reached, LA to Enact Curfew, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 0:00

content: Source: Bloomberg, 17:15

title: US and China Agree on Plan to Cool Trade Tensions
content: Good morning. The US and China agree on a plan to ease trade tensions. Scott Bessent is said to be a contender for the US Federal Reserve chair. And Nintendo’s Switch 2 sales smash a record. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: EU Targets Russian Banks, Energy With New Sanctions
content: Welcome to the Brussels Edition, Bloomberg’s daily briefing on what matters most in the heart of the European Union.

title: Land Rovers, Houses and Whisky: Gold Rally Brings Riches to Rural Zimbabwe
content: Surge in gold prices is driving a boom in Africa’s small-scale production

title: Wall Street Banks Are Battling for Japan’s Top Young Talent
content: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: Global firms are slugging it out to hire bankers in Japan as inflation returns and trading surges.

title: India Plans Air Conditioner Temperature Rules to Save Power
content: India is working with appliance makers to standardize the cooling range of air conditioners to ensure that the minimum temperature is not set below 20C (68F), in an effort to cut the energy use of these power guzzlers.

title: Trump Tariffs to Stay, US-China Agree to Framework, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:31

title: Alphabet’s AI Critics Are Asking the Wrong Questions
content: Recent shareholder proposals show how inadequate tech and AI governance really is.

title: California’s Newsom Says Democracy Is Under Assault
content:
“Democracy is under assault."

California Governor Gavin Newsom has accused Trump of misusing his power and warned rest of the country to prepare for unrest as LA imposes a curfew after protests over immigration raids. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US-China Trade 'Framework', Downtown LA Under Curfew, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:29

title: California Governor Says 'Democracy Is Under Assault'
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom said US "democracy is under assault" during a brief televised address on Tuesday. Newsom said Trump had bypassed state and local officials to stage what he called an unlawful and inflammatory military deployment. “California may be first — but it clearly will not end here,” Newsom said. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Asia: US, China Set Trade Framework (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 15:36

content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:03

title: Morgan Stanley Australia CEO Says IPOs, Deals Are Returning
content: Morgan Stanley’s Australia chief said he’s seeing a return of initial public offerings and merger activity after a “horrible” first half as the country’s stability draws overseas capital.

title: US, China Says Consensus Reached on Trade Framework, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:31

title: California Asks Court to Stop LA Troop Deployment | Balance of Power: Late Edition 6/10/2025
content: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Krishnamoorthi (D) Illinois shares his thoughts on the second day of trade talks between the United States and China. Janet Napolitano, former Homeland Security Secretary under the Obama Administration, weighs in on the Los Angeles protests and the 4,000 National Guard troops and 700 US Marines in the city and what she would have done if the President asked her to deploy these troops. US Senator Ted Cruz, a Texas Republican, discusses the tax-cut package passed by the House and the anti-deportation protests in Los Angeles. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Wall Street Heavyweights Grow Super Assets
content: Morning all, Rich Henderson in Bloomberg’s Melbourne bureau with the latest headlines...Today’s must-reads:• Wall Street giants grow super assets• Airwallex co-founder’s net worth surges• First female Treasury secretary

title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily: Steel Deal Near (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 39:51

title: China Trade Talks, US-Mexico Nears Steel Deal, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:36

title: Space Firm Voyager Raises $383 Million in IPO Priced Above Range
content: Voyager Technologies Inc. raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering Tuesday, pricing its shares above a marketed range.

title: Militarization of Civil Protest: Napolitano on Trump, LA Protests
content: Janet Napolitano, former Homeland Security Secretary under the Obama Administration and former Governor of Arizona, weighs in on the Los Angeles protests and the 4,000 National Guard troops and 700 US Marines in the city and what she would have done if the President asked her to deploy these troops. Janet also talks about whether or not what is happening in Los Angeles justifies needing more ICE and Border Patrol agents. She speaks with Kailey Leinz and Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Newsom Warns Trump May Use Soldiers on Immigration Raids
content: Get caught up.

title: Nintendo Switch 2 Sets Sales Record in Boon for Games Sector
content: Nintendo Co. sold 3.5 million-plus units of the Switch 2 in just four days, a record-breaking start for the company’s first new console in eight years.

title: Proxima Fusion Raises €130 Million to Become European Nuclear Champion
content: The company will use the funds to develop superconducting magnets that are a key component of the technology.

title: Hong Kong Bans Video Game in Further National Security Push
content: Hong Kong invoked national security laws to ban a video game for the first time, broadening the use of the set of legislation to fend off perceived threats and requiring internet service providers to comply.

title: Alphabet’s AI Critics Are Asking the Wrong Questions
content: Recent shareholder proposals show how inadequate tech and AI governance really is.

title: Thiel-Backed Crypto Startup Bullish Files for US IPO, FT Says
content: Bullish Global, the cryptoasset exchange whose backers include billionaire Peter Thiel, has filed for a US initial public offering, the Financial Times reported.

title: GQG’s Jain Cuts AI Exposure on Data Center Woes, Backs Utilities
content: Rajiv Jain, manager of the $23 billion GQG Partners Emerging Markets Equity Fund, is trimming exposure to investments linked to artificial intelligence on concerns of waning data-center demand, while remaining bullish on utilities.

title: Starlink Is Best for Rural Airports, Not So Much for Urban Ones, Cruz Says
content: Urban airports should use fiber-optic communications while Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite service may be better for rural ones, Senator Ted Cruz said.

title: Space Firm Voyager Raises $383 Million in IPO Priced Above Range
content: Voyager Technologies Inc. raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering Tuesday, pricing its shares above a marketed range.

title: Zuckerberg Recruits for New Meta AGI Group | Bloomberg Tech 6/10/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Meta’s plans for a new ‘Superintelligence’ AI group. Plus, Apple expands its deal with OpenAI. And the CEO of United Launch Alliance says NASA has alternatives to Elon Musk’s SpaceX. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: EchoStar Bondholders Huddle With Law Firm Akin Gump as Default Looms
content: Bondholders to EchoStar Corp. are working with law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld and investment bank Centerview Partners LLC as the telecommunications company mulls a potential bankruptcy filing amid a Federal Communications Commission probe, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Amazon Security Chief Urges Hands-Off Approach to AI Regulation
content: Amazon.com Inc.’s chief security officer joined officials at other major tech companies in calling for fewer regulations in artificial intelligence, warning that government involvement in this rapidly emerging area risks narrowing the scope of the company’s work.

title: Zuckerberg Is Personally Recruiting New ‘Superintelligence’ AI Team at Meta
content: Mark Zuckerberg, frustrated with Meta Platforms Inc.’s shortfalls in AI, is assembling a team of experts to achieve artificial general intelligence, recruiting from a brain trust of AI researchers and engineers who’ve met with him in recent weeks at his homes in Lake Tahoe and Palo Alto.

title: Meta’s Threads Testing New Private Messaging Feature
content: Threads, the Meta Platforms Inc. social network that rivals Elon Musk’s X, is testing a new messaging feature for users to interact privately on the service.

title: Whole Foods Supplier Hack Leaves Empty Shelves, Stalls Forklifts
content: United Natural Foods Inc., a grocery distributor for Amazon Inc.’s Whole Foods Market, is working to bring systems back online by June 15 and resume product deliveries after a cyberattack disrupted its operations, leaving some store shelves barren of ice cream, bread and other goods.

title: How Fintech Founder Rejected Stripe Buyout Before Building $775 Million Fortune
content: Seven years ago, Airwallex co-founder Jack Zhang walked away from what looked like the deal of a lifetime. Stripe Inc. was offering to buy his firm for $1.2 billion and legendary Sequoia investor Michael Moritz was urging him to accept.

title: Publicis Wins $1.7 Billion Mars Advertising Account From WPP
content: Publicis Groupe SA has won a major new client, snagging the $1.7 billion ad portfolio for M&Ms and Snickers owner Mars Inc. from WPP Plc, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Data Centers Prompt US to Boost Power-Usage Forecast by 92%
content: US data centers are rapidly driving up demand for power, with the official forecast for electricity consumption next year almost doubling in the past month.

title: Musk’s Banker Michael Grimes Sells SpaceX, Anduril for Trump Job
content: Michael Grimes, the veteran technology investment banker who helped Elon Musk buy Twitter in 2022, reported assets worth as much as $98 million in a financial disclosure as part of his new role at the Commerce Department.

title: Snap’s First Consumer AR ‘Specs’ Glasses Will Arrive in 2026
content: Snap Inc. plans to launch its first consumer pair of augmented-reality glasses next year, beating a planned release from rival Meta Platforms Inc. by several months.

title: Qualcomm Demonstrates New Processor for AI-Based Smart Glasses
content: Qualcomm Inc., the top maker of smartphone processors, is making a bigger push into smart glasses with low-power components that can run artificial intelligence software.

title: Sonos Upgrades Ace Headphones as Part of Software Turnaround
content: Sonos Inc. released a major software update for its Ace wireless headphones on Tuesday, as it works to rebuild its reputation following a disastrous app overhaul last year.

title: Academic Publishers Sign AI Deals as US Cuts Research Grants
content: Academic publishers are rushing to sign licensing deals with artificial intelligence companies, carving out a new revenue stream as US research funding cuts dim their outlook.

title: Retail Stock Investors Can Now Imitate the Pros With AI Trading Tools
content: Artificial intelligence trading tools that analyze reams of data and build portfolios are already shaking up Wall Street. But as they increasingly become available to retail investors, the entire stock market is in for a seismic transformation.

title: CoreWeave and Palantir Get Meme Stock Comparisons as Shares Soar
content: The surging shares of CoreWeave Inc. and Palantir Technologies Inc. are drawing comparisons to meme stocks — whose rapid gains are fueled by retail trader fervor more than financial performance.

title: Cisco Updates Networking Products in Bid to Tap AI-Fueled Demand
content: With data-transfer bottlenecks threatening to slow AI systems, Cisco aims to speed things up

title: Paramount Global to Cut 3.5% of US Workforce Due to Decline of Cable-TV Industry
content: Paramount Global plans to cut several hundred employees on Tuesday due to a continuing decline in the cable-TV industry and the broader economic landscape.

title: ‘SmartLess’ Podcast Hosts Are Starting a Phone Company
content: Actors see opportunity in mobile service with lower data

title: BP Puts AI at Heart of Efforts to Boost Performance
content: When engineers prepare to drill for oil, they know the spot deep underground where the well must end and can choose their starting point, but there are many possible routes in between.

title: Switch 2 Resellers Drive Thriving Market in Japan Despite Crackdown
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Mayumi Negishi reports on the backlash against scalpers who are finding ways to obtain and sell the new Switch 2 game console outside the authorized retail outlets.

title: Tencent Music to Buy Ximalaya to Drive Online Media Ambitions
content: Tencent Music Entertainment Group has agreed to buy Chinese podcasting startup Ximalaya Inc. for $1.3 billion in cash plus an issuance of stock, a deal that propels its ambition to become China’s answer to Spotify.

title: EU Aims for US Trade Talks to Extend Past Trump’s July Deadline
content: The European Union believes trade negotiations with the US could extend beyond President Donald Trump’s July 9 deadline, even as the speed of the talks has increased over the past week.

title: Hungary’s Inflation Rate Rises Again in Central Bank Challenge
content: Hungarian inflation accelerated in May for the first time in three months, underscoring central bankers’ challenge in returning consumer price growth toward their target.

title: Swedish Support for Joining Euro Fades as Krona Strengthens
content: Swedes’ enthusiasm to adopt the euro fell for the first time in four and a half years after a recent run of strength for the krona, a survey showed.

title: South Korea Household Loans Climb, Adding to BOK, Regulator Concern
content: South Korea’s bank lending to households climbed the most in nine months, an increase that adds to concerns over growing debt at the central bank and the financial regulator as policymakers assess how much support to give the sputtering economy.

title: India, US to Expedite Trade Talks Ahead of Trump’s Tariff Deadline
content: India and the US will expedite trade talks to conclude an agreement that includes “early wins” for both sides, an official said, as the two nations race to clinch a deal before Washington’s tit-for-tat tariffs kick in next month.

title: US, China Officials Agree on Plan That Awaits Xi, Trump Sign-Off
content: The US and China capped two days of high-stakes trade talks with a plan to revive the flow of sensitive goods — a framework now awaiting the blessing of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

title: Land Rovers, Houses and Whisky: Gold Rally Brings Riches to Rural Zimbabwe
content: Surge in gold prices is driving a boom in Africa’s small-scale production

title: Being a Bully on Trade Won’t Work Longer Term, Lagarde Warns
content: There’s no longer-term advantage to being a bully on global commerce, according to European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde.

title: The Euro Struggles to Win Over Czechs Going Slow on Adoption
content: The Czech central bank governor touted the benefits of his country’s currency, saying that the koruna puts it in a better position to moderate price-growth than the euro would.

title: North Korea Appears to Have Added to Its Nuclear Complex
content: North Korea appears to have constructed a new building within its main nuclear complex, satellite imagery showed, in what could be an additional enrichment facility to ramp up the country’s ability to produce nuclear weapons.

title: New Zealand Immigration Decline May Impede Economic Recovery
content: New Zealand immigration fell to a two-and-a-half year low in April, adding to risks of a slower-than-expected economic recovery that could prompt more interest-rate cuts.

title: RBNZ Says Adrian Orr Resigned as Governor Over Funding Cut
content: New Zealand’s central bank said former governor Adrian Orr resigned over government cuts to the bank’s funding.

title: US Inflation Seen Picking Up With Some Tariff Pass-Through
content: Forecasters say underlying US inflation likely picked up in May, reflecting a modest impact from tariff pass-through for goods that are mostly imported, while some services like airfares saw smaller price gains or outright declines.

title: Most BOJ Watchers Expect Slower Pace in Reducing Bond Purchases
content: A majority of Bank of Japan watchers expect officials to slow their pace of reductions in government bond buying and keep interest rates unchanged at next week’s policy meeting, according to a Bloomberg survey.

title: Bessent Returns to Washington as US-China Talks Stretch On
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent departed trade talks with China late Tuesday in London, as delegations continued to negotiate over key tech and industrial exports and deescalating their trade war.

title: Traders Boost Bets on Just One 2025 Fed Cut Ahead of CPI Data
content: Traders are increasingly betting that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates only once this year amid signs of resilient growth and sticky inflation.

title: Ghana Seeks to Shield Budget Goal as Nurses Strike Over Pay Deal
content: Ghana has asked its nurses to call off a strike and accept the implementation of a wage deal next year as it seeks to protect the 2025 budget from unplanned slippages.

title: Canada’s Economy in ‘Suspended Animation’ During Trade War, CIBC Chief Says
content: Canada’s economy is stuck in a state of “suspended animation,” with major new investments largely on hold, but may start to recover in the coming months, according to the head of one of the country’s largest banks.

title: South Africa Names Rugby Captain, Business Leaders to National Dialogue Panel
content: South Africa’s president set up a panel that includes business leaders, actors and the captain of its national rugby team to guide a dialogue on the country’s future development path.

title: ECB’s Stournaras Says Stable EU Policy Draws Investors to Euro
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Yannis Stournaras said the US’s unpredictable behavior on tariffs is undermining the dollar’s status as the global reserve currency and is an opportunity for the euro, according to an interview in Handelsblatt.

title: Tariffs Hit Canadian Firm That Made World Trade Center’s Spire
content: ADF Group Inc., a Canadian maker of steel structures, reported lower earnings and slowed its production partly because of the uncertainty caused by US tariffs.

title: Chile’s Matthei Details Plan to Save Billions in Public Spending
content: Chile presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei laid out plans to save state coffers $1.5 billion annually by combating fraud and revamping government purchases, following a scandal over irregular medical leave by public employees.

title: Bessent Emerging as a Contender to Succeed Fed’s Powell
content: A growing chorus of advisers inside and outside the Trump administration are pushing another name to serve as the next chair of the Federal Reserve: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.

title: Morgan Stanley Urges Bond Traders to Bet on Easing Inflation
content: Morgan Stanley interest-rate strategists say a surprise ebb in inflation data due this week and declining oil prices stand to reel in the bond market’s expectations for inflation over the next two years.

title: Key Republican Senator Expects ‘Revenge’ Tax to Be Delayed
content: Republican Senator Thom Tillis said he expects the implementation of the Section 899 “revenge tax” in President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending bill to be delayed as it faces pushback from Wall Street and businesses.

title: Zimbabwe’s ZiG Currency: How Does It Work, and Can It Last?
content: Zimbabwe’s gold-backed currency, the ZiG, is already suffering from the same lack of credibility that doomed its predecessors.

title: Kenya Cuts Key Rate for Sixth Time in Row to Prop Up Economy
content: Kenya’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate for the sixth time in a row to help shore up the economy as inflation is expected to remain benign.

title: Brits Hoarding Cash Amid Global Volatility, Says Bank of England Official
content: The rising number of British banknotes in circulation suggests households are hoarding cash as they face times of extreme uncertainty and the possibility of network outages, according to a Bank of England official.

title: Argentina Bonds Rise on New Measures to Lure Dollars
content: Argentina’s bonds gained Tuesday after the central bank unveiled a slew of measures aimed at helping the South American nation amass more hard-currency reserves, firepower the country needs to meet dollar debt payments.

title: ECB Can Wait Until September to Even Discuss Next Rate Move, Vujcic Says
content: The European Central Bank should wait until at least September to have an in-depth discussion about an interest-rate move, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic.

title: KKR’s Final Offer Values Landlord Assura at £1.7 Billion
content: A consortium led by KKR & Co. raised its bid in a takeover battle for Assura Plc, valuing the UK healthcare landlord at £1.7 billion ($2.3 billion).

title: Zara Owner Inditex Posts Slowing Sales, Warns of Forex Pain
content: Zara-owner Inditex SA reported a muted start to the second quarter and warned that foreign-exchange headwinds could have a greater impact on results this year than anticipated. Shares tumbled.

title: Auto Parts Supplier Marelli Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
content: Marelli Holdings Co., the struggling auto parts supplier for Nissan Motor Co., Stellantis NV and other carmakers, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US as it seeks to slash its debt burden and restructure under new ownership.

title: General Mills Is Said to Weigh Sale of China Häagen-Dazs Stores
content: General Mills Inc. is considering selling its Häagen-Dazs ice-cream stores in China, according to people familiar with the situation, as the US food company faces challenges with sales in the country.

title: How a Rice Shortage Spurred a National Crisis in Japan
content: Shops and restaurants have hiked the price of their rice dishes and with an election looming the rice crisis could weigh heavily on voters.

title: Qantas Says Singapore Airport Costs Fueled Jetstar Asia Cut
content: The “unsustainable” rising costs of operating from Singapore’s Changi airport were partly to blame for the closure of Qantas Airways Ltd.’s low-cost subsidiary Jetstar Asia, executives said.

title: BYD Vows Timely Supplier Payments as China Scrutinizes Automakers
content: BYD Co. and Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co. joined several of China’s government-backed automakers in a pledge to standardize bill payment for their suppliers to 60 days as authorities’ scrutiny of the industry’s health shifts to supply chain financing.

title: Labubu Doll Fetches $150,000 at China Auction as Demand Rages
content: A human-sized Labubu doll fetched a whopping 1.08 million yuan ($150,000) at an auction in Beijing, in a testament to the popularity of the collectible toy flaunted by celebrities.

title: India Plans Air Conditioner Temperature Rules to Save Power
content: India is working with appliance makers to standardize the cooling range of air conditioners to ensure that the minimum temperature is not set below 20C (68F), in an effort to cut the energy use of these power guzzlers.

title: Main China Steel Group Warns EV Price War Is Punishing Mills
content: China’s main steel industry group has warned an electric vehicle price war is hurting mills and deepening their financial woes.

title: Starbucks Adding Assistant Managers to Run Stores More Smoothly
content: Starbucks Corp. is planning to add at least one full-time assistant manager to most of its company-operated US locations, giving store managers more latitude to focus on tasks such as recruiting and managing schedules.

title: China Nudges Pig Farmers to Restrain Supply After Prices Slump
content: China is seeking to control hog numbers and curb pork production, in a bid to support prices of the country’s favorite meat and ease deflationary pressures in the economy.

title: Musk Sets June 22 Launch Date for Tesla’s Robotaxi Service
content: Elon Musk said Tesla Inc. has set June 22 as a tentative launch date for the start of its robotaxi network.

title: India’s State Oil Refiners Plan Tanker Order for Domestic Use
content: India’s state-run refiners are planning to order 10 domestically-built vessels to transport fuels around the country as the government pushes ahead with its ambition to expand the shipbuilding industry.

title: Starbucks Enters the Protein Wars With Test of New Drink Option
content: Starbucks Corp. is testing a protein option in its drink lineup, wading into a red-hot trend as it seeks to reverse a string of sales declines.

title: GM Dodges Tariffs With Production Shift to US From Mexico
content: General Motors Co. plans to invest $4 billion in its US plants over the next two years to boost output of some of its top-selling gas-powered vehicles as the company works to manage President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: RFK Jr. Says He Won’t Put Anti-Vaxxers on Key Vaccine Panel
content: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. pledged to bring in “highly credentialed physicians” and “not anti-vaxxers” to fill newly vacant slots on an influential committee that advises the US government on vaccine policy.

title: Deere Eyes Brazil Machinery Sales Beating Europe in Coming Years
content: Deere & Co expects sales of machinery such as tractors and combines to Brazil will overtake those to Europe in the next five to 10 years, eventually making it the company’s second-biggest market.

title: How RFK Jr.’s CDC Ousters Upend the Future of Vaccines
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., US secretary of health and human services, dismissed all 17 members that make up a key committee advising the US government on vaccine safety and policy, saying that removing the entire panel was the only way to restore public confidence in vaccine science. The move, announced in an opinion piece on June 9, added to the confusion about whether Americans would have access to vaccines for diseases from polio and measles to Covid and the flu.

title: China’s Bankers Ditch Global Hotel Chains as Travel Budgets Bite
content: These days, Shanghai-based banker Jason Zhang can no longer stay at the Westin hotel in downtown Beijing’s financial district after his company cut its travel budget. Instead, he had to settle for a cheaper domestic hotel chain.

title: Wall Street Wins More of Australia’s $2.7 Trillion Pension Pot
content: Australia’s pension funds are rapidly boosting their allocations to the heavyweights of US finance as rivalry heats up for access to the country’s A$4.1 trillion ($2.7 trillion) retirement pot.

title: Paul Weiss Strategy Tested as Partners Exit Post-Trump Deal
content: Paul Weiss leader Brad Karp spent more than a decade building his firm’s deals practice to an elite level matching its litigation work. A deal he struck with President Donald Trump threatens the balance between the two.

title: Ascend to Pay Up to $2.46 Million in Bankruptcy Bonuses to Executives
content: Ascend Performance Materials Inc., a bankrupt maker of industrial nylon, won court permission to pay 11 executives a total of as much $2.46 million in bonuses as the company works to cut debt and reorganize itself while in court protection.

title: Alexander Brothers Plead Not Guilty to New Criminal Charges
content: Former star real estate brokers Tal and Oren Alexander and their brother Alon Alexander pleaded not guilty in New York to a string of fresh charges filed in their criminal sex-trafficking case as they continued to fight for release from custody.

title: Smucker Falls Most in Nearly 40 Years as Tariffs Hit Profit
content: JM Smucker Co. declined the most in nearly four decades after saying US tariffs increasing costs in its coffee business will hurt profit, continuing a challenging run for the biggest US packaged food producers.

title: Ghana Seeks to Shield Budget Goal as Nurses Strike Over Pay Deal
content: Ghana has asked its nurses to call off a strike and accept the implementation of a wage deal next year as it seeks to protect the 2025 budget from unplanned slippages.

title: Lilly Pacts Prohibit Telehealth Sales of Copycat Zepbound
content: Eli Lilly & Co. will only work with telehealth firms that agree to stop selling copycat versions of weight-loss drugs, diminishing the likelihood of a partnership with one most visible players in the industry, Hims & Hers Health Inc.

title: Victoria’s Secret Investor Slams ‘Disastrous’ Board Decisions
content: One of Victoria’s Secret & Co.’s biggest investors called for a board overhaul after accusing the company of “continued mismanagement” and “disastrous board-level decisions.”

title: Whole Foods Supplier Hack Leaves Empty Shelves, Stalls Forklifts
content: United Natural Foods Inc., a grocery distributor for Amazon Inc.’s Whole Foods Market, is working to bring systems back online by June 15 and resume product deliveries after a cyberattack disrupted its operations, leaving some store shelves barren of ice cream, bread and other goods.

title: Judge Refuses to Block NYC Broker-Fee Law Starting June 11
content: A federal judge refused to block a New York City law that would require landlords — rather than their tenants — to pay fees for hiring listing brokers, clearing the way for the measure to take effect tomorrow.

title: Anduril CEO Palmer Luckey says the defense tech company will 'definitely' go public
content: Defense tech startup Anduril Industries will eventually go public, according to founder and CEO Palmer Luckey.

title: Trump says D.C. military parade protesters will be met with 'very heavy force'
content: Trump's warning comes after he deployed National Guard troops and Marines to Los Angeles in response to protests over immigration enforcement efforts.

title: Trump deployment of National Guard, Marines to LA will cost $134 million: Pentagon official
content: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defended the necessity of deploying the troops to Los Angeles, which he said would last 60 days.

title: Apple's WWDC underwhelms on AI, but software gets biggest facelift in over a decade
content: Apple investors waiting for the company to make a big push in artificial intelligence didn't have much reason for excitement at WWDC.

title: Amazon Kuiper second satellite launch delayed by ULA due to weather
content: The second launch of Amazon's Kuiper internet satellites is now scheduled for June 16, instead of Friday.

title: RFK Jr.'s firing of CDC vaccine panel undermines science, could threaten public health, experts say
content: Some experts say the move undermines science, disrupts a trusted regulatory process and could sow public distrust in vaccinations and federal health agencies.

title: Former Wall Street analyst building market AI on why stock pickers won't go extinct
content: Former Morgan Stanley analyst and AlphaSense CEO Jack Kokko builds gen AI models that do Wall Street analyst work, but he isn't worried about their future.

title: Snap to launch smaller, lighter augmented reality Specs smartglasses in 2026
content: Snap plans to release the sixth-generation of its augmented reality glasses, now dubbed Specs, next year.

title: Elon Musk says he regrets some social media posts he made about Trump
content: Elon Musk on Wednesday said he regretted some of the social media posts he made last week during an explosive public dispute with U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Dollar divorce? Asia's shift away from the U.S. dollar is picking up pace
content: A mix of geopolitical uncertainties, monetary shifts, and currency hedging is prompting a meaningful move toward de-dollarization across the region.

title: Zara owner Inditex flags slowing summer sales as quarterly revenues miss expectations
content: Zara owner Inditex on Wednesday posted weaker-than-expected first quarter sales while flagging a slower start to the summer season than last year

title: The rise of artificial intelligence can make college degrees 'out of date': Upskill in AI or fall behind, says expert
content: "In AI-exposed fields, what matters is increasingly what people can do today, not what they studied in the past," according to PwC's AI Jobs Barometer report.

title: U.S. online stores put 'out of stock' signs as Nintendo Switch 2 sales hit record highs
content: Nintendo said it sold over 3.5 million units of its flagship Switch 2 gaming system in the four days since release, a record-breaking start for the company.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla robotaxi rides in Austin 'tentatively' set to begin June 22
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said in a post on X on Tuesday that the first self-driving Tesla will reach a customer's house on June 28.

title: China, U.S. officials reach agreement for allowing rare-earth, tech trade. Now it's up to Trump and Xi
content: The U.S. and China have reached consensus on trade, representatives from both sides said after high-level talks in London.

title: A frustrated Zuckerberg makes his biggest AI bet as Meta nears $14 billion stake in Scale AI, hires founder Wang
content: Meta's Mark Zuckerberg is bringing in Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang to help the social media company better execute on its AI ambitions.

title: Tesla rallies on robotaxi hopes as fear over Musk-Trump feud subsides
content: Tesla rallied for a third straight day, pushing the stock close to where it was trading before last week's spat between Elon Musk and President Trump.

title: GM to invest $4 billion in U.S. plants amid tariffs for Mexican-produced vehicles
content: GM plans to invest $4 billion in three American assembly plants, including moving or increasing production of two Mexican-produced vehicles to U.S. plants.

title: ABC News won’t renew Terry Moran contract after Trump, Miller 'hater' social media post
content: ABC News correspondent Terry Moran was under fire from Trump administration officials for the post on X targeting Trump and Stephen Miller.

content: Starbucks will launch "Green Dot Assist" in stores in the U.S. and Canada in fiscal 2026.

title: Google overhauls internal learning platform to focus on AI, 'business priorities'
content: The overhaul of the platform will include courses focused on AI tools and 'business priorities.'

title: California asks judge to quickly block Trump troop deployments to LA
content: Trump has authorized the deployment of 4,000 California National Guard troops and about 700 Marines to LA, despite Gov. Gavin Newsom's objections.

title: Inflation readings and Treasury auctions to test the bond market. Here's what to expect
content: Together, the results could have important implications for the direction of the economy and Federal Reserve interest rate policy.

content: CNBC reveals the 2025 Disruptor 50 list led by companies benefiting from the AI investment boom and exponentially growing their businesses.

content: Defense contractor Anduril is the No. 1 2025 CNBC Disruptor 50 company as the ties between Silicon Valley technology and the U.S. military increase.

content: Electric vehicle makers in China, led by the country's market leader BYD, have been engaged in a bruising price war.

title: Snap to launch smaller, lighter augmented reality Specs smartglasses in 2026
content: Snap plans to release the sixth-generation of its augmented reality glasses, now dubbed Specs, next year.

title: World Bank sharply cuts global growth outlook on trade turbulence
content: "This would mark the slowest rate of global growth since 2008, aside from outright global recessions," the World Bank said of its forecast.

title: FanDuel adds 50-cent surcharge on Illinois bets to offset state taxes, DraftKings may follow
content: The new tax is applied to each wager that a sportsbook accepts — 25 cents per bet for the first 20 million wagers, 50 cents per wager after that.

title: Immigrant framed for Trump threats can be released on bond, judge says
content: The Homeland Security Department still wants Ramon Morales-Reyes deported despite conceding he did not write threatening letters about President Donald Trump.

title: Boeing airplane orders rise to highest level since late 2023 ahead of Paris Air Show
content: Boeing booked 303 gross orders in May, the most since December 2023.

title: IBM announces new quantum processor, plan for Starling supercomputer by 2029
content: Part of the company's plan involves the new IBM Quantum Nighthawk processor, which is set to release later this year.

title: Paramount to cut 3% of U.S. workforce as it deepens cost-cutting
content: It's the latest round of layoffs at Paramount as it contends with cord-cutting and prepares to merge with Skydance Media.

title: As GOP weighs Obamacare cuts, the party's constituents are more likely to use marketplace coverage, poll finds
content: Republicans are considering a massive domestic policy bill that would slash funding for Affordable Care Act exchanges. But many GOP voters rely on them.

title: Meta forming new AI lab helmed by Scale AI CEO Alex Wang, report says
content: Meta is forming a new artificial intelligence research lab dedicated to "superintelligence," according to a report.

title: DoubleLine’s Gundlach says to buy international stocks on the dollar's 'secular decline'
content: The widely-followed investor noted that foreigners invested in the United States could be holding back on committing more capital due to geopolitical concern.

title: Why BlackRock's smallest deal of 2024 may end up being its most consequential
content: Larry Fink has said BlackRock's Preqin acquisition is "probably the most significant thing we have done in terms of expanding the profile of private markets."

content: For all the stock market drama this year, investors' portfolio balances may not look too different from when President Donald Trump entered office in January.

content: President Donald Trump's "big beautiful" bill could make it harder to claim the earned income tax credit. Here's who could be impacted.

title: Multiple Prongs to Bearish Dollar Trade: 3-Minute MLIV
content: Anna Edwards, Kriti Gupta and Mark Cudmore break down today's key themes for analysts and investors on "Bloomberg: The Opening Trade."  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Toho Titanium Shares Jump as JX Metals Mulls Unwinding
content: Toho Titanium Co. shares surged after parent JX Advanced Metals Corp. said it’s considering ways to unwind the listing of the titanium unit as Japan’s complex system of subsidiaries comes under scrutiny.

title: Medical Tech Firm Brainlab Announces Plan for Frankfurt IPO
content: Medical technology company Brainlab AG announced plans for an initial public offering on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, becoming the latest German company to seek a listing this year.

title: Can US Catch Up to China's Rare Earths Dominance?
content:
US Critical Materials Executive Director Harvey Kaye says the US should do everything it can to ramp up its rare earth processing infrastructure.
On Bloomberg's Insight with Haslinda Amin, he also said the US could probably catch up to China's rare earths production in five years. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Pares Mideast-Driven Surge as Trade Tensions Flare Up Again
content: Oil edged lower — after jumping more than 4% on Wednesday — as traders tracked tensions in the Middle East and the latest moves in US trade policy.

title: Romanian Inflation Climbs to One-Year High as Leu Hit Record Low
content: Romanian inflation accelerated in May after the leu’s decline to a record low during a recent political crisis boosted costs of goods and services.

title: Trump Issues Fresh Tariff Threat | Bloomberg: The China Show 06/12/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/12/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Dollar, Stock Futures Fall on Trump Tariff Threat: Markets Wrap
content: Equity-index futures fell along with the dollar after President Donald Trump said he will set unilateral tariff rates within two weeks, dialing up trade tensions once again. Haven assets such as Treasuries and gold rose.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu Dodges Early Election as Iran Tensions Rise
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government survived an attempt by opposition parties to dissolve parliament early Thursday, as tensions spiked over Iran’s nuclear program.

title: Ant Unit to Seek Stablecoin Permits in Hong Kong, Singapore
content: Jack Ma-backed Ant Group Co.’s international unit is planning to apply for stablecoin licenses in Singapore and Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: The Asia Trade 12/6/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Economy Shrank More Than Expected in April
India’s RBI Winds Down Offshore Currency Tool as Strategy Shifts
content: India’s central bank has scaled back its use of a key tool it deployed last year to counter the strong dollar, according to people familiar with the matter, reflecting a change in the authority’s intervention strategy under its new leadership.

title: Japan Complains After China Fighter Jet Buzzes Patrol Plane
content: Tokyo has complained to Beijing after a Chinese fighter jet tailed a Japanese patrol aircraft over the weekend, flying as close as 45 meters from the aircraft, according to Japan’s Defense Ministry.

title: Korean Assets Draw Foreign Inflows on Election Clarity
content: Foreign funds are piling into South Korean stocks and bonds suggesting a resurgence in investor confidence in Asia’s fourth-biggest economy as political clarity returns after the election of Lee Jae-myung as president.

title: Waiting for the Fed All Summer Long
content: Inflation is still lurking, and there’s little point getting out too far in front of tariffs.

title: Australian Regulators Say Global Fragmentation Is Accelerating
content: Australian regulators say recent international developments appear to be accelerating the pace of global fragmentation, increasing complexity and volatility.

title: Vietnam Trade Envoy Meets Nike, Walmart in US Tariff Deal Push
content: Vietnam’s trade minister met with executives from Nike Inc and Walmart Inc as part of a major charm offensive targeting US businesses, aiming to rally support ahead of high-stakes trade negotiations to avoid steep tariffs.

title: China Found World’s Pain Point on Trade — and Will Use It Again
content: For months Donald Trump pushed tariffs and trade restrictions on China to unprecedented levels, part of a strategy to force Xi Jinping into talks the US president expected would help cut the trade deficit and boost American manufacturing.

title: Investor Rush for India Exposure Revs Up Block Deals, IPOs
content: India’s market for share sales is warming up after a several dull months, as companies and shareholders cash in on a buoyant stock market.

title: Airbus Sees Global Aircraft Fleet Doubling by 2044, Led by India
content: Airbus SE predicted the global commercial aircraft fleet will double in size to almost 50,000 planes over the next 20 years, spurred by rapid growth in markets like India, where a rising middle class increasingly takes to air travel.

title: With Friends Like Brazil, OPEC+ Doesn’t Need Enemies
content: It’s clear that a boom is following the bust, and the timing couldn’t be worse for the Saudi-led oil cartel.

title: China Gets First Private Builder Dollar Bond Offering Since 2023
content: Seazen Group Ltd., one of the few major private-sector Chinese developers yet to default, started marketing a dollar bond that would be the first of its kind in more than two years.

title: China’s Cheap Funding Breathes Life Into Leveraged Bond Trades
content: China’s efforts to support the economy by keeping funding costs low are increasing lending among banks, in a sign they may be borrowing cheaply to buy bonds for a profit.

title: JSW Cement Is Said to Eye Mumbai IPO as Roadshow Begins
content: JSW Cement Ltd. has kicked off a roadshow for its planned initial public offering that could take place in Mumbai as soon as next month, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Chinese Mid-Cap Stocks to Thrive on AI Boom, Ox Capital Says
content: Chinese mid-cap stocks will be the next winners as companies take advantage of advancements in artificial intelligence, according to a fund manager at Ox Capital Management Pty Ltd.

title: Ivanhoe Cuts Copper Guidance as Part of Flooded Mine Reopens
content: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd. slashed its output guidance for this year — and withdrew an estimate for 2026 — after restarting underground operations in part of its flood-hit copper mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: CDPQ Looks to Trim US Assets as CEO Worries About Stagflation
content: The head of Caisse de Dépôt et Placement du Québec said it’s time for the fund to scale back on US investments after years of growth and great returns.

title: Japan and US Still Far Apart in Tariff Talks, PM Cited as Saying
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba still sees distance with the US when it comes to trade talks, according to an opposition party leader who met with the leader to discuss US tariffs.

title: EU Mulls Sanctioning Two Small China Banks for Russia Trade
content: The European Union has proposed sanctioning two small Chinese banks for helping Russia get around the bloc’s existing trade restrictions, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.

title: Trump Tariffs Prompt Largest-Ever Drop in UK Goods Exports to US
content: Britain’s goods exports to the US fell in April by the largest amount for any month since records began in 1997 after President Donald Trump launched his global trade war.

title: US Marks Russia Holiday for First Time Since Invasion of Ukraine
content: The US State Department congratulated Russia on its national holiday for the first time since the start of the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine and reaffirmed that Washington will remain engaged in efforts to end the war.

title: Labour Gambles on Growth Boost Outside London to Beat Farage
content: Rachel Reeves will pump billions of pounds into areas outside London as the Labour government tries to head off an electoral threat posed by Nigel Farage’s Reform UK.

title: Myanmar Recovery Dented by Devastating Quake, World Bank Says
content: Myanmar’s economy is headed for its worst performance since the pandemic as the strife-torn country reels from the impact of a devastating earthquake in March that’s estimated to have caused $11 billion in damage, according to the World Bank.

title: Indonesia Leader to Meet Putin in Russia to Boost Ties
content: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will meet Russian President Vladimir Putin this month in his first visit to Russia since taking office.

title: China Found World’s Pain Point on Trade — and Will Use It Again
content: For months Donald Trump pushed tariffs and trade restrictions on China to unprecedented levels, part of a strategy to force Xi Jinping into talks the US president expected would help cut the trade deficit and boost American manufacturing.

title: Trump Open to Dialogue With Kim Jong Un, White House Says
content: President Donald Trump remains open to communications with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, the White House said in its latest comments expressing willingness to resume dialogue with the nuclear-armed North, despite little signal from Kim seeking engagement.

title: Bulgarians Are Getting the Euro, But Half of Them Don’t Want It
content: People are growing more concerned about the potential impact on prices.

title: Czech Leader Calls on Trump to Give Europe More Time to Rearm
content: Czech President Petr Pavel called on the US to give Europe more time and realistic goals to take care of the continent’s security and contain an increasingly aggressive Russia.

title: US to Pull Some Embassy Staff From Middle East as Tensions Rise
content: The US ordered some staff to depart its embassy in Baghdad and authorized families of military service members to leave the region, officials said, after Iran threatened to strike American bases if it’s attacked over its nuclear program.

title: LA Under Second Night of Curfew as Trump Crackdown Expands
content: Protests over immigration raids that began in Los Angeles continued to spread across the US as President Donald Trump escalated his crackdown by unleashing new federal powers.

title: Korean Stock Hedges Cheapen With $3.2 Billion of Bullish Bets
content: South Korea’s presidential election last week has sparked the biggest equity surge in more than four years. Options traders are betting there’s more to come.

title: South Korea Halts K-Pop Broadcasts Into North to Ease Tensions
content: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s military shut down loudspeakers broadcasting anti-North Korea propaganda along the inter-Korean border on Wednesday, marking the new liberal government’s first concrete step toward easing tensions between the war-divided rivals.

title: Sperling Sees Enduring US-China Trade Tensions, Volatility Ahead
content: Trade tensions between the U.S. and China are unlikely to ease soon despite a recent thaw on tariffs, according to Gene Sperling of Pacific Investment Management Co., who warns market volatility is likely to persist.

title: Millions of Acres of Public Land Sales Added to Trump’s Tax Bill
content: The sale of millions of acres of federal land would provide billions of dollars to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive package of tax cuts and spending in the Senate’s version of the bill released Wednesday night.

title: US Urges Court Not to Limit Trump’s Use of Troops in LA
content: The US Justice Department urged a federal judge not to interfere with the Trump administration’s deployment of the National Guard and US Marines to respond to deportation protests in Los Angeles.

title: Oaktree’s Marks Says Trump Values Unpredictability, Be Cautious
content: Oaktree Capital Management LP co-founder Howard Marks said investors should expect uncertainty to endure under US President Donald Trump and relatively high valuations in global markets require a cautious stance.

title: Gold Advances on Middle East Tensions and Trump’s Tariff Pledge
content: Gold gained for a second day on increased tensions in the Middle East, with its haven status also supported by President Donald Trump’s comments that he will inform trading partners on tariff rates within two weeks.

title: The Trump Administration Keeps Denying Disaster Preparedness Aid to States
content: FEMA recently told Iowa, Mississippi, Missouri and Oklahoma it won’t be granting funds to bolster state defenses against future natural disasters.

title: Ex-Columbia Student Khalil Wins Challenge to ICE Detention
content: A federal judge ruled the Trump administration can’t detain or deport a former Columbia University graduate student based on claims that his participation in pro-Palestinian protests compromised US foreign policy, a decision that could lead to his release from an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility.

title: Trump Says Again He’ll Set Unilateral Tariffs in Two Weeks
content: President Donald Trump said he intended to send letters to trading partners in the next one to two weeks setting unilateral tariff rates, ahead of a July 9 deadline to reimpose higher duties on dozens of economies.

title: RFK Jr.’s New Vaccine Panel Includes Self-Proclaimed Anti-Vaxxer
content: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced eight new members of an expert panel that advises the federal government on immunization policy, including several vocal vaccine critics and one who identifies as an “anti-vaxxer.”

title: Immigration Raids Spread to Agriculture as Meat Plant Targeted
content: Immigration raids rocking cities from Los Angeles to Chicago are spreading to the agriculture industry, with a meat plant in the Midwest and fruit workers in California being targeted.

title: Pentagon Mulls Scrapping Aukus Agreement With Australia, UK
content: The Pentagon has launched a review of the Biden-era Aukus pact to develop nuclear-powered submarines with Australia and the UK, as the Trump administration looks to shift the burden for collective defense to allies and make sure the US has enough warships of its own.

title: World Bank Lifts Ban on Nuclear Power, Considers Upstream Gas
content: The World Bank’s board lifted its ban on supporting nuclear power, and is discussing whether to fund natural gas exploration and production, as it seeks ways to bolster access to electricity to realize its core development goals.

title: G-7 Tries to Avoid Trump Conflict by Scrapping Joint Communique

title: Cruz Pitches $1.1 Trillion Cut to Fed Bank Payments for Trump Tax Bill
content: Texas Senator Ted Cruz pitched Republican senators Wednesday on ending the Federal Reserve’s authority to pay interest to banks, claiming it would save $1.1 trillion over a decade, with members of the party’s conservative flank lauding the idea.

title: Sumitomo Realty Seeks Office Sale After Elliott Takes Stake
content: Sumitomo Realty & Development Co., the Japanese developer facing pressure from Elliott Investment Management to boost its value, is seeking to sell a group of office properties in Tokyo for at least ¥100 billion ($700 million), according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Senate GOP Clashes With House on Trump Tax Bill | Balance of Power Late Edition 6/11/2025
content: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, White House Council of Economic Advisers Chair Stephen Miran says inflation has been successfully coming down because of President Donald Trump's policies. Xavier Becerra, former California Attorney General, weighs in on the Los Angeles protests, Governor Newsom suing the Trump Administration, and his reaction to the President deploying the National Guard and Marines into the city. content: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright discusses oil prices surging as reports suggest the United States potentially evacuating its embassy staff in Baghdad, and whether or not the global oil market should be concerned about a potentially disruptive event in the Middle East. He also talks about reports on domestic crude production possibly declining in 2026 and what that means for jobs, along with the impact of the Tax bill on clean energy. Chris Wright speaks with Kailey Leinz and Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Chinese mid-cap stocks will be the next winners as companies take advantage of advancements in artificial intelligence, according to a fund manager at Ox Capital Management Pty Ltd.

title: DayOne Gets $3.5 Billion Funding for Johor Data Centers
content: DayOne Data Centers Singapore Pte. secured 15 billion ringgit ($3.6 billion) of multicurrency financing to support its green data centers in Malaysia’s Johor state, according to a statement from Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd.

title: Nvidia, Samsung Plan Investments in Robotics Startup Skild AI
content: Samsung Electronics Co. and Nvidia Corp. will take minority stakes in Skild AI Inc. as they seek to bolster their work in the emerging consumer robotics industry.

title: Chime, Backers Raise $864 Million in Above-Range IPO
content: Chime Financial Inc. and some of its shareholders are raising $864 million in an initial public offering, pricing the shares above a marketed range.

title: Oracle Sees ‘Dramatically Higher’ Sales, Boosting Cloud Momentum
content: Oracle Corp. projected cloud infrastructure sales will jump more than 70% in the fiscal year that began this month, boosting shares in late trading on investor enthusiasm for the closely watched business.

title: Social Media Firms Accountable for Posts, Brazil Judges Conclude
content: Brazil’s Supreme Court formed a majority in favor of further regulating social media companies, the latest effort by authorities to hold tech giants accountable for illegal content posted on their platforms.

title: Meta Taps Top Researchers From Google, Sesame for New AI Lab
content: Meta Platforms Inc. has poached top engineers from multiple tech firms, including Alphabet Inc.’s Google, for a new team focused on achieving a more advanced form of AI called artificial general intelligence.

title: Diller’s IAC in $30 Million Settlement Over Match.com Spinoff
content: Barry Diller’s IAC agreed to a $30 million settlement to resolve claims that investors were shortchanged in its spinoff of Match Group Inc., which operates dating apps including Tinder and Hinge.

title: Space Firm Voyager Technologies Jumps 82% After Upsized IPO
content: Voyager Technologies Inc. shares ended their debut trading day up 82% after the company raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering.
