Nvidia CEO Sees Tenfold Boost to Europe’s AI Computing Power
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang projected that Europe’s artificial-intelligence computing capacity will increase by a factor of ten over the next two years, with more than 20 so-called AI factories in the works.

title: US Makes Export Controls Negotiable as Part of China Trade Talks
content: Trade talks between the US and China this week cemented a seismic change in Washington’s approach to the countries’ economic relationship: US export curbs, meant to keep sensitive technologies out of Beijing’s hands, are now explicitly up for negotiation.

title: Paul Tudor Jones Fears AI Job Losses Will Worsen Social Division
content: Paul Tudor Jones said he’s concerned about potential societal fallout from artificial intelligence-driven job losses and urged politicians to consider how to best regulate the technology.

title: Prosus Says Earnings Likely Doubled on E-Commerce, Tencent
content: Prosus NV said its earnings per share likely nearly doubled in the last fiscal year after growth at its e-commerce businesses accelerated and the value of its holding in Chinese internet company Tencent Holdings Ltd. surged.

title: DoorDash to Buy Symbiosys to Boost Its $1 Billion-a-Year Ad Unit
content: DoorDash Inc. is adding to its recent buying spree by acquiring advertising tech firm Symbiosys for $175 million, bolstering an ad business that now generates more than $1 billion annually.

title: Alibaba Staff Worked Through Holiday After DeepSeek Breakthrough
content: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.’s engineers canceled vacations and worked through the Lunar New Year holiday to play catch up after DeepSeek shocked the global tech industry with its low-cost, powerful artificial-intelligence model in January.

title: US Replacing Huawei Towers in Panama to ‘Counter China’
content: The US embassy in Panama said it is replacing Huawei Technologies Co.’s telecommunication towers with US technology as the administration of Donald Trump intensifies its stance against China in the region.

title: Uber Alleges Insurance Fraud Scheme in Florida as It Goes on Legal Offensive
content: Uber Technologies Inc. sued a group of lawyers, medical providers and rideshare drivers it claims staged car accidents, manufactured damages and received unnecessary medical procedures to take advantage of insurance policies in Florida, costing the rideshare giant “several million dollars” in legal fees.

title: Disney, Comcast Sue AI Image Generator Midjourney
content: Walt Disney Co. and Comcast Corp. teamed up to sue Midjourney Inc., accusing the startup of copyright infringement in the latest sign of tension between major media companies and a new crop of artificial intelligence businesses.

title: Air Conditioning Drives New India Power Demand, Green CEO Says
content: The biggest source of new electricity demand in India is coming from air conditioning, outpacing transport and data centers.

title: Altman-Backed Robot Delivery Startup Raises $80 Million in Funding
content: Coco Robotics, a startup that operates a fleet of cooler-sized delivery robots on wheels, has raised $80 million in funding from OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman and other backers, a sign that automated delivery technology is advancing. The financing, which Coco Robotics plans to announce Wednesday, was led by venture capital firm SNR, with participation from investors including Pelion Venture Partners, Offline Ventures and one of Altman’s brothers, Max. With the new funding, Coco Robot

title: African Backer of Tech Unicorns Eyes AI in Healthcare Deals
content: Chronos Capital, an early backer of emerging market unicorns Tyme Group and Optasia, is looking to invest in companies deploying artificial intelligence in healthcare as it seeks to capitalize on a technology that’s expected to transform the medical industry.

title: Databricks Eyes $1 Billion Sales for Data Warehousing Product
content: Databricks Inc., a software provider among the most valuable startup companies, said its data warehousing business is on track to nearly double in size this year, and it’s launching a new database product that it hopes will follow a similar growth trajectory.

title: Amazon-Backed Rare Earths Startup to Build Recycling Plant in Canada
content: Cyclic Materials, a startup backed by Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft Corp., announced plans to build a rare-earths recycling plant and research center in Canada.

title: Nvidia’s Huang Sees Quantum Computing Reaching Inflection Point
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said Wednesday that quantum computing is reaching an inflection point and will be powerful enough in the coming years to help “solve some interesting problems” globally.

title: Amazon, Walmart Drone Deliveries Take Rivalry to the Skies
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Matt Day looks at the plans by Amazon and Walmart to significantly expand deliveries using drones.

title: Nvidia Teams Up With G42 for UAE Data Centers in Mideast AI Push
content: Nvidia Corp. will collaborate with a G42 unit to build data centers powered by its Blackwell chips, a sign of how the United Arab Emirates’ access to the latest generation of semiconductors has improved since US President Donald Trump’s May trip to the Middle East.

title: Japan and US Still Far Apart in Tariff Talks, PM Cited as Saying
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba still sees distance with the US when it comes to trade talks, according to an opposition party leader who met with the leader to discuss US tariffs.

title: Trump Tariffs Prompt Largest-Ever Drop in UK Goods Exports to US
content: Britain’s goods exports to the US fell in April by the largest amount for any month since records began in 1997 after President Donald Trump launched his global trade war.

title: UK Economy Shrunk 0.3% in April as Tariffs and Taxes Bite
content: Sharp tax increases and US President Donald Trump’s tariffs triggered the UK’s first monthly economic contraction in six months, casting doubt over the Labour government’s plan to fund its spending ambitions with faster growth.

title: Romanian Inflation Climbs to One-Year High as Leu Hit Record Low
content: Romanian inflation accelerated in May after the leu’s decline to a record low during a recent political crisis boosted costs of goods and services.

title: China Found World’s Pain Point on Trade — and Will Use It Again
content: For months Donald Trump pushed tariffs and trade restrictions on China to unprecedented levels, part of a strategy to force Xi Jinping into talks the US president expected would help cut the trade deficit and boost American manufacturing.

title: Trump Open to Dialogue With Kim Jong Un, White House Says
content: President Donald Trump remains open to communications with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, the White House said in its latest comments expressing willingness to resume dialogue with the nuclear-armed North, despite little signal from Kim seeking engagement.

title: India Central Bank Sends Conflicting Signs With Policy Moves
content: India’s central bank under new Governor Sanjay Malhotra is giving market participants conflicting signals about monetary policy as it takes aggressive steps to spur economic growth and lending.

title: Bulgarians Are Getting the Euro, But Half of Them Don’t Want It
content: People are growing more concerned about the potential impact on prices.

title: Serbia Seen Resuming Rate Cuts After Long Pause: Decision Guide
content: Serbia is poised to cut borrowing costs for the first time since September as inflation approaches the central bank’s target and economic growth slows.

title: East African Finance Chiefs Face Fiscal Tightrope in Budgets
content: East African finance ministers will be walking a tightrope when they reveal their spending plans on Thursday, with ballooning debt, underperforming revenue and geopolitics challenging planned fiscal consolidation.

title: CDPQ Looks to Trim US Assets as CEO Worries About Stagflation
content: The head of Caisse de Dépôt et Placement du Québec said it’s time for the fund to scale back on US investments after years of growth and great returns.

title: Japan’s Firms See Business Climate Worsen on Tariff Hits
content: Japan’s largest businesses turned pessimistic for the first time in more than a year as Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs upended key sectors, a development that could complicate the Bank of Japan’s policy path.

title: NZ’s Willis Criticizes RBNZ Handling of Orr Resignation
content: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis has criticized the Reserve Bank for its handling of former Governor Adrian Orr’s resignation, saying it should have been more transparent about his reason for quitting.

title: Sperling Sees Enduring US-China Trade Tensions, Volatility Ahead
content: Trade tensions between the U.S. and China are unlikely to ease soon despite a recent thaw on tariffs, according to Gene Sperling of Pacific Investment Management Co., who warns market volatility is likely to persist.

title: Australia Inflation Expectations Rise to Highest Since 2023
content: Australia’s expected inflation rate rose to 5.0% in June, the highest level since July 2023, according to a survey released by the Melbourne Institute.

title: Trump’s Auto Tariffs Strike at the Heart of Japan’s Economy
content: Toyota, Honda, Subaru and other Japanese carmakers brace for a profit hit of more than $19 billion as economists flag the risk of a recession and a setback for key wage cycle

title: Asia’s Easing Prices Pave Path for Rate Cuts and US Divergence
content: Inflation is easing across Asia as lower food and fuel prices and stronger local currencies against the dollar push down costs. That’s giving the region’s central bank chiefs scope to support their trade-reliant economies as the risk of US tariffs and related uncertainty weigh on the outlook.

title: Trump Says Again He’ll Set Unilateral Tariffs in Two Weeks
content: President Donald Trump said he intended to send letters to trading partners in the next one to two weeks setting unilateral tariff rates, ahead of a July 9 deadline to reimpose higher duties on dozens of economies.

title: UK House Price Indicator Slides to 10-Month Low as Market Cools
content: A closely watched index of UK property prices declined to its lowest in almost a year, suggesting the housing market remains under pressure after a tax break for buyers expired.

title: RBNZ Policymaker’s Closed-Door Talk Raises Transparency Concerns
content: An external member of the Reserve Bank of New Zealand’s Monetary Policy Committee will give a rare presentation today, but it will be behind closed doors.

title: US Tariff Revenue Hits Fresh Record, Helping Shrink May Deficit

title: Bessent Says $2 Trillion Reasonable for Dollar Stablecoin Market

title: Trump Says China Will Ship Rare Earths in ‘Done’ Trade Deal

title: Bank of France Cuts Growth Forecasts as Trade Tensions Hit
content: The Bank of France cut its economic-growth and inflation forecasts through 2027 as the fallout from US tariffs dulls activity in Europe.

title: US Makes Export Controls Negotiable as Part of China Trade Talks
content: Trade talks between the US and China this week cemented a seismic change in Washington’s approach to the countries’ economic relationship: US export curbs, meant to keep sensitive technologies out of Beijing’s hands, are now explicitly up for negotiation.

title: Canada and US Exchange Working Document on Trade Deal, CBC Says
content: US and Canadian officials are exchanging a document outlining potential trade deal terms, CBC News reported on Wednesday, citing anonymous sources, who said the paper is seen as a step toward a new trade pact.

title: Bessent Says ‘Remains to Be Seen’ Whether Tax Bill Adds to Debt
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent refrained from arguing that the tax legislation Republicans are working to finalize in Congress will avoid adding to the debt burden.

content: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the European Union is likely to be among the last deals that the US completes, as the administration rushes to secure tariff agreements with other trading partners.

content: Tesco Plc’s sales increased more than expected as the supermarket chain sold more premium and own-brand products.

content: Sumitomo Realty & Development Co., the Japanese developer facing pressure from Elliott Investment Management to boost its value, is seeking to sell a group of office properties in Tokyo for at least ¥100 billion ($700 million), according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Thai Exporters Face $600 Million in Added Costs as Port Congestion Worsens

title: China Found World’s Pain Point on Trade — and Will Use It Again
content: For months Donald Trump pushed tariffs and trade restrictions on China to unprecedented levels, part of a strategy to force Xi Jinping into talks the US president expected would help cut the trade deficit and boost American manufacturing.

content: Airbus SE predicted the global commercial aircraft fleet will double in size to almost 50,000 planes over the next 20 years, spurred by rapid growth in markets like India, where a rising middle class increasingly takes to air travel.

content: Logistics giant DHL Group plans to invest about €500 million ($575 million) in health-care services in Africa and the Middle East over the next five years to capitalize on China‘s push into the regions.

title: China Gets First Private Builder Dollar Bond Offering Since 2023

title: Toyota Shareholders Vote to Reappoint Chairman Akio Toyoda
content: Toyota Motor Corp.’s chairman kept his seat on the carmaker’s board at its annual meeting, where talk of selfies and sumo wrestlers overshadowed Akio Toyoda’s role in a contentious buyout of a group company.

content: Monash IVF Group Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Michael Knaap resigned, days after the pioneering reproductive health-care company disclosed a second embryo transfer incident that sent shares tumbling.

title: Japan’s Jera Touts 20-Year LNG Agreements With US Suppliers

content: The Chicago Bears are exploring a sale of the minority stake owned by the late Andrew McKenna Sr., according to people familiar with the matter.

content: Oklo Inc., a nuclear energy startup developing small reactors, is seeking to raise as much as $400 million in a secondary share offering.

content: European natural gas prices surged after Israel carried out a wave of strikes against Iran, raising fears of a wider war in a region that’s key to global energy supplies.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin  6/13/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Zhihu CFO on Growth Outlook
content:
Han Wang, CFO of Zhihu, a Chinese online knowledge platform, discusses his outlook for business and growth for the platform, as they look to integrate AI deeper into their product.
He speaks with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Nina Trentmann on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Dundee Precious Agrees to Buy Adriatic Metals for $1.25 Billion
content: Dundee Precious Metals Inc. agreed to buy Adriatic Metals Plc, which operates the Vares silver project in Bosnia and Herzegovina, for about $1.25 billion.

title: Oil Spikes as Israeli Attacks on Iran Stoke Fears of Wider War
content: Oil surged as much as 13% before paring gains, after Israel carried out waves of strikes against Iran, raising fears of a wider war in a region that accounts for a third of global crude production.

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 06/13/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stocks Fall, Oil and Gold Jump as Israel Hits Iran: Markets Wrap
content: Crude oil jumped the most in more than three years, stocks slid and haven assets including government bonds and gold rose after Israel attacked Iran’s nuclear program sites in a major escalation of tensions in the Middle East.

title: The China Show 6/13/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, David Ingles and Avril Hong give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Escalation Is Key Fear for Markets After Strike, Analysts Say
content: The key question for markets following Israel’s strike on Iran is how much worse things will get, say strategists.

title: Tor, Nomura Provide Private Credit to Indian Developer Suruchi
content: Indian real estate company Suruchi Properties Pvt. has obtained 4.5 billion rupees ($52.3 million) of private credit for refinancing purposes, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: ‘I Got Up and Ran’: How One Man Survived Plane Crash That Killed 241
content: As Air India Flight AI171 descended toward its doom on Thursday, Ramesh Vishwaskumar sat in the first row of economy class — headed for one of the most harrowing and luckiest moments of his life.

content: Thailand’s tariff negotiations with the US are likely to take place virtually as President Donald Trump’s self-imposed July 9 deadline nears, according to the Department of Trade Negotiations.

title: Oil Surge Is Latest Headwind for Tariff-Rattled Global Economy
content: For a global economy that’s been buffeted by trade tensions all year, lower energy prices were one of the few positives. If a surge in the price of oil after Israel carried out airstrikes against targets in Iran is sustained, that tailwind will switch to become yet another headwind.

title: Gold Market Competition Heats Up as Industry Meets in Singapore
content: The start of a gold-futures contract in Singapore has put the spotlight on a flurry of moves in Asian financial hubs to capitalize on rising interest in the commodity as demand increases and prices surge, just as a dramatic spike in hostilities in the Middle East drove a fresh leg higher.

title: Oil Curve Shift Shows Fears of Protracted Mideast Conflict
content: The oil futures curve is strengthening on concerns that Israel’s latest strike on Iran could have severe and long-lasting repercussions.

title: Dollar’s Haven Status Faces a Key Test After Israel Strikes Iran
content: Under pressure from all sides and with cracks in its global currency dominance a key market talking point this year, the dollar’s traditional role as a crisis haven faces a crucial test should Israel’s attack on Iran escalate.

title: Pop Mart’s 200% Stock Rally Spurs Rush to Hike Price Targets
content: Wall Street analysts are rushing to raise price targets on Pop Mart International Group Ltd. following the success of its Labubu dolls.

title: Israel-Iran Conflict Triggers Fear of ‘Death Spiral,’ Analysts Say
content: Israel’s early-morning strikes against Iran’s nuclear program and ballistic-missile sites on Friday prompted the Islamic Republic to vow a “harsh blow” against both Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government and the US, which denied any involvement.

title: Chinese Firms in Talks to Join Group for Li Ka-Shing’s Ports
content: China’s largest shipping company is among the firms in talks to invest in a multinational consortium seeking to buy billionaire Li Ka-shing’s global ports, according to people familiar with the matter, in an effort to ease Beijing’s concerns over the controversial deal.

title: Israeli Attack on Iran Raises Risk of Wider Conflict, Bloomberg Economics Says
content: Israel’s attack on the Iranian nuclear program and its ballistic missile sites threatens to spark wider fighting in the Middle East that risks drawing in the US, according to Bloomberg Economics.

title: Caller ID Is Destroying Our Understanding of the Jobs Market
content: Britain’s statistics crisis is not unique — modern technology and changing habits are causing problems in many countries

title: The Asia Trade 13/6/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Iran Vows Retaliation After Israel Strikes Nuclear Program
content: Israel launched airstrikes against Iran's nuclear program and ballistic-missile sites early on Friday, a major escalation in the standoff between the two adversaries. Bloomberg's Ethan Bronner reports on the latest. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Outlook in Flux as Analysts Revise Views After Israel Strike
content: Israel’s strike on Iran has injected a fresh bout of geopolitical risk into an oil market that has been in the doldrums due to concerns about the global economy and supply increases from OPEC+.

title: A $115 Billion Fund Manager Bets on Shortest Maturity India Debt
content: India’s economic growth is set to accelerate sharply, making the ultra short-end of the debt market the most attractive segment, according to one of the country’s top money managers.

title: GemLife Raises $486 Million in Australia’s Biggest IPO This Year
content: GemLife raised A$750 million ($486 million) in its initial public offering, which edged out air carrier Virgin Australia’s deal as the country’s biggest listing this year.

title: Bitcoin Sinks as Israel Escalates Iran Standoff With Airstrikes
content: Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies sank after Israel launched airstrikes on Iran in a major escalation.

title: Share Sales, Block Trades Power India's Fat IPO Pipeline
content: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: Key Iran Nuclear Enrichment Site of Natanz Shows No Sign of Breach
content: The United Nations’ atomic watchdog said there are no indications of increased radiation levels at Iran’s main uranium-enrichment site, an early sign that Israel’s strikes have not penetrated the containment layers protecting the Islamic Republic’s nuclear stockpile.

title: Greece’s IPTO Seeks Pay for Delays to €1.9 Billion Subsea Cable
content: Greek grid operator IPTO SA is seeking compensation for delays to getting licenses for seabed surveys that are needed to complete what’s set to be one of the world’s largest power links.

title: India, US Harden Trade Stance as July Tariff Deadline Nears
content: Trade officials from India and the US have hardened their stance on some key issues as they race to conclude an interim deal before higher US tariffs take effect in July, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Israel Strikes Iran’s Nuclear Sites, Warns More Attacks to Come
content: Israel launched waves of airstrikes against Iran’s nuclear program and ballistic-missile sites on Friday morning, a major escalation in the standoff between the two adversaries that risks sparking a wider war in the Middle East.

title: Israel Disregards Trump With Major Attack on Iran Nuclear Sites
content: President Donald Trump had repeatedly urged Israel not to strike Iran’s nuclear sites.

title: Trump Can Keep Deploying Troops in LA for Now, Court Says
content: The Trump administration won a brief reprieve from a judge’s order to pull back on its use of military troops in Los Angeles to deal with protests over the president’s immigration raids.

title: China’s Security Office Flexes New Power With Hong Kong Probe
content: Beijing’s national security office in Hong Kong carried out its first known joint operation with city officials, marking an expansion of China’s direct law enforcement in the financial hub.

title: FTC Weighs Political Neutrality Pledge for Ad Agency Mega-Merger
content: Omnicom Group Inc. and Interpublic Group have discussed with US antitrust officials not withholding online advertising for political reasons as a possible condition for winning approval to form the world’s biggest advertising agency, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Akazawa Sees a Deal With US Sparing Japan From Higher Car Levies
content: Japan’s top trade negotiator expects a trade deal with the US to spare Tokyo from higher auto tariffs, even if US President Donald Trump decides to increase them against other nations.

title: North Korea Restores Damaged Warship, Plans Two More Next Year
content: North Korea said it successfully refloated a 5,000-ton destroyer that suffered damage in a botched launch attempt last month that left it foundering in shallow water, with leader Kim Jong Un vowing to build two more vessels of the same class next year as part of his efforts to boost the country’s naval capabilities.

title: Philippine Ex-Leader Duterte Seeks Release From ICC Detention
content: Former Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte has requested the International Criminal Court in The Hague for his interim release, three months after he was arrested for alleged crimes against humanity under his controversial war on drugs.

title: Iran Retaliates With Drones After Israel's Attack on Nuclear Sites
South Korea’s Lee to Meet Chaebol Heads in Bid to Revive Economy
content: South Korean President Lee Jae-myung will meet the heads of the country’s biggest conglomerates Friday, as he seeks to jumpstart a flagging economy while navigating tensions over his reform agenda aimed at curbing the dominance that chaebols wield over the corporate landscape.

title: Battle Over Sports Betting Threatens to Derail Lula Fiscal Plan
content: A fierce lobbying push by sports betting companies is threatening to bring down the Brazilian government’s plan to raise revenues and hit fiscal goals after the lower house speaker backed off support for a deal he helped broker.

title: Judge Questions Trump’s Unilateral Power to Deploy Troops in LA
content: A federal judge sharply pressed the Trump administration over its authority to deploy the California National Guard to respond to protests in Los Angeles without the consent of the state’s governor.

title: Regulators Are Harming UK as a Financial Center, Lawmakers Warn
content: A culture of risk aversion and mission creep among UK financial regulators is undermining trust and placing costly burdens on banks and insurers, an influential group of parliamentarians found.

title: Xi Plays Long Game on US-China Trade as Trump Seeks Quick Wins
content: While Donald Trump hailed the outcome of trade talks in London, Xi Jinping walked away with an understated strategic gain: a negotiating process that buys China time and helps defuse the threat of more harmful tariffs and technology curbs.

title: California Senator Handcuffed Outside Noem Briefing in LA
content: US Senator Alex Padilla of California was forcibly removed from a press conference and handcuffed after disrupting a media briefing by Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem on the federal immigration crackdown in Los Angeles.

title: Trump Sees Possible ‘Massive Conflict’ Between Israel, Iran
content: President Donald Trump said Israel “could very well” strike Iran but that he had advised against an attack while negotiations over Tehran’s nuclear program were ongoing, as the departure of US staff from the region fans concerns about a coming strike.

title: Harvard Asks Judge to Bolster Block of Foreign Student Ban
content: Lawyers for Harvard University urged a federal judge to ensure that the Trump administration won’t impose alternative restrictions on the school’s enrollment of foreign students after the government’s earlier efforts were blocked.

title: Trump Administration Orders 500,000 Immigrants to Leave US
content: Immigrants admitted to the US from a Biden-era parole program for Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua, and Venezuela have begun receiving notices of termination urging them to depart the US.

title: Trump’s China Trade Framework Mostly a Reset to Earlier Terms
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Catherine Lucey looks at what came out of the trade talks with China this week. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: House Passes Musk’s DOGE Cuts to PBS, NPR and Foreign Aid
content: The US House approved $9.4 billion in Elon Musk’s DOGE federal spending cuts, with Republican moderates swallowing their concerns about cutting previously approved spending for foreign aid and public broadcasting.

title: Gold Advances on Fed Rate-Cut Bets and Middle East Tensions
content: Gold rose after another soft inflation report bolstered bets that the Federal Reserve may need to cut interest rates later this year.

title: Argentina Inflation Hits Lowest Since Covid in Win for Milei
content: Argentina’s monthly inflation slowed to the lowest level since the height of the pandemic, scoring a major victory for President Javier Milei ahead of a crucial midterm vote.

title: Trump Mulls Using Defense Powers to Fund Rare-Earth Projects
content: The Trump administration is developing a plan to use Cold War-era powers to prioritize and fund rare earth projects it deems critical to national security, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Key Senator Looks to Slow Ted Cruz Plan on Fed Interest to Banks
content: Senate Banking Committee Chairman Tim Scott said he opposes swift action on a proposal that would bar the Federal Reserve from paying interest on reserves to banks to help pay for Republicans’ massive tax and spending package.

title: Russian Harvard Scientist Freed on Bail After Months in Custody
content: A Russian scientist at Harvard University was freed on bail by a federal judge after spending four months in detention for failing to declare biological material she brought into the US for research.

title: IMF Sees Unwinding of Global Trade Surge Ahead of Trump Tariffs
content: The International Monetary Fund is seeing signs that the rise in trade and activity to front-run US President Donald Trump’s tariffs is beginning to unwind as the global economy still faces heightened uncertainty.

title: BPCE to Buy Novo Banco in Deal Valuing Bank at €6.4 Billion
content: French banking group BPCE agreed to acquire Lone Star’s Novo Banco SA in a deal valuing the Portuguese lender at an estimated €6.4 billion ($7.4 billion) in what’s set to be a key cross-border acquisition for Europe.

content: What do Pop Mart’s ever popular Labubu dolls have to do with China’s economy and the need for US-China trade talks? (Source: Bloomberg)

Israel launched waves of airstrikes against Iran’s nuclear program and ballistic-missile sites on Friday morning.

title: Visionaries Club Co-Founder Lacher at Founders Forum
content: Visionaries Club Co-Founder Robert Lacher says artificial intelligence and defense are the most interesting sectors for venture capitalists in Europe. Speaking on the sidelines of the Founders Forum in Oxfordshire, Lacher said “the geopolitical shift, as bad as it is, is the best thing that could have happened” to European tech. Lacher spoke to Bloomberg TV on June 12. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Israel launched waves of airstrikes against Iran’s nuclear program and ballistic-missile sites on Friday morning. Bloomberg’s Jonathan Tirone breaks down the situation and discusses what this means for the Iranian nuclear program.

title: Meta Finalizes $14.3 Billion Scale Investment, Hires Its CEO
content: Meta Platforms Inc. has finalized a multibillion-dollar investment in Scale AI and recruited the startup’s chief executive officer to join its artificial intelligence efforts — an unusual deal that signals a heightened push by the social media giant to catch up on AI development.

title: CATL Shares Clouded by Bleak Outlook After Mega Hong Kong Debut
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. has received little love following its splashy $5.2 billion listing in Hong Kong last month, as investors eye multifold challenges in the global EV battery market.

title: Nexon Shares Jump 10% as Tencent Said to Study Acquisition
content: The shares of Nexon Co. surged 10% after Bloomberg reported Tencent Holdings Ltd. is studying a potential deal for the gaming company to bolster its presence in that segment.

title: Tencent Studies Deal for $15 Billion Game Developer Nexon
content: Tencent Holdings Ltd. is studying a potential deal for Nexon Co., as the Chinese internet giant looks for ways to bolster its lucrative gaming operations, people with knowledge of the matter said.

title: Fintech Chime Climbs 37% in Debut After $864 Million IPO
content: Chime Financial Inc. rose 37% in its trading debut after pricing its shares above the marketed range to raise raising $864 million in the year’s sixth-biggest US initial public offering.

title: Hong Kong Bets the Future on a Vast Tech Zone by China’s Border
content: Northern Metropolis could align the city even more with the mainland, at a time when its finance and property sectors are faltering.

title: NRG Expects to Line Up New US Data Center Deals This Quarter
content: NRG Energy Inc. is working on deals to power US data centers “all over the country” and will reveal details with second-quarter results, according to the top executive of the independent generator.

title: A Fatal Tesla Crash Shows the Limits of Full Self-Driving
content: As Elon Musk touts robotaxis in Austin, federal regulators are investigating whether Tesla’s system is dangerous even with a human behind the wheel.

title: AMD Says New Chips Can Top Nvidia’s in Booming AI Chip Field
content: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. Chief Executive Officer Lisa Su said her company’s latest AI processors can challenge Nvidia Corp. chips in a market she now expects to soar past $500 billion in the next three years.

title: Apple Targets Spring 2026 for Release of Delayed Siri AI Upgrade
content: Apple Inc. has set an internal release target of spring 2026 for its delayed upgrade of Siri, marking a key step in its artificial intelligence turnaround effort.

title: Adobe Gives Sales Outlook That Fails to Convince AI Skeptics
content: Adobe Inc. gave a sales outlook for the current quarter that topped analysts’ estimates, but investors remain skeptical that the leader in creative software can outduel AI-focused upstarts.

title: Meta, Apple Try Very Different Strategies to Catch Up on AI
content: Two of the biggest technology companies are taking radically different approaches to compete on AI. But first…

title: Oracle Hits Record After Seeing ‘Dramatically Higher’ Sales
content: Oracle Corp. shares soared to a record high after the software maker projected a 70% gain in cloud infrastructure sales this fiscal year, giving a bullish outlook for the closely watched business.

title: GameStop’s Future Is in Trading Cards, CEO Says
content: GameStop Corp., the largest standalone video-game retailer in the US, will focus on growing its trading card business, Chief Executive Officer Ryan Cohen said at the company’s annual shareholder meeting Thursday.

title: Scale AI Picks New CEO as Wang Set to Join Meta After Investment
content: Scale AI plans to promote Chief Strategy Officer Jason Droege to serve as its next chief executive officer following a multibillion-dollar investment from Meta Platforms Inc., according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: US Says Export Controls to Keep Huawei AI Output Limited in 2025
content: A senior Trump administration official said that Huawei Technologies Co.’s ability to produce AI semiconductors will be very limited this year, responding to US lawmakers’ concerns that China is gaining ground in production of advanced semiconductors.

title: Trump Says US Will Have ‘Golden Share’ in US Steel
content: President Donald Trump says the US government will retain a “golden share” in United States Steel after its purchase by Japan’s Nippon Steel.

title: Trump Calls California’s EV Mandate a ‘Disaster’
content: President Donald Trump signed mandates that revoke California clean air policies, including requirements that carmakers sell electric vehicles in greater numbers each year in the state.

title: Tesla Sues Ex-Optimus Engineer Alleging Theft of Robotic Trade Secrets
content: Tesla Inc. sued a former engineer with the company’s highly secretive Optimus program, accusing him of stealing confidential information about the humanoid robot and setting up a rival startup in Silicon Valley.

title: UK Pension Intervention Will Unlock Capital, Tech Minister Says
content: The London Stock Exchange is under-capitalized and the UK government’s plan to intervene in pension funds — forcing them to invest in private companies — will boost the amount of money being pumped into the economy, Technology Secretary Peter Kyle said.

title: Arm CEO Sides With Nvidia on US Export Limits on China
content: Arm Holdings Plc CEO Rene Haas aligned himself with Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang in saying that US export controls on China threaten to slow overall technological advances and are ultimately bad for consumers and companies. Haas spoke Thursday in an interview with Bloomberg at the Founders Forum Global conference in Oxford.

title: Synthesia CEO Riparbelli on Tech Opportunities in Europe
content: Synthesia CEO Victor Riparbelli says ongoing political tension has created better opportunities for entrepreneurs to build companies as focus shifts away from regulation and into the technology and defense sectors. He speaks with Bloomberg's Tom Mackenzie at the Founders Forum in Oxfordshire. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Why Voyager Shares Are Jumping After Upsized IPO
content: Voyager Technologies shares ended their debut trading day up 82% after the company raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering. Norah Mulinda reports on “Bloomberg Open Interest.”

title: Micron Pledges $200 Billion Investment in US Manufacturing
content: Chipmaker Micron Technology Inc. said it will spend about $200 billion on US manufacturing, research and development, the latest company to pledge large-scale investments in the country since President Donald Trump won election.

title: Micron to Invest About $200B in US Chip Manufacturing
content: Micron Technology said it will spend about $200 billion on US manufacturing, research and development. The spending will include roughly $150 billion for domestic manufacturing capacity and another $50 billion for R&D. Jake Silverman has more on “Bloomberg The Open.”

title: Mattel Taps OpenAI to Help It Design Toys, Other Products
content: The first release from the collaboration is expected later this year.

title: CoreWeave Shorts Face 150% Borrow Costs After $1.6 Billion Loss
content: CoreWeave Inc.’s soaring share price is torching short sellers who are paying high prices to bet that the stock will soon fall back to earth.

title: Yahoo Adds New AI Features to Mail App in Attempt to Up Usage
content: Yahoo is rolling out new artificial intelligence features for its email platform in an effort to better engage one of its fast-growing subset of users: Gen Z and millennials.

title: Arm CEO Sides With Nvidia Against US Export Limits on China
content: Arm Holdings Plc Chief Executive Officer Rene Haas said Thursday that US export controls on China threaten to slow overall technological advances and are ultimately bad for consumers and companies, aligning himself with Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang and others looking to ease tensions between Washington and Beijing.

title: China’s Economy Withstood Trade Chaos But Momentum Likely Slowed
content: The Chinese economy rode out the tariff rollercoaster in May even as domestic consumption likely weakened again, after the government’s massive fiscal stimulus and frontloading by exporters offset shocks from abroad.

title: India, US Harden Trade Stance as July Tariff Deadline Nears
content: Trade officials from India and the US have hardened their stance on some key issues as they race to conclude an interim deal before higher US tariffs take effect in July, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Israeli Attack on Iran Raises Risk of Wider Conflict, Bloomberg Economics Says
content: Israel’s attack on the Iranian nuclear program and its ballistic missile sites threatens to spark wider fighting in the Middle East that risks drawing in the US, according to Bloomberg Economics.

title: Caller ID Is Destroying Our Understanding of the Jobs Market
content: Britain’s statistics crisis is not unique — modern technology and changing habits are causing problems in many countries

title: BOJ Is Said to See Inflation Running Stronger Than Expected
content: Bank of Japan officials see prices rising a little stronger than they expected earlier in the year, a factor that may open the door to discussions over whether to raise interest rates if global trade tensions ease, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: A $115 Billion Fund Manager Bets on Shortest Maturity India Debt
content: India’s economic growth is set to accelerate sharply, making the ultra short-end of the debt market the most attractive segment, according to one of the country’s top money managers.

title: Akazawa Sees a Deal With US Sparing Japan From Higher Car Levies
content: Japan’s top trade negotiator expects a trade deal with the US to spare Tokyo from higher auto tariffs, even if US President Donald Trump decides to increase them against other nations.

title: South Korea’s Lee to Meet Chaebol Heads in Bid to Revive Economy
content: South Korean President Lee Jae-myung will meet the heads of the country’s biggest conglomerates Friday, as he seeks to jumpstart a flagging economy while navigating tensions over his reform agenda aimed at curbing the dominance that chaebols wield over the corporate landscape.

title: Peru Holds Key Rate as Policymakers Weigh Risks to Growth
content: Peru held interest rates unchanged as the central bank gauges whether US tariff policy will jeopardize its combination of the fastest growth and the lowest inflation among Latin America’s major economies.

title: Taxes and Tariffs Prompt UK Firms to Slow Hiring, Recruiters Say
content: British employers scaled back hiring further in May in the wake of the sharp tax increases imposed by the Labour government and US President Donald Trump’s trade war, according to a closely watched survey.

title: Xi Plays Long Game on US-China Trade as Trump Seeks Quick Wins
content: While Donald Trump hailed the outcome of trade talks in London, Xi Jinping walked away with an understated strategic gain: a negotiating process that buys China time and helps defuse the threat of more harmful tariffs and technology curbs.

title: Wealthy Australians Brace for a New Tax on Retirement Savings
content: Australia is forging ahead with a new tax on its richest retirement savers amid concerns that the country’s A$4.1 trillion ($2.7 trillion) pensions system is becoming a high-wealth accumulation vehicle.

title: China Forced to Keep Unprofitable Firms Alive to Save Jobs and Avoid Unrest
content: Saddled with the most loss-making industrial companies since 2001, Xi Jinping is trying to clean up his economy without triggering mass layoffs.

title: Argentina Inflation Hits Lowest Since Covid in Win for Milei
content: Argentina’s monthly inflation slowed to the lowest level since the height of the pandemic, scoring a major victory for President Javier Milei ahead of a crucial midterm vote.

title: Key Senator Looks to Slow Ted Cruz Plan on Fed Interest to Banks
content: Senate Banking Committee Chairman Tim Scott said he opposes swift action on a proposal that would bar the Federal Reserve from paying interest on reserves to banks to help pay for Republicans’ massive tax and spending package.

title: IMF Sees Unwinding of Global Trade Surge Ahead of Trump Tariffs
content: The International Monetary Fund is seeing signs that the rise in trade and activity to front-run US President Donald Trump’s tariffs is beginning to unwind as the global economy still faces heightened uncertainty.

title: South Africa Rail Firm Averts Strike as Unions Accept Pay Deal
content: South Africa’s state-owned ports and freight-rail company reached a pay deal with its two recognized labor unions, averting a strike that threatened to disrupt mineral and agricultural exports.

title: Canadian Support for Counter-Tariffs Dips as Trump Trade War Persists
content: Canadians continue to support retaliating against US President Donald Trump’s wave of tariffs, but their fervor has waned as the trade war wears on.

title: East Africa Plans Spending Boost to Offset Global Risk, Aid Cuts
content: East African finance chiefs increased planned spending to a record to sustain economic growth and mitigate the effects of geopolitical risks and cuts in foreign aid.

title: Bessent Sees Deficit Falling Over 10 Years After Tax-Cut Bill
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that there are a number of different assessments of the deficit impact of Republicans’ signature tax-cut bill, and that his own expectation is it will shrink borrowing over a decade.

title: Trump Floats Higher Auto Tariff, Guts California Gas-Car Ban
content: President Donald Trump said he may raise US auto tariffs in order to boost domestic auto manufacturing, a move that could further ratchet up tensions with trading partners.

title: Investor Anxiety Over ‘Revenge Tax’ Is Overblown, Barclays Says
content: A controversial provision in President Donald Trump’s tax-and-spending bill aimed at penalizing countries with “unfair” tax regimes is unlikely to disrupt US bond and stock markets, according to Barclays Capital.

title: US Household Net Worth Falls for First Time Since 2023
content: US household worth declined at the start of the year for the first time in since 2023 as Americans contended with a tariff-driven stock market selloff.

title: US Mortgage Rates Tick Down, Sending 30-Year Average to 6.84%
content: Mortgage rates in the US fell for a second straight week.

title: Why Trump’s Section 899 ‘Revenge’ Tax Worries Investors
content: A measure in President Donald Trump’s sweeping domestic policy legislation designed to penalize countries with tax policies the administration considers unfair is causing a stir on Wall Street.

title: UK Trade Secretary Reynolds Hopeful of US Deal on Car Tariffs Soon
content: UK Business and Trade Secretary Jonathan Reynolds said he was hopeful that a deal can be struck soon with the US to lower tariffs on British cars, but indicated that negotiations over steel have further to go.

title: Carney Sees Progress in Trade Talks Between US and Canada
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he hopes to secure a commercial and security agreement soon with US President Donald Trump, though he tamped down expectations that a deal will be ready in time for the Group of Seven summit in a few days.

title: US Recurring Jobless Claims Jump to Highest Since End of 2021
content: Recurring applications for US unemployment benefits rose to the highest since the end of 2021, adding to evidence that it is taking unemployed Americans longer to find a new job.

title: Traders Resume Fully Pricing In Two Fed Rate Cuts This Year
content: Traders are once again fully pricing in expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates twice this year as reports on US producer prices and jobless claims support a rally in the bond market.

title: Muted US Producer Prices Add to String of Tame Inflation Reports
content: US producer price inflation remained muted in May across the board, another sign that tariffs have yet to result in higher prices for consumers and businesses.

title: Key Iran Nuclear Enrichment Site of Natanz Shows No Sign of Breach
content: The United Nations’ atomic watchdog said there are no indications of increased radiation levels at Iran’s main uranium-enrichment site, an early sign that Israel’s strikes have not penetrated the containment layers protecting the Islamic Republic’s nuclear stockpile.

title: Boeing CEO No Stranger to Crisis as 787 Crash Poses New Test
content: Boeing Co. Chief Executive Officer Kelly Ortberg finds himself in a painfully familiar role as he faces another crisis, this time over a crash involving the company’s marquee 787 Dreamliner jet in India that killed more than 240 people.

title: BPCE to Buy Novo Banco in Deal Valuing Bank at €6.4 Billion
content: French banking group BPCE agreed to acquire Lone Star’s Novo Banco SA in a deal valuing the Portuguese lender at an estimated €6.4 billion ($7.4 billion) in what’s set to be a key cross-border acquisition for Europe.

title: Dundee Precious Agrees to Buy Adriatic Metals for $1.25 Billion
content: Dundee Precious Metals Inc. agreed to buy Adriatic Metals Plc, which operates the Vares silver project in Bosnia and Herzegovina, for about $1.25 billion.

title: Singapore’s Scoot to Start Some Routes Lost by Jetstar Asia Exit
content: Singapore Airlines Ltd. and its budget carrier Scoot will launch new routes and increase existing flight frequencies beginning in August, a spokesperson said, filling gaps left by the exit of Qantas Airways Ltd.’s Jetstar Asia.

title: Toyota Chair Reclaims Support After Scandals That Hurt Last Vote
content: Toyota Motor Corp. Chairman Akio Toyoda’s reelection garnered almost 97% of voted shares during the carmaker’s annual meeting, marking a comeback from the record low he saw after a series of regulatory scandals led investors to question the business group’s leadership.

title: Greece’s IPTO Seeks Pay for Delays to €1.9 Billion Subsea Cable
content: Greek grid operator IPTO SA is seeking compensation for delays to getting licenses for seabed surveys that are needed to complete what’s set to be one of the world’s largest power links.

title: Pop Mart’s 200% Stock Rally Spurs Rush to Hike Price Targets
content: Wall Street analysts are rushing to raise price targets on Pop Mart International Group Ltd. following the success of its Labubu dolls.

title: Search for Answers Begins in Air India Crash That Killed 241
content: Investigators have started combing the wreckage of Air India flight AI171 as they seek to determine what caused the Boeing Co. Dreamliner to crash shortly after takeoff Thursday afternoon, killing all but one of the 242 people aboard in the deadliest aviation accident in more than a decade.

title: Chinese Firms in Talks to Join Group for Li Ka-Shing’s Ports
content: China’s largest shipping company is among the firms in talks to invest in a multinational consortium seeking to buy billionaire Li Ka-shing’s global ports, according to people familiar with the matter, in an effort to ease Beijing’s concerns over the controversial deal.

title: BYD Manager Calls EV Price War It Helped Spark Unsustainable
content: BYD Co. sees China’s electric vehicle price war as unsustainable, according to a senior company executive, who stopped short of saying the country’s largest EV maker would scale back the aggressive discounting it helped trigger.

title: Alibaba Movie Unit’s Pivot, Rebrand Bring $2 Billion Value Gain
content: Damai Entertainment Holdings, formerly Alibaba Pictures Group, is shifting its focus from movies production to faster-growing entertainment segments targeting younger consumers — and investors are taking notice.

title: FDA Approves Moderna’s RSV Vaccine for Younger Adults
content: US regulators approved Moderna Inc.’s vaccine to prevent a common respiratory illness for more adults, a potential easing of the Trump administration’s opposition to mRNA technology.

title: Midwestern Bowling Outfit Pinstripes to File for Bankruptcy
content: Dining and entertainment company Pinstripes Inc. is considering filing for bankruptcy as soon as next week, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Regulators Are Harming UK as a Financial Center, Lawmakers Warn
content: A culture of risk aversion and mission creep among UK financial regulators is undermining trust and placing costly burdens on banks and insurers, an influential group of parliamentarians found.

title: BPCE Is Nearing an Almost €7 Billion Deal for Novo Banco
content: Lone Star Funds has decided to pursue a sale of Portuguese lender Novo Banco SA and has entered into exclusive discussions with French banking group BPCE, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Kenvue Is Considering Selling Some Brands, Reuters Reports
content: Kenvue Inc., the consumer-health business that was part of Johnson & Johnson, is exploring a sale of some of its skin-care and beauty brands, Reuters reported Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: What RFK Jr.’s Changes to CDC Panel Mean for Vaccine Policy
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., secretary of health and human services, appointed eight new members of an expert panel that advises the federal government on immunization policy, including several vocal vaccine critics and one who identifies as an “anti-vaxxer.”

title: Minerva to Take Part in Antitrust Review of Marfrig-BRF Deal
content: Brazilian beef producer Minerva SA has been secured a say in the antitrust review of its rival Marfrig Global Foods SA’s proposed takeover of sausage maker BRF SA after raising concerns about the impact of the transaction on its operations.

title: A Fatal Tesla Crash Shows the Limits of Full Self-Driving
content: As Elon Musk touts robotaxis in Austin, federal regulators are investigating whether Tesla’s system is dangerous even with a human behind the wheel.

title: Air India Plane Crash Draws Attention to Flaps and Landing Gear
content: Video of the Air India jetliner that crashed into a neighborhood points to potential anomalies that aviation safety authorities will examine to understand what caused the accident that killed at least 241 people.

title: New York Real Estate Industry Appeals Broker-Fee Case Ruling
